Ironclad is the #1 contract lifecycle management platform for innovative companies. Every company, in every country, in every industry runs on contracts, but managing these contracts slows companies down and costs them millions of dollars. L’Oréal, Staples, Mastercard, and other leading innovators use Ironclad to collaborate and negotiate on contracts, accelerate contracting while maintaining compliance, and turn contracts into critical carriers of operational business intelligence. It’s the only platform flexible enough to handle every type of contract workflow, whether a sales agreement, an HR agreement or a complex NDA.Ironclad’s innovation and work culture has been recognized by Forbes’ 50 Most Promising AI Companies in 2021, Fortune’s Best Small & Medium Workplaces 2021, Fast Company’s 2020 Best Workplaces for Innovators, Glassdoor’s best Machine Learning startup, Enterprise Tech 30 List, and is backed by leading investors like Accel, Y Combinator, Sequoia, and BOND. For more information, visit www.ironcladapp.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.The Recruiting Team @ IroncladWe work in a highly collaborative environment, and strive to foster a positive, inclusive culture. Recruiting top talent is one of Ironclad's highest priorities, and we are looking for a Recruiting Coordinator to help us deliver a top-notch candidate experience. At Ironclad,* Recruiting Coordinators* are strategic partners to Recruiting and the company at large. As an expert on all things candidate experience, systems, and process, you will be called on to partner across the company to help craft the best possible experience for candidates, interviewers, and hiring partners.Ironclad's values Intent, Empathy, Integrity, and Drive inform everything we do. As a Recruiting Coordinator, you will be an ambassador for our culture and values and will represent them in your interactions with candidates and teammates alike. If these values resonate with you, and you’d like to join us on our mission to build the product that legal teams love, let’s talk!What you'll be doing: Manage interview scheduling & logistics while maintaining a bird's-eye view of daily, weekly, and quarterly scheduling logistics landscapePartner with the Recruiting Team, hiring managers, and teams across Ironclad to provide an exceptional candidate experienceChampion operational excellence, always looking for ways to increase efficiency, improve processes, and help our recruiting process scale through systemsAnticipate & proactively work to solve problems and smooth out any logistical challengesSupport operational goals and programs on the Recruiting Team; we are looking for someone who is interested in digging in and exerting ownership on short & long-term projects in addition to day-to-day candidate scheduling and logistics work.What we are looking for: Administrative, project management, or coordination experience. Experience at a high-growth startup a plus.Excellent judgement & problem solving abilityOutstanding written and verbal communication skillsAble to balance multiple priorities while maintaining an excellent quality of workInterest in joining and contributing to a supportive and collaborative teamThrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment – looking for a high degree of ownershipExperience with and aptitude for learning business software (i.e. Google Apps, Applicant Tracking Systems or similar)Experience with heavy calendar management is a bonusPursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction recordsJob Type: Full-time

JobTitle: Sales Leader, Watson Health – Life Sciences
Content_text:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Location: You will ideally reside in the Northeast, but all other locations will be considered.


Watson Health helps life sciences companies take advantage of Real World Evidence and augmented intelligence with products, services, and solutions that span Development and Commercialization in the pharmaceutical, medical technology/device, and contract research organization (CRO) segments of the industry.

The Sales Leader is an inspiring, client-focused executive responsible for a global team selling IBM Clinical Development and Real World Evidence (e.g., MarketScan) products, consulting services, and solutions. You and your team will be responsible for driving new targeted total portfolio selling across global markets at IBM. You will direct your efforts on continual development and progression of a pipeline of new business opportunities and promote our key Boulders (i.e., Focus, Alignment, and Branding).


For more information about our Life Sciences solutions, please see link below:
https://www.ibm.com/watson-health/solutions/life-sciences-technology

Your Role and Responsibilities
The Sales Leader is an experienced, motivated consultative sales executive responsible for IBM Watson Health sales primarily to key pharmaceutical and CRO accounts. You and your team will be responsible for developing existing and new relationships across key accounts in order to build a pipeline and close opportunities in the high-growth Watson Health Life Sciences segment. You will be responsible for understanding the Cloud, Cognitive/AI, real world evidence and clinical development solutions and offerings available in the Watson Health Life Sciences portfolio.


You will lead the development of account plans and sales strategies for assigned key accounts that bring the full value of the Watson Health portfolio and IBM to our customers. This is an exciting and emerging business, requiring team members to be agile in response to market trends and offering traction. You and your team will work with sales and clinical leadership and delivery to execute on sales strategy, provide voice of the customer feedback to portfolio owners and will be responsible for achieving account/territory revenue/signings targets.

Embrace and implement team diversity, inclusion, and unity to bring forward the best thinking to anticipate and solve our clients real-world problems.

Key Responsibilities:
Focus on portfolio selling
Support and enable sales team in building and executing strategic and tactical sales plans in collaboration with enabling and support groups to identify and shape new Watson Health Life Sciences portfolio opportunities and drive sales.
Effectively engage in complex negotiations with prospective clients and teaming partners around business commitments and details of each proposal.
Deliver sales to meet or exceed annual quota within assigned geography.
Alignment with client needs
Effectively build and maintain relationships internally and externally to understand client business challenges and needs.
Map client challenges and needs to Watson Health Life Sciences portfolio of offerings and deliver compelling presentations, solution demonstrations, proposals and orals that result in new business revenue.
Assume responsibility for the total customer relationship during the sales cycle, working with services counterparts.
Branding
Promote IBM thought leadership and represent Watson Health at industry conferences and meetings.
If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for this position $147,000 to $272,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.
WHLS21

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

8+ years sales experience managing complex software-led solutions sales in a healthcare-related sales role with a demonstrated track record of exceeding business objectives and sales quota.
3+ years’ experience managing a team.
Demonstrated experience selling to senior-level and executive-level decision makers to influence them to position company solutions as the preferred solutions
Track record of achieving and/or exceeding quotas.
Ability to partner, collaborate and influence others in a highly matrixed organization on a cross-functional team to achieve goals.
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

10+ years sales experience managing complex software-led solutions sales in a healthcare-related sales role with a demonstrated track record of exceeding business objectives and sales quota.
7+ years’ experience managing a team.


About Business UnitIBM Watson Health is committed to building smarter health ecosystems. This means simpler processes, better care, faster breakthroughs, and improved experiences for people around the world. We have the essential capabilities necessary to help our clients drive their digital transformations: deep industry expertise, data and analytics, and actionable insights—underpinned by security and trust.
This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.
Your Life @ IBMWhat matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location StatementIBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:


12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).Select educational reimbursement opportunities.Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.
This position is eligible for participation in an IBM sales incentive plan. Actual incentive opportunity will be based on performance and the eligible Target Incentive, as addressed in the applicable plan, all of which is subject to change.


We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

About Expedock

We are reinventing the multi-trillion dollar industry of global container trade using our automation technology. Since our incorporation in early 2020, we've raised millions of dollars from top tier global technology investors and closed contracts with some of the world's biggest logistics businesses like CEVA, Roadrunner Freight, JUSDA, etc. We're growing fast at 30% MoM and we're looking for the best talent to join our team.
Who we need

Do you want to work for company that is helping reinvent one of the world's largest industries that affects 90% of everything around you? Expedock is looking for a talented Account Executive to join our team. This role will report directly to the Chief Executive Officer as a member of the business development team and will work closely with our product and ops teams for improving the product and onboarding customers respectively.

So if you are looking for truly fascinating and inspiring work, where you'll be working alongside an amazing team while having the opportunity to provide insights on top of closing large deals for a company with unlimited growth and earning potential, join us!
Job Description

On a daily basis, the Account Executive will:

Pitch to customers and manage accounts
Handle queries and work with operations to onboard account
Synthesize feedback from customers and log into Hubspot (have the opportunity to provide feedback to product team with gathered data to back it)
Use quantitative data to build a business case
Streamline and iterate on the pitch deck and script
Listen to the customer and adjust presentation + demonstration based off of this
Generate 20-30% of their own leads through their own networking-based efforts


Requirements

Either worked at a logistics technology or logistics company previously


Minimum Qualifications

Deep interest in container freight logistics and technology
Ability to adjust the discussion based off of what the customer says
Ability to hand-off learnings from BD to Ops in written form
Synthesize insights quantitative and quantitative data across a large number of deals
Discipline to capture data and take notes
Worked at a Seed - Series C startup while fulfilling the Sales/BD/Account Executive function


Why Expedock

Disrupting a trillion dollar global trade logistics market with Artificial Intelligence
Competitive compensation package with perks like education allowances
A very dynamic team and fun colleagues to work with
Learning and mentorship from the best startup talent based around the world
Work from home set up with flexible work hours so you have full ownership of your time
Unparalleled professional growth by gaining experience in multiple functions
Opportunity to fast track into leadership positions if you do very well

Generous signing bonus (up to $10,000)

As a Manager, Transportation Strategy at The RealReal (TRR), you will shape the future direction of TRR's logistics organization by working with cross-functional leaders on critical supply chain projects. You will partner with leadership to develop long and short-term strategies impacting multiple areas of the business including supply acquisition, inventory control, final mile delivery and revenue. You will own internal consulting projects from design through execution, summarizing your approach and results for TRR executives and the wider company.

What You Get To Do Every Day

Partner with the executive team and senior leadership to set the strategic direction for the transportation organization
Collaborate with cross-functional partners to develop and drive execution of complex, multi-year, transportation initiatives, prioritizing among many competing opportunities for maximum impact relative to company goals
Conduct sophisticated financial modeling to discover, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets for strategic analysis and research
Support leadership on preparation of executive, board and company-wide presentations, creating polished materials and identifying key takeaways
Work with the head of transportation to build a world class team and working environment

What You Bring To The Role

BS in Business, Supply Chain or related field, MBA degree preferred and a MINIMUM of 4+ years of experience in top tier management consulting, investment banking, private equity, venture capital, corporate strategy or equivalent in a high-growth e-commerce company
Successful track record of working across and multiple functions in an organization and influencing senior leaders
Experience understanding, simplifying and solving complex, ambiguous problems, ideally in a high-growth consumer business
Strong data analysis skills, including the ability to produce, interpret and draw conclusions from data and develop metrics to track results
An ambitious, analytic, entrepreneurial approach coupled with excellent communication skills, pragmatism and comfort with ambiguity

The RealReal is the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, resale luxury goods, with more than 20 million members. With a rigorous authentication process overseen by experts, The RealReal provides a safe and reliable platform for consumers to buy and sell their luxury items. We have hundreds of in-house gemologists, horologists and brand authenticators who inspect thousands of items each day. As a sustainable company, we give new life to pieces by thousands of brands across numerous categories—including women's and men's fashion, fine jewelry and watches, art and home—in support of the circular economy. We make selling effortless with free virtual appointments, in-home pickup, drop-off and direct shipping. We do all of the work for consignors, including authenticating, using AI and machine learning to determine optimal pricing, photographing and listing their items, as well as handling shipping and customer service. At our 13 retail locations, including our eight shoppable stores, customers can sell, meet with our experts and receive free valuations.

The RealReal is committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or Veteran status. We will consider qualified applicants for a position regardless of arrest or conviction records, consistent with legal requirements.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. GHR3728

CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94105 (Financial District/South Beach area)+1 location
Content_text:
About the team:

At Sift we enhance trust and safety in the digital world with our AI driven technology platform. Our products deliver payment protection, ensure content integrity, and protect account defense for businesses around the world. The Machine Learning Platform team exists to enable product teams to construct and operate their production machine learning services as effectively as possible.

The team does this by providing a platform which handles the common needs of the product teams including production system integration, model training, model availability, health and monitoring infrastructure for model serving, and a streamlined model release process.

What you'll do:

As a Senior Engineer on the Machine Learning Platform team you will build tools and processes to manage, improve, and rapidly scale our platform. Specifically, you will:

Design and build tools and processes to make the release of new machine learning models fast, easy, safe, and minimally disruptive.
Participate in architecture discussions to meet the requirement to serve hundreds of machine learning models at thousands of queries per second.
Ensure that our systems can continue to scale rapidly while addressing rapidly evolving product team needs.
Implement scalable, low-latency, high-throughput, fault-tolerant, extensible, and easily maintainable data processing pipelines for both batch and real-time systems.
Motivate, listen and empathize, and help engineers and data scientists to excel.

What would make you a strong fit:

2+ years of professional software development experience or a degree in CS (or a related field) with 2+ years of experience.
Experience building highly available low-latency systems using Java, Scala, C++ or other object-oriented languages.
Experience working with large datasets and best in class data processing technologies for both stream and batch processing, such as Apache Spark, Apache Beam, MapReduce.
Strong debugging, testing, tuning, and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication & collaboration skills, and a belief that team output is more important than individual output.
Self-starter, with a quick learning curve.

Bonus points:

Familiarity with practical challenges in ML systems such as feature extraction and definition, data validation, training, monitoring, and management of features and models.
Practical knowledge of how to build end-to-end ML workflows.
Experience with building an ML feature store for batch and real-time aggregation/serving.
Knowledge of GCP or AWS cloud stack for web services and big data processing.

A little about us:

Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Airbnb, Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.

The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. But it's not just another anti-fraud platform: Sift enables businesses to tailor experiences to each customer according to the risk they pose. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.

Benefits and Perks:

Competitive total compensation package
401k plan
Medical, dental and vision coverage
Wellness reimbursement
Education reimbursement
Flexible time off

Sift is an equal opportunity employer. We make better decisions as a business when we can harness diversity in our experience, data, and background. Sift is working toward building a team that represents the worldwide customers that we serve, inclusive of people from all walks of life who can bring their full selves to work every day.

This document provides transparency around the way in which Sift handles personal data of job applicants: https://sift.com/recruitment-privacy

Hive is the leading provider of cloud-based enterprise AI solutions to power the next wave of intelligent automation. We offer a portfolio of best-in-class deep learning models, built with consensus-validated training data sourced and annotated by our distributed workforce of more than 2 million contributors globally. Hive's APIs enable use cases including automated content moderation, contextual advertising, advertising and sponsorship measurement, document parsing, and more. We process billions of API requests per month for many of the world's largest and most innovative companies.
Hive has raised over $120M in capital from leading investors, including General Catalyst, 8VC, Glynn Capital, Jericho Capital, Bain & Company, Visa Ventures, and others. We have over 170 employees globally in our San Francisco and Delhi offices. Please reach out if you are interested in joining the future of AI!
Data Engineer Role
In order to execute our vision, we need to grow our team of best-in-class data engineers. We are looking for developers who conduct impeccable data practices and implement high quality data infrastructures. We value hard workers who are comfortable improvising solutions to big data challenges while building a system that can stand the test of time. Our ideal candidate has experience building data infrastructure from the ground up, contributes innovative ideas and ingenious implementations to the team, and is capable of planning out scalable, maintainable data pipelines.
As a data engineer, you would at first work primarily on our Hive Media product, taking real-time data from hundreds of television streams and turning them into a combination of real-time and scheduled outputs, especially our signature ads feed. Your work would improve the quality of our results while reducing computational cost and latency. Expect truly novel challenges.
Responsibilities
Writing scheduled Spark pipelines that perform sophisticated queries on the entirety of our datasets
Writing real-time pipelines that execute complex operations on incoming data
Synchronizing large amounts of data between unstructured and structured formats on various data sources
Creating testing and alerting for data pipelines
Building out our data infrastructure and managing dependencies between data pipelines
Defining and implementing metrics that provide visibility into our data quality
Requirements
You have an undergraduate and / or graduate degree in computer science or a similar technical field, with a sound understanding of statistics
You have 1-2 years of industry experience as a data engineer
You have hands-on experience doing ETL and have written data pipelines in either Spark, Hadoop, or similar technologies
You have a sound understanding of SQL
You have worked with data lakes such as S3 or HDFS
You have worked with various databases, such as Postgres, Cassandra, or Redshift before, and understand their pros and cons
You have a working knowledge of the following technologies, or are not afraid of picking them up on the fly: Mesos, Chronos, Marathon, Jenkins
You are fluent in at least one scripting language (preferably NodeJS or python) and one compiled language (such as Scala, Java, or C)
You have great communication skills and ability to work with others
You are a strong team player, with a do-whatever-it-takes attitude
Who We Are
We are a group of ambitious individuals who are passionate about creating a revolutionary AI company. At Hive, you will have a steep learning curve and an opportunity to contribute to one of the fastest growing AI start-ups in San Francisco. The work you do here will have a noticeable and direct impact on the development of the company.
Thank you for your interest in Hive and we hope to meet you soon!

As we accelerate the development of AI, we’re investing in the growth of our team and looking for an Executive Assistant to support our Engineering leadership. You’ll be a strategic partner who will primarily handle calendars and scheduling for a couple of our busiest leaders along with some additional administrative tasks.We’re looking for someone who enjoys streamlining hectic days, anticipating and adapting to the needs of our leaders, and thriving in a fast-moving environment.We value someone who is an extremely strong communicator, self-starter, incredibly organized, flexible, and can maintain strong internal and external relationships.You will:Support 2-3 members of the CTO's engineering leadership teamManage leaders' day-to-day calendars and travel coordination (90%)Act as a primary point of contact for all internal and external stakeholders on matters pertaining to these leadersChampion organization and execution of the leaders' team initiatives and activities (i.e. hackathons, team events)Ideally you'd have:BA / BS degree or equivalent work experienceMinimum 3-5 years of experience supporting busy leadersStrong raw scheduling and coordination skillsEfficient and effective communication skills and ability to interact with internal and external partnersFantastic organizational skills and great follow through on tasksAbout Us: At Scale, we believe that the transition from traditional software to AI is one of the most important shifts of our time. Our mission is to make that happen faster across every industry, and our team is transforming how machine learning can build innovative products. Our products provide access to human-powered data for hundreds of use cases and are used by industry leaders such as Open AI, Lyft, GM, Samsung, Airbnb, NVIDIA, and many more. We’ve recently raised $325 million in Series E funding at a valuation of $7B+ and are expanding our team to accelerate the development of AI applications.We believe that everyone should be able to bring their whole selves to work, which is why we are proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability status, gender identity or Veteran status.We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@scale.com. Please see the United States Department of Labor's EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.Job Type: Full-time

We have a world-class team that is passionate about building amazing technology. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.Job Type: Full-time

JobTitle: SVP, Chief Supply Chain and Procurement Executive
Content_text:
The Senior Vice President, Chief Supply Chain and Procurement Officer is the leader of the organization known as Buy to Pay Shared Services. Buy to Pay Shared Services encompasses the end to end supply chain management processes of strategic sourcing/contract management, procurement/order management, receiving, warehousing, distribution, inventory management, demand forecasting & supply planning, point of use item capture, item master management, vendor management, asset disposal and/or item returns, accounts payable, travel expense reimbursements, including responsibility for the overall customer and supplier experience. Additional support functions directly reporting to this role include driving total health spend optimization maximizing affordability, sustainability (green impact of products), and community impact with every dollar of spend at hand. This role is also the KFH/HP Executive Sponsor, along with the Permanente Federation/PMG Executive Sponsor, of the National Product Council who drives national medical products standards in sourcing/contracting as well as assists in various product utilization standardization efforts in the regions. Buy to Pay Shared Services also has a significant responsibility for ensuring strong financial and asset controls; fraud/waste/abuse monitoring and remediation; as well as ensuring supply continuity at all times and ensuring all supplies/assets are well protected physically. The SVP, CSC&P Officer is the executive responsible, first and foremost, for making sure these services are of the highest quality, delivered with the highest of service orientations and at an affordable cost on behalf of our regional and other customers. The SVP has the program-wide responsibility for reducing and controlling product/service costs and constantly innovating on standard processes to reduce/eliminate variation and optimize value delivered and driving innovation internally and externally to meet increasing customer demands in new ways. These improvements include, but are not limited to, sourcing opportunities for standardization of products and suppliers; consolidation and optimization of supplier relationships including creation of new relationships to increase value, and research/entry into new markets or interests and potential value, inventory turn improvements and supply spend reductions, including utilization improvements, as well as driving electronic transactional processing throughout the process to ensure lowest cost A/P processing at high quality levels and short cycle times. To support this evolution, the role will oversee the investment program to deploy complete digitization of the end to end supply chain by implementing a standard digital/electronic procurement platform all the way from sourcing to the ultimate ordering, distribution and inventory management as well as payment of those supplies and equipment to our suppliers and other partners. Additionally, the leader will establish the infrastructure to ensure continued overall supply chain performance improvement including defining and meeting service level agreements, cost objectives, financial plans, and benchmarks for cost, service and quality that are regularly reviewed internally and compared externally. The SVP is responsible for a wide array of products and services that currently covers over $8B in sourcing/contracting scope, over $11B in procurement/distribution/inventory management and over $20B+ in voucher disbursements through AP as well as tens of thousands of expense reports reviewed and reimbursed annually. The scope of this role has and is expected to continue to expand substantially through the standardization and consolidation of all buy to pay functions throughout the program in the next 3+ years. The latest consolidations have been clinical technology, security, and increasing support for pharmacy and marketing. Future potential includes direct management of pharmacy supply chain contracting and supply chain management functions, IT contract management, marketing contract management and ambulatory/continuum supply chain procurement and management all the way to the home. This position reports to the Executive Vice President – Enterprise Business Services and is a member of the Enterprise Business Services Executive Leadership Team. The position requires the following; Extensive collaboration with Senior leadership groups throughout the Program and the industry on all aspects of supply chain management, clinical understanding of products and care delivery to drive utilization and clinical care pathway changes, and strong IT/digital/mobile technical skills that include threat management mitigation strategies with the continually increasing risk of physical disasters such as pandemics, fires, earthquakes, etc and virtual including cybersecurity. This role is a critical industry leader in driving positive industry change in U.S. supply chain management for the betterment of all care delivery and the ever evolving threats being presented in the US and the world (cyber, pandemics, climate change, social unrest, etc). This SVP is also a participating member of several governance bodies and steering committees across KP ensuring the protection, delivering and improvement of all supply/procured service-related matters or initiatives. Demonstrated expertise as a strategic leader, including but not limited to: excellent strategic and systems-thinking skills; benchmarking industry best practice for supply chain management execution; supply chain and payment risk assessment and mitigation; business case development; proven capability to motivate change; strong ability to develop dynamic, constructive working relationships and partnerships with Senior leadership across KP; willingness to constantly challenge the “status quo”; adeptness at being a relationship driven, consultative team player, able to effectively facilitate processes in a large, complex organization; and strong ability to demonstrate political savvy – able to operate in politically complex situations and remain effective. Must have personal influence and credibility to be able to work within a politically complex process supporting the regional and program office leadership delivery strategy. Must be personally motivated to want to bring innovation and positive change to all aspects of supply chain management at KP. Demonstrated high ethics and integrity; experience handling confidential and sensitive situations or information with ability to exercise a high degree of judgment and discretion while maintaining strict confidentiality as required. Demonstrated capability to communicate effectively with all levels of leadership across the program, up to and including the National Executive Team and the Board of Directors. Demonstrated appreciation of total health and wellness for themselves and the work force. Demonstrated appreciation of a diverse and inclusive work environment. The SVP, Chief Supply Chain and Procurement Officer will ensure that the Buy to Pay teams maximize business value by providing business-savvy thought leadership, analyses and counsel, and as an overall change agent of the organization.
Essential Responsibilities:
Strategic leader and thought partner to EVP, Enterprise Business Services and various executive leadership on integration of all Buy to Pay Shared Services within and across KP.
Develops a strong overall Buy to Pay strategy that supports the overall organizational strategy, performance objectives and customer expectations.
Develops national sourcing strategies to identify product & services that are supportive of program & regional strategies while optimizing affordability, sustainability and community impact of the dollars that are spent.

Lead the supply chain operations team to develop and consistently provide, without interruption, products and services that are needed ensuring no clinician or patient ever goes without.

Defines, drives and monitors performance ensuring continuous improvement on key core supply chain metrics (operational productivity in labor, materials, and transportation and any other variable costs, inventory management improvement in turns and service levels, fill rates and turn time, sourcing effectiveness and savings, environmental impact, community impact of dollars spent, etc.).
Minimizes company risks and maintains compliance for assigned areas of responsibility (e.g. safety, regulatory, environmental, security, fraud/waste/abuse minimization).
Leads the development and implementation of company policies that have enterprise-wide effect; analyzes and evaluates complex policy issues and makes recommendations on actions to be taken; sets direction for governance and control programs to ensure compliance in all aspects of the business.
Develops and sustains distribution and resource management best practices such as systems integration and optimization, inventory control, demand planning and forecasting accuracy, SKU and supplier rationalization/optimization, timely and effective payment disbursements optimization for early payment discounts and overall automation of as many activities and transactions as possible between KP and its suppliers as well as internally across the entire buy to pay end to end process.
Creates and manages the operating budget, including required productivity to deliver sustained 3-5% improvements year on year as well as strategies to transform where needed or opportunities present, ensures maintenance and appropriate capital spend and investments are well planned and executed.
Creates and develops centralized functions to maximize operational efficiencies and risk reduction.
Leads the Buy to Pay Shared Services team to take responsibility for improvements in safety as well as instilling a strong “Speak Up” culture to protect the organization and its employees from risks and to drive innovation and disruption by maximizing solutions/ideas brought forward for the betterment of our processes and maximization of the value provided.

Take an industry leading position in responsibility for the Buy to Pay Total Health Spend Optimization strategy that looks to drive the maximum output possible in terms of affordability of the products & services sourced and procured; the environmental sustainability and carbon footprint impact of the manufacture and usage of those products & services at KP; and the community impact of those products & services by increasing local and supplier diversity spend and engaging other partners to create economic opportunity in the communities we serve (e.g. creating jobs).
Basic Qualifications:
Experience
Minimum of fifteen (15) years of progressive sourcing, supply chain operations, and pay operations experience.
Minimum ten (10) years of experience in strategy leadership roles in creating and transforming supply chain management functions.
Minimum five (5) years designing and implementing procurement, supply, and payment processes with spend responsibility of at least $1 billion.



Education
Requires Bachelor's or master’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Finance, Operations Engineering, Industrial Engineering or related disciplines.



License, Certification, Registration
N/A



Additional Requirements:
Extensive experience leading large, diverse, and geographically dispersed teams in a multi-disciplinary way.
Healthcare-related experience preferred (manufacturing, pharmaceutical, medical device, distribution and/or direct healthcare provider experience etc.) but strong supply chain and related technologies background required.
Experience with deep data analyses and advanced analytics (e.g. predictive, prescriptive) along with understanding of current industry trends (e.g. blockchain, machine learning, robotics, AI, 3D printing, drones, last mile delivery mechanisms)required.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with building alliances, and mergers & acquisitions is preferred.
MBA or comparable degree strongly preferred.

JobTitle: Staff Writer, Tech Platforms and Power
CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94107 (South of Market area)•Remote
Content_text:
WIRED is where tomorrow is realized. It is the essential source of information and ideas that make sense of a world in constant transformation. The WIRED conversation illuminates how technology is changing every aspect of our lives—from culture to business, science to design. The breakthroughs and innovations that we uncover lead to new ways of thinking, new connections, and new industries. WIRED reaches more than 30 million people each month through WIRED.com, our digital edition, the magazine, social media, and live events.
Job Description
The largest technology companies exercise world-changing market power. WIRED seeks a writer to cover these companies, with a particular focus on Facebook, Amazon, Google and Apple.
This role spans both the business/economic and social impacts of these companies’ power, and your underlying question will always be how this power is changing the world, both for better and for worse. You’ll track these companies as they expand into new markets and business lines, exploring the potential of new products and economic opportunities they create, and reporting on the strategies they use to outmaneuver or quash competitors and influence regulators, politicians, and the public. You may also cover them through the stories of their smaller rivals, of companies that depend on their economic ecosystems—such as sellers on Amazon or app developers for Apple—or of regulators or activists who tussle with them. You may look at how they tackle issues like misinformation and political manipulation, how they use their platforms to try to promote positive change such as voter participation or public health, and how their founders or top executives use their wealth philanthropically. And you may look at their influence around the world, particularly how they wield it in smaller countries or those with authoritarian regimes.
You should have some experience of covering Big Tech, and be excited by the prospect of storytelling across a wide range of formats, from breaking news and sharp, timely analysis to deeply reported narrative features. (If you’ve never written one of those, don’t worry: WIRED has some of the finest longform editors in the business, and we love helping people who’ve got reporting chops and raw writing talent grow into gifted storytellers.) You may also have the opportunity to take part in our podcasts, video series, or live events.
You’ll work with our experienced business editor, Scott Thurm, who will help you find avenues to focus on within this broad beat and develop lines of investigation that can yield scoops and original ideas. You’ll be part of a growing and increasingly global newsroom of smart, kind, nerdy, and well-informed colleagues who are always brimming with ideas and eager to help each other out. In particular, in this job you can expect to collaborate with folks such as Gilad Edelman, who covers tech policy and regulation; Cecilia D’Anastasio, our chief writer on the games industry, Tom Simonite, Will Knight, and Khari Johnson, our AI team; and Matt Burgess, who covers privacy and regulation in Europe.
Pandemic permitting, you can work out of WIRED’s offices in San Francisco, New York or London, but if you live in the United States or UK outside those cities you can be based remotely.
Primary responsibilities:
Pitch, report, and write stories on platforms and power beat, balancing news and analysis of the most important stories with original investigative reporting, features, or essays
Collaborate with other members of the business and national affairs teams in shaping the WIRED coverage agenda for Big Tech-related issues
Collaborate with audio, video, events, and social media teams as needed to develop ways of telling stories on other platforms
Skills and qualifications:
Experience as a technology or business journalist with a track record of original reporting on Big Tech
A clear, engaging, jargon-free writing style
What happens next?
If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply below, and we will review your application as soon as possible. You can update your resume or upload a cover letter at any time by accessing your candidate profile.
Condé Nast is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.

The RealReal is the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, resale luxury goods, with more than 20 million members. With a rigorous authentication process overseen by experts, The RealReal provides a safe and reliable platform for consumers to buy and sell their luxury items. We have hundreds of in-house gemologists, horologists and brand authenticators who inspect thousands of items each day. As a sustainable company, we give new life to pieces by thousands of brands across numerous categories—including women's and men's fashion, fine jewelry and watches, art and home—in support of the circular economy. We make selling effortless with free virtual appointments, in-home pickup, drop-off and direct shipping. We do all of the work for consignors, including authenticating, using AI and machine learning to determine optimal pricing, photographing and listing their items, as well as handling shipping and customer service. At our 13 retail locations, including our eight shoppable stores, customers can sell, meet with our experts and receive free valuations.

The RealReal is committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or Veteran status. We will consider qualified applicants for a position regardless of arrest or conviction records, consistent with legal requirements. GHR3634

Hive is the leading provider of cloud-based enterprise AI solutions to power the next wave of intelligent automation. We offer a portfolio of best-in-class deep learning models, built with consensus-validated training data sourced and annotated by our distributed workforce of more than 2 million contributors globally. Hive's APIs enable use cases including automated content moderation, contextual advertising, advertising and sponsorship measurement, document parsing, and more. We process billions of API requests per month for many of the world's largest and most innovative companies.
Hive has raised over $120M in capital from leading investors, including General Catalyst, 8VC, Glynn Capital, Jericho Capital, Bain & Company, Visa Ventures, and others. We have over 170 employees globally in our San Francisco and Delhi offices. Please reach out if you are interested in joining the future of AI!
Product Analyst, Media Analytics
As a Product Analyst on the Hive Media team, you will be a key member of a growing product team and will own business-crucial quantitative analysis. You are a self-starter who works efficiently and is capable of working with engineering to automate analysis to focus on high-value-add projects. As a Product Analyst, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings the next. You are well versed in verbal, written, and visualization-driven communications. You will work to effectively turn business questions into data analysis, and provide meaningful data backed recommendations to our business teams and clients.
Responsibilities
Develop product quality and performance KPIs and track over time via dashboarding and automated reporting
Analyze high volume data using SQL and effectively communicate findings
Collaborate with Business Development to provide data-backed insights to our partners and clients
Develop and own product processes. Collaborate with Engineering and QA teams to execute on process-driven objectives.
Requirements
You have a bachelor’s or graduate degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics
You have 1-3 years of work experience in an analytics focused role at a technology or technology consulting firm
You have experience scripting with SQL, extracting large sets of data, and designing ETL flows. You also have experience with a statistical or scripting language such as Python, Node JS, R, or MATLAB
You have experience in an interdisciplinary/cross-functional field. Added points for enterprise-technology, SaaS, client facing, or start-up experience
You have distinctive problem-solving skills and impeccable business judgment. You know how to translate analysis results into business recommendations, and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills
You have experience articulating product and business questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and conducting business analysis to arrive at an answer. You are able to collaboratively structure and define analysis with initially ambiguous requirements
Who We Are
We are a group of ambitious individuals who are passionate about creating a revolutionary AI company. At Hive, you will have a steep learning curve and an opportunity to contribute to one of the fastest growing AI start-ups in San Francisco. The work you do here will have a noticeable and direct impact on the development of the company.
Thank you for your interest in Hive and we hope to meet you soon!

About us:
Mythic has developed a unified hardware and software platform featuring its unique Mythic Analog Compute Engine (Mythic ACE™) to deliver revolutionary power, cost, and performance that shatters digital barriers preventing AI innovation at the edge. The Mythic Analog Matrix Processor (Mythic AMP™) makes it much easier and more affordable to deploy powerful AI solutions, from the data center to the edge device. The company has raised over $165.2 million to date, has over 120 employees, and has offices in Redwood City, CA, and Austin, TX.
About the role:
Mythic is enabling the future of AI by building an analog-compute hardware platform that is 100-1000x more efficient than conventional all-digital systems. The technology developed at Mythic will pave the way for bringing cutting-edge solutions into edge applications.
This Mythic vision comes together in the AI Engineering team. We use our expertise to adapt deep learning models to Mythic's unique hardware, provide guidance to the marketing and product teams, and implement novel methodologies to train neural networks for reduced precision and real-world environments. If you are excited about implementing novel algorithms and neural network architectures to optimize AI for the world's first analog supercomputer, this role is for you.
This role is not location-specific. However, candidates will be expected to keep working hours in line with either Pacific or Central Time.
This team significantly impacts Mythic by:
Expanding Mythic's portfolio of computer vision models
Optimizing network architectures to take maximum advantage of Mythic's high performance technology
Improving the robustness and generalizability of analog computer neural networks in the real world
Making it easier for new users to take advantage of Mythic's computer vision platform
Here's what you will do:
Train and deploy neural networks for machine vision to showcase the strengths of mixed-signal computation
Work closely with the product and BD teams to understand customer needs and build working products to meet those needs
Adapt and optimize customers' deep learning models to Mythic's hardware
Develop and maintain high-quality code bases
Stay up-to-date with literature for neural network architectures
Here's the background we hope you have:
3+ years of experience in industry training neural networks for computer vision
Experience training neural networks with reduced precision or other hardware-based limitations. Such as quantization-aware training, pruning, distillation, and transfer learning
Experience working in an agile/scrum environment that follows CI/CD and other software engineering practices
Experience documenting project plans and progress, providing high-level status updates to management, organizing stand-ups and other meetings
Comfortable writing optimized+clean Python and PyTorch code
The following would be nice to have, but is not required:
Previous exposure to analog and mixed-signal circuits
Experience working at startups
Experience creating new datasets and eliminating biases
Experience working with neural network interpretability, applied optimization, and/or statistical learning
Experience with other Neural Network frameworks (Tensorflow, Caffe, ONNX)
Familiarity with C++, Cython, and/or CUDA
Experience with edge deployment pipelines: e.g. gstreamer or opencv
Published code portfolio
#LI-Remote
At Mythic, we pride ourselves in creating a culture where all employees feel valued and appreciated for the diverse perspectives and backgrounds they bring to the team. We aim to hire smart people, give them the resources they need to do their job well, and then leave the rest up to them. We celebrate individual differences and encourage people to be comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. At the end of the day, we are committed to building a diverse workforce where everyone belongs.
Mythic is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. It ensures equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

About Kelvin

Kelvin is a software company dedicated to unlocking the power of domain knowledge and AI to create a more efficient, safe and sustainable industrial automation industry. The Kelvin Intelligent Control Software Platform enables our customers to transform their legacy operations into self-optimizing systems using AI-driven intelligent automation applications. Our team is distributed around the world with offices in San Francisco, Colorado, Australia, and Portugal.

How we work

Kelvin embraced the remote spirit, meaning you get to create your own schedule no matter the timezone. You’ll be joining a team of engineers, data scientists, designers, product managers, project managers, operations and finance, around the globe.


The Job

We are looking for a Director of Product Marketing to join our team and take an active role in creating, implementing, and overseeing marketing activities in the Industrial IoT and Industry 4.0 marketplace. Your role is to synthesize market, consumer, product, and competitive inputs driving the highest possible revenue for the business. You will work directly with the Engineering and Product teams to develop product pricing, product strategy, and analysis, product positioning to target consumers, sales messaging development, competitive analysis, and product differentiation, among others. The role is deeply collaborative and incorporates some sales enablement activities, for example, the creation of sales tools, communication, and training.

The ideal candidate has excellent writing and oral communication skills, including a technical background to take complex technical ideas into sales enablement content and frameworks.
At Kelvin your main responsibilities will be:

Work directly with the Product and Engineering teams to ensure Kelvin’s products and services resonate with the target market and translate complex technical concepts into easy-to-understand frameworks
Generate content that resonates inside and outside the Kelvin
Interface directly with clients and report back to product management
Monitor the competitive landscape and marketing trends
Work with the product team to develop the sales enablement content to support new messaging, product launches, and other marketing campaigns
Plan product launches for all new products and releases and coordinate with Product Management, Marketing, and Sales to execute a successful launch
Conduct regular, in-depth competitive analysis to ensure the marketing and sales teams are aware of new developments to speak more credibly with prospects
Develop all Sales tools, including value propositions, competitive positioning, launch scripts, customer proof points, ROI metrics, and calculations
Develop thought leadership for use in bylines, corporate messaging, and other content
Work with internal stakeholders to formulate the company story and craft messaging in response to new competitive positioning, product releases, etc


Qualifications

Deep understanding of technical concepts, especially as it relates to industrial IoT and Industry 4.0
Effectively align with Product and Engineering to ensure a successful and integrated product launch, champion new product features, and enliven product solutions
Lead post-launch activities to ensure that the product constantly grows in the market; and that the product is continuously moving from awareness to adoption in new market segments
Build and implement a strategic plan to target consumers by developing sales messaging, competitive analysis, and product differentiation, among others
Develop various product marketing initiatives, including consumer case studies, product videos, website content, and much more
Establish product positioning and messaging and endeavor to understand the consumers’ needs and behaviors
Work with Product Management and Sales teams in the formulation of optimal pricing strategies, models, product education approach, product solution creation, and execution of competitive counter-tactics


Benefits

Kelvin believes in putting its employees first. We offer a generous compensation package that includes medical, dental, vision, FSA, unlimited PTO, and 401(k) benefits with a match.


Equal Opportunity Employer

Kelvin is deeply committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We believe that different backgrounds and life experiences make our team better. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.

JobTitle: newPostdoctoral Fellow - Scientific Machine Learning in Clinica...
CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA (Mission Bay area)+3 locations
Content_text:
THE POSITION
We have an opening for a postdoctoral fellow or artificial intelligence (AI) residency in the Modeling & Simulation group within the Clinical Pharmacology department at Genentech. We are looking for a talented and innovative individual wishing to apply their expertise to solve concrete problems in clinical drug development. The project is to tackle the difficult problem of identifying combination therapies that will provide durable benefit to a large number of cancer patients. The idea is to combine an existing mechanistic model of the biology with a deep-learning framework that will be mutually beneficial to one another, allowing to assess and identify novel groundbreaking anti-cancer treatment combinations. During this residency, you will interact and learn from some of the most talented scientists in their field of Clinical Pharmacology, Clinical Development, Biomarker Development, Biological Research, as well as with AI and modeling scientists. This research is expected to lead to influential publications in top-tier journals. It is a challenging role, but it is offering tremendous prospects for learning, development and impact. This position is for 2 to 4 years and is opened internationally.
In addition to building a mechanistically-driven deep learning framework for the comprehensive assessment of anti-cancer combinations, the candidate will be responsible for compiling and processing all data necessary for the project, set up the computational framework required for the project, work closely with other modeling and AI scientists and benefit from each other expertise, learn the biology and the clinical aspects of anti-cancer treatments as needed and collaborate with non-modeling scientists from other departments.
Other responsibilities include:
Present results in non-technical terms at cross-functional teams, department meeting, and/or review committees.
Summarize results in posters for presentation in internal or external conferences.
Write manuscripts summarizing the accomplished work.
Adapt and thrive in an interactive, team-oriented culture.
Requirements:
Ph.D. in physics, applied mathematics, statistics, computer or computational sciences, or in an engineering field such as biomedical informatics, or a related discipline
Experience with developing deep-learning systems is required.
Experience or knowledge with neural network-based ODE systems, such as neural-ODE or Universal Differential Equations is preferred.
Experience with statistical modeling and machine learning analysis is required.
Experience with ODE-based, stochastic, or agent-based systems modeling would be considered a plus (especially of biological systems).
Proficiency in scientific computing programming using Matlab, Mathematica, Julia, R or Python is required. Experience with Matlab would be considered a plus.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, enthusiasm to contribute in a multidisciplinary environment, driven by challenges, scientific curiosity.
Publication record of substantial/influential work is expected.
Creative, resourceful, and eager to learn and discover are other qualities we are looking for.
Relocation benefits are available for this job posting.
For information about Vincent's Lemaire lab at Genentech, please go to:
https://www.gene.com/scientists/our-scientists/vincent-lemaire
For information about the Postdoctoral Program at Genentech, please go to:
https://www.gene.com/careers/university-and-early-career/postdocs
