Are you excited about Precision Medicine? Would you like have an impact on patients’ lives and contribute to eliminate cancer as a cause of death? If so then join us!
We’re investing like never before in our people, in growth, and in new diagnostic techniques and technologies. There are opportunities at every turn, with a variety and breadth that is uncommon to find and an industry-leading pipeline in oncology. Scientists at AstraZeneca are working every day to turn science fiction into science fact. Our ambition - to develop innovative, targeted medicines for every patient that needs them - and to match those treatments to patients most likely to benefit from them – is now a reality. This approach, known as Precision Medicine, is based on those individual characteristics that make some patients respond to treatment better than others. We use this knowledge to develop diagnostic tests that doctors can use to help prescribe the best treatment for each patient. Indeed, it’s now become common practice for patients with cancer to be offered such diagnostic tests before their treatment plan is agreed.
The AstraZeneca Companion Diagnostics Unit within the Precision Medicine and Biosamples function drives scientific leadership through the delivery of innovative companion diagnostics enabling our oncology ambition to transform the lives of patients living with cancer, and ultimately eliminate cancer as a cause of death.
We do this by:
Leading the development of diagnostics across AstraZeneca’s early and late stage oncology portfolios through close collaborations with our external diagnostic partners.
Leading the development and implementation of patient selection strategies to deliver companion diagnostics programs in support of our business priorities.
Leading companion diagnostic regulatory interactions to secure companion diagnostic approvals in major markets
Collaborate across AstraZeneca with colleagues in multiple Clinical functions plus commercial to help drive market uptake.
Developing strategies for early cancer detection, near patient testing and implementing testing options for minimal residual disease and early treatment interventions.
Utilising artificial intelligence diagnostic solutions and seeing software as a medical device.
Developing specific disease area strategies (e.g. lung cancer, breast cancer or hematological malignancies) and new diagnostic modalities.
Collaborating closely with fellow pharma companies on joint assets.
Join this fantastic, collaborative team and be part of our success; we have already delivered over 50 innovative/impactful companion/complementary oncology diagnostic approvals across the major markets of the US, EU, Japan and China since 2014 and we need you to help us take the next steps in patient-centric diagnostic development.
If this sounds like the type of organisation where you would like to grow your career and make a real difference to patients then we would like to hear from you.
We are currently looking for a Director.
Typical Accountabilities, what you will be doing:
As a Director, you’ll be a member of the Oncology Companion Diagnostic Unit (CDU). Your objective will be to ensure that innovative companion diagnostic tests or equivalent segmentation tools are delivered to our oncology drug projects. Drawing on world-class expertise and personal experience in companion diagnostic development you will ensure the adoption of Precision Medicine approaches within the AstraZeneca business. You will also provide leadership and support to a pool of fellow diagnostic experts to ensure delivery of a diagnostic strategy.
As an associate director this will entail developing and implementing the diagnostic strategy agreed by the respective development teams, and planning and leading Precision Medicine activities from a technical, financial, risk, regulatory, IP and partnering perspective. You will work collaboratively with colleagues at all levels in the Precision Medicine function to deliver this expertise to drug project teams.
Your role will also involve contributing to the personal development of project team members. Providing expert advice on strategic and innovative Precision Medicine approaches and companion diagnostic developments to development teams, you’ll be instrumental in ensuring that we adopt world-class practice in the field.
Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience:
Essential:
Bachelor Degree
Experience of companion diagnostic tests or patient biomarker/segmentation tools in clinical development.
Experience of Precision Medicine approaches and diagnostic development within the relevant therapeutic area.
Effective communication, stakeholder, influencing skills and programme management.
Significant understanding of the functions involved in companion diagnostic development and how they contribute to achieving successful diagnostic submissions and approvals
Desirable :
Ph.D. in relevant subject
Significant previous experience in a similar role in different companies.
Delivery of companion diagnostics, regulatory interactions and commercialisation.
High quality scientific expertise in the field of Precision Medicine or relevant therapeutic area as evidenced by publications.
AstraZeneca has taken critical steps to protecting colleagues, loved ones, and patients from COVID-19 and its variants. COVID-19 vaccination is required for all US employees, and weekly PCR COVID-19 testing is required for those who are unvaccinated or have an approved accommodation.

About OpenAIOpenAI is an AI research and deployment company dedicated to ensuring that general-purpose artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity. AI is an extremely powerful tool that must be created with safety and human needs at its core. OpenAI is dedicated to putting that alignment of interests first — ahead of profit.To achieve our mission, we must encompass and value the many different perspectives, voices, and experiences that form the full spectrum of humanity. Our investment in diversity, equity, and inclusion is ongoing, executed through a wide range of initiatives, and championed and supported by leadership.At OpenAI, we believe artificial intelligence has the potential to help people solve immense global challenges, and we want the upside of AI to be widely shared. Join us in shaping the future of technology.About the teamThe Applied team safely brings OpenAI's technology to the world. We released the GPT-3 API and Codex, which powers GitHub's Copilot. There's a lot more on the immediate horizon.Our customers build fast-growing businesses around our APIs, which power product features that were never before possible. We simultaneously ensure that our powerful tools are used responsibly. Safe deployment is more important to us than unfettered growth.The Engineering team wraps a massive fleet of GPUs in scalable, robust, infrastructure powered by Kubernetes, Go, Python, Terraform, Kafka, Postgres, and Snowflake.We are looking for an experienced engineering manager to help grow the team, set clear direction for the future, and build a diverse and inclusive culture.In this role, you will: Help set a vision for your team and Applied as a whole, and then ensure we efficiently achieve our goalsEnsure your team of engineers are performing at their peak, are growing, and advancing in their careersCreate a diverse and inclusive culture that makes all feel welcome while enabling radical candor and the challenging of group thinkWork with Product Managers, your Tech Lead, and leadership to ensure projects are on track, your team is utilized effectively, and core engineering needs are continuously addressedProvide technical direction and mentorship along with your Tech Lead.You might thrive in this role if you: Have at least 5 years of experience as an individual contributor engineer and at least 2 years of experience leading several other engineersAre deeply thoughtful about culture, DEI, and team structure with a track record of improving these areasCan dive into our codebase, intuit how it works, and be able to have a strong intuition for suggestions that will lead us to a stronger engineering position.Experience creating and dismantling engineering processes with a strong experience-driven intuition for crafting minimal, simple processesExperience closing competitive candidates for their team and the ability to craft and convey compelling visions of the futureVery high emotional intelligence and deeply empathetic personality. A strong ability to read between the lines and genuinely connect with a diverse range of fellow colleaguesA voracious and intrinsic desire to learn and fill in missing skills. An equally strong talent for sharing that information clearly and concisely with othersAre comfortable with ambiguity and rapidly changing conditions. You view changes as an opportunity to add structure and order when necessaryExperience in Machine Learning techniques is a plus, but not required*Benefits and Perks*Medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your familyMental health and wellness support401(k) plan with 4% matchingUnlimited time off and 18+ company holidays per yearPaid parental leave (20 weeks) and family-planning supportAnnual learning & development stipend ($1,500 per year)We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. This position is subject to a background check for any convictions directly related to its duties and responsibilities. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the candidate. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodations via accommodation@openai.com.Job Type: Full-time

The RoleThe Lucidworks Revenue team is looking for a Senior Demo Engineer to lead and design world-class demos and prototypes that accelerate Lucidworks’ sales and differentiate our products from our competitors. You will collaborate with Sales Engineering, Sales Leadership, and Product to customize and extend proof of concepts, build and maintain cost-effective, reusable assets, and work cross-functionally to influence the direction of the product.This role will report to the VP or Director of Sales Engineering.The Lucidworks Revenue team is a growing organization, with opportunities for growth, management, and leadership.*About You*We are looking for an individual who is analytical, energetic, and passionate about creating engaging experiences for our customers. You are a driven, self-reliant individual with keen attention to detail who is eager to lead and work within a team. You know the right questions to ask and aren’t afraid to ask for help when needed. You should be technically broad with some knowledge across the full stack (UI, Application, Infrastructure) and thrive in a fast-paced, revenue-focused environment.You will: Collaborate with Sales Engineering to develop demos and proof of concepts, with a keen eye for customer needsIncrease sales success by improving and innovating on demo qualityActively own team software infrastructure or systems and define their long term architecture, health, and growthWork cross-functionally when new products and features are released and solve challenges and roadblocks to ensure demos are field readyStay up-to-date on competing offerings in the market and build proposals on how to innovate in areas of high opportunityCreate opportunities to improve our standards, tooling, and processesYou have: 4+ years of application development, preferably across the entire software stackStrong foundation in computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrievalExperience in Kubernetes in development or infrastructure ownershipExperience writing understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainabilityStrong communicator; explaining or documenting complex technical concepts to others is no problem for youAn understanding of the global market impact of search as a technologyPassionate about AI, machine-learning and the architectural concepts around scaling AI in search in a consumer settingLove for building new products and problem solvingSelf-awareness, a collaborative approach, and empathy*Bonus points if you have: *Knowledge of Lucidworks FusionExperience with SolrExperience with GCPPrior DevOps experienceCOVID Vaccination: Lucidworks policy requires employees to be vaccinated before they visit an office.We are a remote first company but in certain positions where office attendance is deemed to be essential to the role, offers of employment shall be conditional upon proof of vaccination or exception.*Please note that at this time Lucidworks is unable to sponsor US employment authorization (both new and transfer).**About Lucidworks*Lucidworks is leading digital transformation for some of the world's biggest retailers, financial services firms, manufacturers, and healthcare providers. By fusing the power of search and AI, Lucidworks creates connected experiences for shopping, work, research, and support. Brands like Lenovo, Reddit, and Red Hat rely on Lucidworks to power personalized experiences that delight customers and empower employees.Fusion is our cloud-native, ML-powered search platform that integrates open-source projects Spark and Solr with our proprietary code for query intent prediction, low latency search, hyper-personalization and smart app creation. Our products include applications that run on the Fusion platform including Predictive Merchandiser, which helps ecommerce teams harness the power of ML to improve ecommerce conversion and Smart Answers, which enhances chatbots and virtual assistants with natural language processing and deep learning. We believe in building a team to deliver these products that make searching for insights a uniquely personal experience for a worldwide community of users.Lucidworks believes in the power of diversity and inclusion to help us do our best work. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and welcome talent across a full range of backgrounds, orientation, origin, and identity in an inclusive and non-discriminatory way. Applicants receive consideration based on the relevant talents, skills, and experiences they offer to our company. Thank you for your interest and we look forward to learning more about you.Job Type: Full-time

POSITION SUMMARY
As Content Designer, you will help establish and maintain the vision for toys, games, books and other educational products through close collaboration with all of LeapFrog's internal and external production teams. You will help guide talented development teams across the entire LeapFrog portfolio of products. Tasks include spearheading the creative process, developing initial concepts, working with educational advisors to insure seamless curricular integration, providing clear, actionable feedback to external partners, evaluating deliverables, plus tracking and reporting progress to all other departments.
Your skills include a high attention to detail, the ability to react assuredly to changing business parameters, and shipping top-quality projects on time and on budget. You'll need past experience designing successful creative, innovative products.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Drive the content creation process through all phases, from concept, presentation, implementation, tuning and release
Design and maintain all game mechanics, characters, storylines, asset lists, AI behaviors, text and dialogue with comprehensive documentation
Write and edit scripts for VO for LeapFrog products
Work closely with ID and producer teams to generate new toy concepts and improve products already in production
Assist in the design of the UX, through UI screens, support screens, game levels, and reward systems
Design curricular elements of the content experience (with support and input from educational advisors)
Track and review deliverables
Communicate with the team and other departments
Contribute to current and future LeapFrog products
Provide help to designers and producers on an as needed basis
Keep an eye out for new trends in consumer electronics
Search for new ways to improve our processes
Collaborate through communication and teamwork with co-workers, management, clients and others in a courteous, and professional manner
Exercise sound business judgment
Work independently and collaboratively and manage time effectively in order to meet changing deadlines and priorities
Treat all employees, guests and customers and others affiliated with our business with respect
Conform and abide by all laws, regulations, policies, work procedures, instructions and VTech's Rules of Engagement
Conform with all safety rules and use all appropriate safety equipment
Other duties as needed or required
POSITION SKILLS
A passion for creating high-quality, innovative products
Deep knowledge and understanding of recent trends in all areas of entertainment and electronics
An eye to future technologies that can be applied to future LeapFrog products
Strong creative and editorial skills for developing original and licensed products
Ability to understand technical parameters as they apply to design implementations
Works well within cross-functional teams, including hardware, ID, education, and marketing
Ability to work with both internal and external development teams
Knowledge of contemporary children's educational entertainment and content in all areas including toys, books and screen-based content preferred
Knowledge of common electronic entertainment industry practices
Outstanding attention to detail
Excellent organization and communication skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office, and knowledge of common database tracking software tools, like Jira, Test Track Pro, and Basecamp
Knowledge of other multi-media software a bonus
Art and/or programming skills are preferred
EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
A minimum of 4 years of progressively responsible experience in the area of Content Design for toys, games, books or other applicable field
Design experience, preferably as lead, on 4 or more published projects including licensed and original IP
Bachelor's degree in Game Development, Toy Design or a related field; or any combination of experience and education that provides the necessary skills, knowledge and ability to perform assigned tasks
Masters degree is desirable
MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITY
This position has no management/supervisory responsibilities.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Duties are primarily performed in an office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.
MENTAL AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS
Mental activities required by this job include constant decision making, discretion, problem analysis and resolution, independent judgment and independent action. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
The employee must read, speak, write and understand the English language. The employee frequently is required to sit, stand, walk, and use their hands to handle and grasp, reach with hands and arms. The employee may be occasionally required to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl.
The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds [50 pounds if travel]. Specific vision abilities may be required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus with or without the use of prescription eyeglasses.
POSITION TYPE/EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK
This is a full-time position, 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday. Core hours will be set between employee and manager and will be based on business needs. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.
TRAVEL
Travel is primarily local during the business day, although out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected 5% of the time.
OTHER DUTIES
This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. The responsibilities and expectations outlined in this position description are not to be construed as exclusive or all-inclusive. Duties and responsibilities may be added, deleted, or changed at any time at the discretion of management, formally or informally, with or without notice.
VTech and LeapFrog are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers and are committed to fostering a diverse environment. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you are unable or limited in your ability to access job openings or apply for a job on this site as a result of a disability, you may request reasonable accommodations by contacting disability_accommodations@leapfrog.com. General employment-related inquiries should not be submitted to this email.LeapFrog does not accept unsolicited resumes from candidates or from recruiting agencies. Unsolicited resumes should not be submitted to our website or to any LeapFrog employee. LeapFrog will not pay fees to any recruiting agency and will not be responsible for agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes.

About RIOS
RIOS is a technology company helping global customers automate their factories, warehouses, and supply chain operations by deploying a new class of AI-powered and dexterous robots. RIOS robots handle hard-to-automate tasks, typically requiring human-level dexterity, in unstructured environments. RIOS is headquartered in Palo Alto, CA and has a pilot facility in San Carlos, CA. More information is available at www.rios.ai
The Role
RIOS is looking for a team of inquisitive and creative engineers who can help construct advanced systems for object manipulation. A familiarity with hypothesis testing and experimental design is a requirement, along with the ability to prototype models that can scale.
Technical attributes of candidates may include:
M.S. / Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Robotics, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Data Science, Statistics or related field
Experience with C++, Python, CUDA and/or OpenCV
Experience with ML/DL frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Theano, Keras, Scikit Learn etc.
Experience with Reinforcement Learning frameworks: OpenAI Baselines, RLlib, Unity ML Agents, DeepMind Lab, etc.
Experience with distributed DL: Ray, Horovod, etc.
Experience with computer vision algorithms (detection, segmentation)
Experience working with 3D depth images and point clouds
Ability to implement algorithms from literature
Familiarity with State-of-the-Art algorithms and real-world performance
Familiarity with Robot Operating System (ROS)
Attention to details such as documentation, version control and reproducibility
Perks
Competitive salary package & Stock options for every employee
Healthcare + dental + vision insurance plans401(k) plan
Free lunch
Flexible time off & paid holidays
Social events + happy hours + team parties

The SVP of Data and Analytics will be accountable for leading and collaborating with senior business and medical leaders across KP in defining and aligning on a compelling vision and strategic direction for data and analytics, identifying and prioritizing investments to strengthen KP’s data architecture foundation and analytical capabilities, and overseeing successful delivery of multiple complex investment programs. The position will report directly to the CITO and will be a member of the IT Executive Committee (ITEC).
The applicant must have a proven track record of designing and delivering innovative data and analytics strategies for large and complex institutions.
This position interacts with a wide expanse of key senior relationships across Kaiser Permanente. The SVP must demonstrate strong executive presence and leadership, strategic mindset that sets an aggressive but credible vision, organizational savvy to navigate and manage ambiguous and complex scenarios, deep technical knowledge of existing and emerging technologies and ability to orchestrate and marshal resources (people, business relationships, funding, and vendors) to get things done.
Essential Responsibilities:
Data and Analytics
Set the strategy, roadmap and key milestones to define a strong data echo-system which delivers business value by innovative use of data, including:

Data architecture
Data Integration and Analytics Solutions and Services
Analytics platforms, tools, architecture and engineering
Management of Data and Analytics Products
Data Stewardship, Data Analytics and Enablement, Data Science (AI / ML), and Data / AI Operations





Provide leadership and oversight on teams that work on large data sets of structured, semi-structured and unstructured data to discover data insights and collaborate with business partners to deliver business value through these insights
Leverage stakeholders input (clinicians, physicians, business leaders and executives) and experiences to execute a data and analytics strategy to meet those needs
Lead and govern teams to develop data analysis solutions based on predictive, behavioral or other models via statistical analysts and use of relevant modeling techniques.
Steward business cases through KP’s investment governance processes, Portfolio Approval Councils (PAC), the Capital Approval Committee (CAC) and the Board of Directors (BOD), as appropriate
Ensure benefits realization and lessons learned are documented and imbedded into subsequent planning cycles and activities
Organization Leadership
Develop a high performing leadership team by providing strategic leadership and vision, and professional development of technical and business management staff
Design, recruit and maintain organizational structures to support on time and on budget delivery for data and analytics programs
Develop yearly goals and objectives and work to develop new leaders on an ongoing basis
Develop communication approaches and strategies, determines presentation focus and emphasis, and prepares board-level presentations to support data and analytics strategic objectives
Effectively partner with business partners as their business evolves and become a trusted planner, partner and advocate for their data and analytics needs
Basic Qualifications:
Experience
Minimum of 10 years of IT, Healthcare or related experience
Minimum of 10 years of data and analytics experience



Education
Bachelor’s Degree; (e.g., MS or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative disciplines)



License, Certification, Registration
N/A



Additional Requirements:
Experience with managing an extensive budget and any associated risk for large programs
Extensive experience solving data and analytics problems using quantitative approaches and a proven passion for generating insights from data
Experience in leading teams to manipulate and analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
Strong knowledge of statistical methods generally, and particularly in the areas of modeling and business analytics
Demonstrate ability to analyze and define business problems, provide predictive analysis, and identify appropriate business insights and solutions
Ability to lead and prioritize business case development with measurable outcomes
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including collaboration, facilitation and negotiation.
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.
An ability to engage with vendors, if necessary, to evaluate third party solutions.
Demonstrate ability to 1) effectively work in an ambiguous environment, 2) effectively work in a cross-team environment and 3) succeed in a complex and dynamic work environment



Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in designing data insight solutions using technologies such as Hadoop/Hive, HBase, NoSQL, Netezza and working with statistical tools like SAS, R/Rapid Miner is preferred
Masters Degree preferred (e.g., MS or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative disciplines)

Dreamview is looking for four Contract Compositors to support us on our current projects in the Media and Entertainment Department.
This is a remote/telecommute position. The studio is 100% virtual and allows the applicant to work anywhere in the world!
RESPONSIBILITIES
Achieve simple to complex compositing tasks at all stages of the production process.
Produce high-level photorealistic images and create seamless transitions between filmed footage and composited 2D and 3D elements;
Work with supervisors to determine creative and technical approaches
Deliver work within established project targets, and the high-quality standards of the company.
Experience in compositing photorealistic images of high-quality and skills to create a smooth transition between shooting plans and 2D/3D elements.

Looking for candidates who are passionate about the art & science of digital imaging, with a great attitude and excitement for continued learning.

Positive attitude and proven track record in problem-solving

Ability to remain calm under pressure
Excellent organizational and communication skills

About DreamView
DreamView Studios was founded by veteran CGI visionaries with 100+ years combined experience in creating CGI & Visual Effects for blockbuster movies, AAA games, commercials, and eCommerce products, hailing from companies such as Disney, Industrial Light & Magic, Pixar, and Electronic Arts.
The DreamView™ cloud platform and production services help businesses create, manage, and distribute photoreal and Augmented Reality CGI products and media for eCommerce sites, marketing initiatives, consumer experiences, and more. Virtual products, lifestyle scenes, and video creation is not only faster and less costly than traditional set design and layout, but also provides infinitely reusable 3D CGI assets and media. The company's proprietary platform and process facilitates streamlined product development and visualization, and is globally scalable.
DreamView's team is completely virtual with employees across the globe. We offer competitive compensation, benefits, unlimited time-off, massive growth opportunities, and a supportive and knowledgeable team to facilitate your success.

Company Overview

Our mission is to empower the delivery of better care and therapies through actionable insights.

Healthcare is challenging. Too often, we and those we love fail to receive the care we deserve due to delayed, impersonal, incomplete or hard-to-understand information. Economists estimated that up to 20-30% of healthcare spending fails to meaningfully move outcomes and is wasted. In the US alone, this adds up to nearly $1 trillion per year that could be re-directed to additional access to care, new roads, and better schools.

One of the biggest drivers of this confusion and waste is a lack of easily accessible, timely and personalized information on how to optimize each and every healthcare journey.

We believe we can change healthcare by deliberately bringing together healthcare experience, Silicon Valley big data software engineering, and cutting-edge data science to deliver innovative solutions to pervasive problems.

Clarify Health is a rapidly growing technology company whose enterprise analytics cloud transforms healthcare data into actionable insights for providers, health plans, and life sciences companies. Our Insights Platform powers highly automated business applications that enable customers to drive growth, optimize networks, improve care delivery, manage population health, maximize value-based care performance, and commercialize pharmaceutical and biotechnology products. We are proud to be redefining the science behind understanding and predicting individual patient journeys and cohorts. With intuitive, on-demand interrogation of over 300 million longitudinal patient journeys, Clarify enables healthcare organizations to leapfrog from traditionally cumbersome and manual analytics, unlocking self-service and rapid generation of insights that result in better health and outcomes

Clarify Health brings together committed and passionate colleagues with backgrounds in big data and AI engineering from financial services together with extensive clinical operations expertise. The team has a track record of achieving over $1 billion in improvement at more than 125 health systems, payers, and pharmaceutical companies, and deploying cloud-based software at over 5,000 institutions.

Clarify Health is looking for colleagues who want to help grow an exciting and transformative digital healthcare company. A strong cultural fit – entrepreneurial; resilient; optimistic; generous and fun-loving – is critical to success in this role.
The Role
The Chief-of-Staff will report to the CEO, and work closely with the President, ELT members and the Vice-President of Strategy on overall leadership team management, maintaining broader company alignment through all-in meetings and goal settings processes, and solving critical challenges for the company.
The CoS will deliver insights and build compelling communications to help the leadership team align on, define, and communicate its strategy, raise capital, and build a rapidly growing business. From time-to-time the CoS will drive special projects to ensure success of these key initiatives and cross-functional opportunities to help Clarify maximize and realize its full potential.
Setting Leadership Team Agenda - Understanding what is going on in the business and using that information to prioritize, set, and drive leadership meeting agendas to maximize productivity of the ELT, asking the right questions and driving to decision while bringing all input
Ensuring Effective Leadership Team Meetings and Working - Driving critical ongoing internal meetings forward (e.g., weekly Executive Leadership Team meetings, monthly broader leadership teams, weekly all hands, internal meetings, etc.)
Daily CEO syncs to set priorities, prep for key meetings, and provide context where needed
Tracking and ensuring that action items from leadership meetings are executed post-decision helping to complete priority items to an appropriate level of quality
Developing presentations and/or ghost-writing key communications for CEO and President (e.g., internal company updates/promotions, investor updates, CEO blog, etc.)
Working with Strategy and Operations team to stand up appropriate goal management systems (e.g., OKRs) and contribute to/internalize information in monthly business reviews
Keeping the CEO accessible, open to new ideas and proposals, and working on the most important items for the company
Managing Clarify’s Advisory Board to maximize value and connection to the company
Keeping a pulse on the business and helping connect dots across the company; support the CEO/leadership team in driving the development of strategic plans
Monitor the health of the organization to identify new opportunities to improve and scale more efficiently in the ways we work, communicate, and track progress across the organization
Acting as a sounding board for Clarify’s CEO/President and initiate early exploration of new ideas or initiatives (e.g., early business case development, market mapping/landscaping)
Maintaining key parts of Clarify’s knowledge management systems (e.g., team Confluence sites, key information on intranet, etc.)
Collaborating on strategic company events and communications led by Marketing (e.g., Clarify Customer Conference, Advisor Conference, etc.)
Being flexible and ready to manage strategic projects or initiatives that have no natural home/capacity within an existing function/team and/or providing leverage to Clarify’s teams
What we are looking for
Passion about making a difference in healthcare
Proven project management skills to organize, plan, and prioritize research from ideation and design, through initiation, and ultimate publication
Outstanding individual and team performer with excellent track record of driving success
3-5+ years of professional experience (e.g., relevant experience at a top-tier management consulting firm, corporate strategy)
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including verbal and written; ability to collaborate with senior executives
Ability to communicate effectively and interact with team members all levels
Ability to build strong relationships with team members across functions and key external stakeholders (Board members, investors, etc.)
Educational background in healthcare (e.g., MD, PhD, MPH) a plus
Willingness to contribute to building an energetic and exciting organization
What we offer you
Competitive compensation package (base + bonus + equity options)
Quality health insurance
Traditional 401K plan
Vision, dental, disability and life insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts and Commuter Benefits
Generous PTO
Flexibility
Monthly wellness stipend
Remote friendly
A collaborative workplace, which will challenge you and celebrate your work
A chance to learn with and from interesting and enthusiastic colleagues
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Be a part of creating the extraordinary with industry leading, disruptive solutions from NetWitness, an RSA company. Our brand carries with it, world-class recognition second to none in the Security industry. Lead by joining a team delivering security excellence through extensive resources embodied by thought leadership, powerful software solutions, and unparalleled Incident Response. Our comprehensive NetWitness suite of solutions (in the cloud or on-prem) provide cutting edge munitions that shrink discovery time and deliver powerful ROI; RSA solves critical challenges that face our economy and nation.
RSA sales leaders are armed to work as trusted advisors for a broad set of industries worldwide. We leverage our strength of partnerships on a sell with and sell through basis to maximize customer value. This enables RSA to match the specific solutions within a cloud, on a prem, hybrid and/or consultative basis solving for client needs. RSA delivers consulting services for Threat Hunting, Incident Response, and ongoing technical engagements all enabling lasting relationships.
Our Sales Leaders directly advise clients on risk, proactive initiatives as well as leading industry trends. Netwitness combined with our advanced forensic services provides unparalleled Detection and Response, Threat Hunting, and threat intelligence capabilities. Our Behavioral Analytics with Artificial Intelligence provides our customers a proactive reduction in time to respond and time to remediate. RSA provides thought leadership in the field with world-renowned White Hat Hackers.
Join us as Industry leaders in Enterprise security software sales with our NetWitness team in the Bay Area to do the best work of your career and make a profound career and social impact.
What you'll achieve:
RSA Netwitness Enterprise sales role focuses on Top Tier Enterprise accounts that fit our Ideal Customer Profile.
The NetWitness Account Manager works in a specific geography and/or set of named accounts to provide product solutions, develop new business, ensure customer satisfaction, and maintain positive ongoing relationships.
You will:
Lead and work with internal and external team members for high growth
Understand, collaborate and solve customers’ business and solution requirements
Deliver in-depth oral, and visual presentations targeted at C and Mid-level leadership, staff, vendors, and clients
Territory management, including account planning and sales forecasting
Work as the frontline thought leaders keeping Corporate Marketing, Product Marketing, and Sales Management at the cutting edge of security threats and market changes
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table.
Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Essential Requirements
Bachelor’s degree; 8+ years of professional experience in a Security relationship selling role
Deep understanding of the lengthy sophisticated software sales motion with a high degree of technical aptitude and advanced knowledge of technical products, vendors, and families of technologies
Strong ability to sell in a highly matrixed environment and to navigate complex organizational structures to build rapport and trust across 12-15 contacts within an enterprise
Solid track record driving revenue with existing customers and proven new logo acquisition skills
Proven ability in closing large, complex deals within the IT/Security sector - >$250k and achieving multi-million-dollar revenue targets
Desirable Requirements
Excellent verbal and written presentation skills; ability to successfully conduct live demonstrations to clients and stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
NetWitness oﬀers mission-driven security solutions that provide organizations with a uniﬁed approach to managing digital risk that hinges on integrated visibility, automated insights and coordinated actions. NetWitness solutions are designed to eﬀectively detect and respond to advanced attacks; manage user access control; and reduce business risk, fraud and cybercrime. RSA protects millions of users around the world and helps more than 90 percent of the Fortune 500 companies, and every branch of the U.S. federal government, thrive and continuously adapt to transformational change. For more information, go to rsa.com.
More information on the RSA NetWitness Platform can be found here: https://www.rsa.com/en-us/products/threat-detection-response
RSA is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at RSA are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. RSA will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. RSA encourages applicants of all ages.

Who we are

Clockwise is an intelligent calendar assistant that frees up your time so you can work on what matters. We use an agentive technology approach to AI to understand your work / life commitments and automatically organize your calendar to help you focus on your priorities. Clockwise creates uninterrupted blocks of time within the boundaries of your work week to get core work done by actively managing complex intra & inter-team scheduling, double bookings, meeting room management, and so much more. Calendars are broken and aren't helping people do their best work. At Clockwise, we make your calendar work for you.

We're proud to have the backing of Accel Partners, Greylock Partners, Bain Capital Ventures and other preeminent investors. Our team has decades of experience from places like Twitter, Asana, Salesforce, Dropbox, Palantir, and Google. Join us to help the world make time for what matters.

The role

Clockwise is looking for our founding Sales Development Representative to help our team grow and deepen our relationships with the thousands of organizations that already use and love our product. We're looking for someone with a track record of success in an SDR role who loves the high energy work of business development. This is a unique opportunity for someone who is motivated to help build the next great PLG sales motion and the process that will be used by the team into the future as we scale.

What you'll do
Prioritize and reach out to organizations and educate them about the value of Clockwise
Generate new sales opportunities for the AE team
Help define our inbound and PQL sales motions
Test messaging and outreach techniques with a goal of helping prospective customers understand the problems we can help them solve
Partner with the AE team to develop SDR & AE workflows
Share feedback with the marketing & product teams on effective messaging & customer needs
About you
You have 1-2 years of sales experience in a high growth company or equivalent relevant experience
You are motivated and have a track record of success against your goals
You are a strong communicator with great business acumen
You seek coaching opportunities and strive to constantly improve
You are organized and value the role technology plays in enhancing productivity
You are passionate about Clockwise's mission to help the world's professionals make time for what matters
Work location

Pacific Time work hours expected.

Clockwise is committed to a work experience that exemplifies our values-driven culture and this starts with empathy for everyone who joins our team. To this end, Clockwise offers both fully-distributed and part-time in-office options for new employees.

Fully Distributed: Clockwise has adopted remote-first rituals and technology for all employees in order to create an excellent employee experience for those who opt to work fully-distributed. This extends not only to a stipend for your home office, but through all our company rituals, including a commitment to get together, in person, on a regular cadence. Please note that while we're open to employees located anywhere inside the United States, we are currently oriented around PT office hours.

In-Office: For those who wish to have a physical office to return to, we also offer an option to work from our San Francisco HQ three days a week. We have a beautiful, fun, spacious office where everyone can work productively and collaboratively. Our San Francisco HQ is located in the Financial District, a block from the Montgomery Street Muni & Bart station.

What we offer (non-exhaustive)
Competitive total compensation package with generous equity
Premium medical, dental and vision plans
401(k) plan
Wellness stipend
Virtual happy hours & events
Generous, flexible vacation policy
Paid maternity and paternity leave
In the Press

www.getclockwise.com/press

What drives Clockwise

Empathy - we work to fully understand our customers and teammates, especially when we disagree

Authenticity - we speak openly and candidly while embracing our teammates' individuality

Focus - we spend our time deliberately and don't wait to do the things that matter

Drive - we relentlessly pursue success and aren't afraid to get outside our comfort zone

Curiosity - we seek out opportunities to learn and continuously question how we can improve

Enthusiasm - we love what we do and are excited to share it with the world

Clockwise is looking to build a diverse team of individuals that share our core values. If these values resonate with you, please apply below or email us at careers@getclockwise.com.

JobTitle: Senior Technical Product Manager, Simulation AI and Integrit...
Content_text:
We're Cruise, a self-driving service designed for the cities we love.

We're building the world's most advanced, self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.

Cruisers have the opportunity to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the forefront of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's an opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.

If you are looking to play a part in making a positive impact in the world by advancing the revolutionary work of self-driving cars, join us.
About the Simulation group:
Simulation is building a platform to accelerate the development and testing of the entire AV technology stack for both hardware and software. We collaborate with teams like AV engineering, systems, and testing to deliver the tools that accelerate development and validation in order to quickly and safely launch new AV capabilities.
Achieving large-scale, commercial AV deployments fundamentally relies on having a powerful and accurate simulation that can test and verify AV behavior across a multitude of virtual driving scenarios without relying on extensive real-world testing and data collection. Developing truly driverless vehicles for ride-hail and goods delivery means Cruise will increasingly rely on Simulation for not just test and validation but also to uncover challenging driving scenarios that will accelerate the development of core AV technologies like Perception and Motion Planning. We're at the forefront of AV technology development and serve as the biggest lever to transform AVs from a prototype into a real commercial product.
About the Senior PM role for Productivity and Experience:
Simulation PMs own the tools and experiences that enable AV engineers and testers across Cruise to develop and test key components of the AV technology stack. As a Senior Technical Product Manager, you'll align Simulation and partner teams around a common vision for productivity and ease-of-use and turn that vision into reality. You'll work closely with UX, engineering, testing, and program management to create the tools and workflows that satisfy the following:
Insightful - deeply understand the problems developers and testers face and lead efforts to determine what types of simulations to create and how users will create them
Throughput - enable users to quickly create, execute, and interpret the appropriate type and quantity of simulations in order to gather the most signal for the least amount of effort
Usability - maximize intuitiveness, user delight, and convenience for new and experienced users alike
You will develop and execute a product strategy that will be lean yet effective in meeting user needs. You will have a strong sense for prioritization, a passion for innovation, and a customer-centric approach to product management.
The Simulation Product Team is a new team that aims to bring a forward-looking and product-first approach to the AV development process. Join us and be one of the key members that will help craft the product culture for the Simulation team.
What you'll be doing:
Partner with UX and engineering leaders to define the vision and goals for creating, executing, and interpreting different types of simulations
Work closely with engineering and platform teams to deploy your products and features across Cruise in order to accelerate velocity and increase confidence for development and testing orgs
Develop and execute a high impact roadmap across all its surfaces and personas in close collaboration with partners, end-users, and senior leadership
Thorough understanding of the products under your leadership, able to justify and communicate decisions and prioritizations
Balance multiple goals and priorities that maximize customer value and user delight
What you must have:
5+ proven years experience in tech-related fields
3+ years of proven success leading highly technical products (simulation, data science, machine learning, computer vision, or robotics)
Proven technical aptitude with complex internal or developer tools
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Experience formulating and driving a focused product vision, and owning the narrative with leadership, users, and partners
A bias to action and bootstrapping major projects, never hesitant to roll up your sleeves and be hands on
Experience leading product development from zero to first release and beyond
Provide insight and deliver measurable results for sophisticated products under ambiguous situations in a fast-paced environment
Bonus points!
Product Leadership experience with autonomous vehicles or safety-critical systems
Experience in developer/tester tooling, infrastructure, or high fidelity simulation products
Why Cruise?
Our benefits are here to support the whole you:
Competitive salary and benefits
401(k) Cruise matching program
Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life
One Medical membership
Flexible vacation and company paid holidays
Healthy meals and snacks provided for non-remote employees
Paid parental leave
Fertility Benefits
Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, subsidized by Cruise
Flexible Spending Account
Monthly wellness stipend
Pre-tax Commuter Benefit Plan for non-remote employees
We're Integrated
Through our partnerships with General Motors and Honda, we are the only self-driving company with fully integrated manufacturing at scale.
We're Funded
GM, Honda, Microsoft, SoftBank, & T. Rowe Price, have invested billions in Cruise. Their backing for our technology demonstrates their confidence in our progress, team, and vision and makes us one of the leading autonomous vehicle organizations in the industry. Our deep resources greatly accelerate our operating speed.
We're Independent
We have our own governance, board of directors, equity, and investors. Our independence allows us to not just work on the edge of technology, but also define it.
We're Vested
You won't just own your work here, you'll have the potential to own equity in Cruise, too. We are competing in a market that is projected to grow exponentially, which gives our company valuation room to grow.

Cruise LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to create a supportive and inclusive workplace where contributions are valued and celebrated, and our employees thrive by being themselves and are inspired to do the best work of their lives.

We seek applicants of all backgrounds and identities, across race, color, ethnicity, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or parental status, or disability. Applicants will not be discriminated against based on these or other protected categories or social identities. Cruise will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable laws.

Cruise is committed to the full inclusion of all applicants. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process please let our recruiting team know or email HR@getcruise.com.

We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. To help us track the effectiveness and inclusivity of our recruiting efforts, please consider answering the following demographic questions. Answering these questions is entirely voluntary. Your answers to these questions will not be shared with the hiring decision makers and will not impact the hiring decision in any way. Instead, Cruise will use this information not only to comply with any government reporting obligations but also to track our progress toward meeting our diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging objectives.

Vaccine Mandate.

At Cruise, we're tasked with leading in the communities we serve — and doing our part to help keep our communities and our teams safe. Our #StaySafe culture transcends and informs all we do, and because of this, as of October 31, 2021 Cruise will be mandating COVID-19 vaccinations for all US-based Cruisers who need or want to access any of our US Cruise facilities and engage in any business travel — including attending any in-person Company-sponsored event.

If you are unable to get a vaccine due to a medical condition, disability, or a strongly-held religious belief, Cruise will consider requests for an accommodation.

Note to Recruitment Agencies: Cruise does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Furthermore, Cruise does not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency other than its approved partners.

We're Cruise, a self-driving service designed for the cities we love.

We're building the world's most advanced, self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.

Cruisers have the opportunity to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the forefront of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's an opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.

If you are looking to play a part in making a positive impact in the world by advancing the revolutionary work of self-driving cars, join us.
About the role:

We are hiring a San Francisco-based Executive Assistant to support a VP in our Artificial Intelligence organization. Our ideal candidate will thrive in our innovative, fast-paced, and growing organization, expanding their skill set and abilities in pace with the company. You could be a great fit if you are someone who will succeed in the technical side of our business and help to cultivate connectivity across the department, driving efficiency and bringing productivity to the next level. This role is intended to scale to take on an additional VP in time.

What you'll be doing:
Act as gatekeeper, time-advocate, and liaison for Executive
Manage a busy and ever-changing calendar and schedule
Handle multiple requests for Executive's time, utilizing strong judgment in managing priority of requests, escalating as necessary for resolution
Create efficiency and balance for your Executive
Manage/assist with team meetings, team calendars, and team Slack channels
Act as culture champion for team: track, highlight, and celebrate important cultural/career moments such as birthdays, work anniversaries and quarterly team events.
Gain familiarity with internal tools and systems used by team
Arrange travel, schedule transit, and make reservations for Executive
Assist with preparation of presentation materials
Plan, coordinate, and facilitate various meetings, functions, and events including quarterly retreats and team-building offsites
Format documents and presentations
Manage and track team budgets
Expenses reimbursements for Executive
Help drive recruitment and hiring, as-needed (project management of candidate screening, schedules, process support)
Point person to keep the team on track and organized
Potentially develop new processes for a growing team
Adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
What you should have:
BA/BS or equivalent experience
4-5 years of related work experience at a high-growth company
Experience working with Product and/or Engineering teams
Strong knowledge of G Suite
Extremely strong communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent calendar management skills, including the coordination of complex meetings and designing scalable operating cadences
Confident self-starter that can take a task and run with it with limited supervision from executive
Creative problem solver who is able to anticipate needs and proactively offer solutions and make recommendations
Acute attention to detail and ability to maintain high levels of confidentiality
Availability to perform job duties outside of normal business hours when necessary
Comfortable adapting to a fast pace working environment
Bonus Points:
Project management experience
Why Cruise?
Our benefits are here to support the whole you:
Competitive salary and benefits
401(k) Cruise matching program
Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life
One Medical membership
Flexible vacation and company paid holidays
Healthy meals and snacks provided for non-remote employees
Paid parental leave
Fertility Benefits
Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, subsidized by Cruise
Flexible Spending Account
Monthly wellness stipend
Pre-tax Commuter Benefit Plan for non-remote employees

Through our partnerships with General Motors and Honda, we are the only self-driving company with fully integrated manufacturing at scale.
We're Funded
GM, Honda, Microsoft, SoftBank, & T. Rowe Price, have invested billions in Cruise. Their backing for our technology demonstrates their confidence in our progress, team, and vision and makes us one of the leading autonomous vehicle organizations in the industry. Our deep resources greatly accelerate our operating speed.
