Do jargon-laced B2B marketing messages make you cringe? Do you mentally copy edit grammatically-incorrect social posts? Are you always looking for the right word to make a sentence come alive? If so, you’ve come to the right place.We’re looking for a talented Content Marketing Manager to join the fast-growing Formation team. As part of the marketing team, you will be responsible for developing content across owned and earned channels, and supporting the evolution of our corporate messaging as our market category grows. In this role, you’ll create content that clearly articulates business value to drive brand awareness and market demand for Formation.This role reports to the Director of Strategic Communications.You will: Produce a wide range of materials including content assets including social posts, ebooks, infographics, blogs and more.Own the growth of our organic social channelsBe responsible for creating, publishing and analyzing performance for Formation’s blog to ensure we’re achieving our corporate growth goals.Be a key driver of content strategy and development within a growing cross-functional teamCome to the table with big ideas and opinions on how we can always be improving.Ensure material is technically accurate, creative, and aligned with our messaging and voice guidelinesAbout you: 3-8+ years of experience developing content for B2B or B2BCSolid understanding of both technical and business value content and messaging (Bonus points for experience with AI/ML and/or personalization)Strong experience with a variety of content types including social, short/long form, and interactive/digitalExperience with CMS and social management platformsFamiliarity writing for SEO objectivesUses analytics to guide decisions and recommendations for long-term content roadmap - push for continuous improvement to support content goalsStrong project management skills and experience working successfully with cross-functional teams, as well as outside agenciesExcellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills with a keen eye for detailA self-starter with experience working in faced-paced start-up or high-growth tech environmentSuperb communicator, BA/BS degreeAbout Formation:Formation helps brands build deeper relationships with each of their customers beyond the transaction. Our patented Dynamic Offer Optimization Platform optimizes each customer’s offer for the best action and reward and automates the generation, deployment and fulfillment of each offer across the marketing stack. Brands see 3X revenue lift, 2X more engagement and 10X faster time to market with their offers. Formation powers the offer optimization for some of the world’s largest brands such as Starbucks, United Airlines and Giant Eagle. For more information, visit formation.ai. Formation also supports a community of digital and loyalty marketing leaders called Loyalty Innovators. For more information, visit loyaltyinnovators.com.We're already reaching millions of people a day, and we're just getting started. Our founding leadership is equal parts business, design, and engineering—because we believe differing perspectives + passionate discourse achieve the greatest outcomes. We give our whole selves. We love learning new things.Formation is committed to inclusion and diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. You will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or veteran status.If you're up for the challenge of a lifetime, we're looking for outstanding talent to join our team.Job Type: Full-time

JobTitle: Prin Solutions ArchitectAI/ML , Strategic Accounts Solutions...
Content_text:
Bachelor’s degree.

At least 10 years of experience designing and building data-intensive solutions using distributed computing.

At least 6 years of experience programming in C, C++, Python, or Scala.

At least 3 years of experience with the full ML development lifecycle using modern technology in a business critical setting.

At least 3 years of hands-on experience developing AI/ML applications on cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)

Job summary
The Strategic Accounts team at AWS believes that artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) represent the biggest opportunities for AWS's largest customers to differentiate themselves and transform their industries. Our AI/ML Solutions Architects are leading these efforts with our customers designing and building ethical and impactful applications, scalable infrastructures and solutions which support data driven ML solutions.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Key job responsibilities
As the Principal Solutions Architect, AI/ML you will be expected to:

Advise, guide and help design an AI/ML strategy which will accelerate the customer's ability to deploy state-of-the-art intelligent systems.
Partner with AWS AI/ML thought leaders and product owners to enable customers to build large-scale ML initiatives with business value top of mind.
Leverage AWS products, managed services and cloud-native capabilities to deliver optimized ML solutions at scale.
Work collaboratively with DBS and Analytics architects to optimize data pipelines which feed AI/ML models and applications
Use programming languages like Python, Scala, C/C++.
Evangelize best practices in all aspects of the AI/ML engineering and modeling lifecycles.
Help recruit, mentor and retain top AI/ML architectural and engineering talent.

A day in the life
As a Solutions Architect specializing in AI/ML, you will provide architectural and technical leadership to a portfolio of customers who are looking to leverage AI/ML applications and systems at scale. You will be the domain expert in AI/ML, guiding architectural design decisions, while demonstrating customer obsession to ensure high availability and performance of the customers machine learning applications. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and be curious while evangelizing the latest innovations and best practices in AI/ML infrastructure, engineering and application design. You will mentor peers and customers while growing your knowledge.

At least 3 years of experience designing, implementing, and scaling production-ready data pipelines that feed ML models.

At least 8 years of experience within a large/data-intensive multi-line business environment.

Experience partnering with technology peers responsible for data architecture and distributed computing infrastructure/platforms.

Ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly to a variety of audiences.

ML industry impact through conference presentations, papers, blog posts, or open source contributions

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Content_text: About A-T-S: Applied Technology & Science (A-T-S) is an engineering and environmental consulting firm in San Francisco focused on water and energy delivery infrastructure, natural resource management, and data sciences/geospatial technology for public, private, and non-profit sector clients.Job Description: Applied Technology & Science (A-T-S) is looking for a Data Scientist to join our team to support natural resources, engineering, and environmental science teams with insights gained from our proprietary data. Our ideal candidate should have a background in using a variety of data analysis and data mining methods, building, and implementing models, using, and creating algorithms, and creating and running simulations, including a strong emphasis in using ESRI software with Python.Requirements: B.S. in related field0-5+ years of experience with manipulating data sets and building statistical modelsExperience Python & GIS (looking for demonstrated ability to expand and automate the ESRI platform)Experience with a scripting language for data analysis and visualization - R (tidyverse, shiny) or pythonExperience in Database Design, data modelsWorking knowledge of R, MATLAB, C++, SQLStatistics (Bayesian statistics background) would also be goodPractical/applied machine learning experienceUnderstanding of data structures and data pipelinesDomain expertise in technical discipline outside of computer/data science (e.g., Water resources engineering, environmental engineering, environmental science, climate change, hydrology, ecology) is highly desirableExperience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environmentGreat communication skills - distill complex information to technical and non-technical groupsKnowledge of data management best practices and metadata standardsCoursework in statistics and probabilityResponsibilities: Manage Data Science projects for status and timelinesUtilize Machine Learning and AI to conduct research projects on image recognition and risk assessment modelingAssist staff in metadata document creation according to international standardsManage uploads to data repository through collaboration with agencies (SMARTS, etc.)Develop QA/QC procedures to ensure quality data collectionTransform messy data into unified, machine-actionable formatsDesign data models and schemas for databasesWrite fantastic technical documentationPerform ad-hoc data analysis and reportingJob Type: Full-timePay: From $1.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Master's (Preferred)Experience:Python: 1 year (Preferred)SQL: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: One location

Join a movement in which everyone can win. We started a movement in which everyone can win – shoppers, retailers, society, and every person on our team. To play fair, trust people and reward them for doing the right thing. We see and feel the impact of our work as more and more people gain financial freedom and retailers grow across the globe.Founded seven years ago in Sydney, Australia, Afterpay has over 16.2 million active customers globally and more than 100,000 of the world’s best retailers around the world including Anthropologie, Revolve, DSW, GOAT, Finish Line, Levi’s, Mac Cosmetics, Ray-Ban and many others. Afterpay is on a mission to power an economy in which everyone wins.Afterpay is completely free for customers who pay on time – helping people spend responsibly without incurring interest, fees, or extended debt. Afterpay empowers customers to access the things they want and need, while still allowing them to maintain financial wellness and control, by splitting payments in four, for both online and in-store purchases. Afterpay is deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers. We are focused on supporting our community of shoppers.We trust in the next generation and share a vision of a more accessible and sustainable world in which people are rewarded for doing the right thing.*The Opportunity*We are looking for Manager / Lead level data gurus to join the Global Marketing Analytics team. The Global Marketing Analytics team measures marketing performance and informs decisions that accelerate growth. This is a great opportunity for someone from a data engineering, BI, data science or data analytics background who has experience in cloud infrastructure and wants to build their career within a fast-growing, global company.*We are much more than our job descriptions - we are our energy, our ideas, our everyday drive. Here’s where you will begin….*You will be leveraging Afterpay’s rich data set to automate marketing measurement and propel the growth of our business. This will include scoping, developing, implementing and maintaining processes that enable experimentation and attribution at scale. You’ll be required to procure, process and provide data from a myriad of sources, and write clear, well-structured, and performant code. As a leader, you will coach junior team members to grow their technical and organizational skills.*Who are you?*Like us, you’ll be deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers and passionate about shaping the future of Afterpay.You love data and get excited talking about data, analytics, experimentation and AI/ML.You have 5+ years hands-on experience working with data.You have 3+ years experience leading data teams.You have excellent data engineering and manipulation skills (SQL, Python, Spark, ETL, data pipelines, etc.).You have a strong understanding of data concepts like Data Lake, data warehousing, ingestion patterns.Experience in Cloud infrastructure, AWS/Azure/GCP.Experience with Git/Jenkins, JIRA.You love being aboard a rocketship with a high performing team.You relish customers and embrace change as customer’s needs evolve.You are a team player, which means being respectful, willing to co-create and trust your team.You believe in delivering useful solutions quickly and iterativelyYou like to keep it real with your actions, be brave with your decisions, do the right thing for all our stakeholders and shape the future with excitement.*Bonus points for: *Understanding of experimentation and marketing fundamentalsBackground in distributed data processingExperience with Apache Airflow/Luigi/AzkabanData Engineering/Dev-Ops background*How we reward you.* We have a pay-for-performance culture so you can expect to be rewarded for high performance. We pride ourselves on fairness and offer a competitive total reward package made up of salary, incentives, and benefits including the opportunity to enroll in our share matching plan.We have a strong focus on health and wellbeing at Afterpay as we aim to support you to succeed in both your career and personal lives, such as providing employees with a corporate membership to Headspace. We offer a wide range of insurance programs so you have the flexibility to choose what is best for you. Afterpay covers 100% of the employee cost and 75% of the cost of your dependents.We value diversity and a collaborative and inclusive environment where everyone feels they belong is important to us.*How to Apply: *We don’t know what the future holds. That’s the exciting part; we show up and make it happen. If you’re brave, if you’re committed to doing the right thing, and excited by this opportunity, click apply now!Afterpay is continuing to hire for all open roles with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new team members, in addition to current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.Job Type: Full-time

Scale’s 3D Sensor Fusion team works with customers like Nuro, Lyft, Toyota, and many others that use LIDAR, Radar, and camera data to perceive the world. We support a range of use cases, from autonomous vehicles to robotics to AR/VR. We are looking for strong, entrepreneurial engineers to help us grow further and continue to push the boundaries of what’s possible in perception and computer vision.
In this role you’ll be given the opportunity to have a large amount of impact by working closely with our customers to discover what they need and build new solutions for them. We are looking for strong software engineer generalists who care deeply about impact and solving customer problems, and have an interest in supporting the AI development lifecycle.
You will
Work with our customers - some of the most sophisticated ML organizations in the world - to quickly prototype and build new 3D sensor fusion data products
Build technologies ranging from frontend labeling software to automated ML systems
Deliver experiments at a high velocity and quality, working closely with operations and ML experts to prove impact
Work across the entire product lifecycle from conceptualization through production
Be able, and willing, to multi-task and learn new technologies quickly
Must haves
2+ years of hands-on engineering experience post graduation
Demonstrated track record of building ambitious products
Interest in working with AI technologies
*Please note, this role is not open to new grads or interns at this time*
Nice to haves
Previous experience working in autonomous vehicles, robotics, or AR/VR
Experience working at other API technology companies
About Us:
At Scale, we believe that the transition from traditional software to AI is one of the most important shifts of our time. Our mission is to make that happen faster across every industry, and our team is transforming how machine learning can build innovative products. Our products provide access to human-powered data for hundreds of use cases and are used by industry leaders such as Open AI, Lyft, GM, Samsung, Airbnb, NVIDIA, and many more. We’ve recently raised $325 million in Series E funding at a valuation of $7B+ and are expanding our team to accelerate the development of AI applications.
We believe that everyone should be able to bring their whole selves to work, which is why we are proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability status, gender identity or Veteran status.
We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@scale.com. Please see the United States Department of Labor's EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.

C3.ai, Inc. (NYSE:AI) is a leading provider of Enterprise AI software for accelerating digital transformation. C3 AI delivers a family of fully integrated products: C3 AI® Suite, an end-to-end platform for developing, deploying, and operating large-scale AI applications; C3 AI Applications, a portfolio of industry-specific SaaS AI applications; C3 AI CRM, a suite of industry-specific CRM applications designed for AI and machine learning; and C3 AI Ex Machina, a no-code AI solution to apply data science to everyday business problems. The core of the C3 AI offering is an open, model-driven AI architecture that dramatically simplifies data science and application development. Learn more at: www.c3.ai
Our C3 AI CRM business unit is hiring for a Sales Director. C3 AI CRM is a next-generation system of intelligence built with configurable and industry-specific workflows and predictive models. We transform customer engagement across every internal and external data source, and we apply AI to formulate accurate and actionable insights. C3 AI CRM is transforming customer experience with industry-specific functionality that delivers powerful predictive insights to boost performance of sales, marketing, and customer service.

As a CRM Sales Director, you will be responsible for new customer acquisition, sales strategy and execution, and continued success of your portfolio. The CRM Sales Director is measured by and expected to achieve all agreed upon new sales goals for the assigned territory.

This is a quota carrying, individual contributor sales opportunity.

Your Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and manage the implementation of strategic sales plans.
Manage efforts to research and identify customer prospects and targets.
Build and maintain C3 AI's company brand, establishing our position in the market.
Accountable for personal sales quotas based on corporate revenue goals.
Engage in key account sales, business development, and ongoing customer success.
Develop and actively maintain sales forecasts across assigned accounts and lines of business.
Own all aspects related to opportunity success, including coordination across all stakeholders (e.g., legal, contacting, etc.).
Measure and report results of and activity related to sales and plan execution in the CRM.
Identify areas for improvement and acts to implement positive change.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree required.
7+ years (10+ years for Senior Director) of documented success in enterprise software sales or business technology products and services.
Experience creating data driven programs to drive company strategy.
Experience selling next-generation products in complex accounts
Exemplary written and oral communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal, planning, and organizational skills.
Demonstrated experience with data management and analysis.

C3 AI provides a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits.

C3 AI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status.

We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, national origin, genetics, disability, military and veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Established in 2017, Whisper is a team of artificial intelligence, hearing care, hardware, and software experts coming together to solve the challenge of providing better hearing. We set out to make the Whisper Hearing System so our parents, grandparents, friends and teammates can have a tomorrow that sounds even better than today.

Based in San Francisco, Whisper is lucky to have the support of great investors including Sequoia Capital, First Round Capital, Quiet Capital, IVP, and more.

THE ROLE

At Whisper, data is at the heart of how we make decisions about building products and services. As an audio data scientist, you will help us investigate and evaluate new audio processing techniques and technologies we could employ to improve the performance of our hearing system, bringing data to the table to help us make the best possible decisions. You will collaborate closely with other researchers, data scientists, and engineers to develop improvements to our products, run human-subjects experiments, analyze the results of those experiments, and derive conclusions on potential benefits to Whisper patients.

You will bring modern analytical techniques to an old-guard industry and answer important questions about hearing loss, product usage, and what makes someone happy with their hearing. In doing so, you will help to inform the product development roadmap and the design of the products we build. This is a great opportunity for someone excited to take responsibility over a broad domain and have a huge impact on how hearing care is delivered to the 430+ million people in the world with hearing loss.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Collaborate with research, data science, and engineering to develop techniques for measuring, predicting, and increasing patient satisfaction with the Whisper hearing system
Identify strategies to make trade-offs between different hearing aid algorithms in different scenarios based on patient preferences and discrimination ability; collaborate with the audio DSP and ML teams to implement those strategies
Investigate and evaluate novel techniques or new technologies taken from recent literature that have the potential to improve patient outcomes

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

3+ years of academic or industry experience developing audio signal processing algorithms
Proficient in Python and familiarity with other systems languages (e.g. C/C++)
Audio qualification experience, including calibration procedures, test procedures, equipment, tools, etc.
Experience developing metrics, assessment techniques, and tools to improve the performance of signal processing algorithms using field data
Experience with applying machine learning algorithms to audio or visual data
Experience working in teams focused software engineering environment (e.g. code reviewing, source control, etc)
Clear communication skills and a team multiplier
BS, MS, or PhD in EE, CS, Statistics, or related technical field
Able and willing to come into our San Francisco headquarters most days

BONUS POINTS

Experience with audio DSP techniques (e.g. adaptive filtering, filter banks, noise suppression, beamforming, speech analysis and synthesis, speech and audio coding, etc.)
Experience using machine learning techniques (e.g. deep neural nets) to solve audio tasks like speech enhancement, audio event classification, or voice detection
Experience building low power wearable products
A personal connection to improving hearing health

If you're interested in difficult and novel problems in embedded audio, immediate ownership of company defining decisions, top compensation, and work which directly helps 360MM+ people hear again - we'd love to hear from you.

Whisper.ai is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce with an inclusive working environment for everyone to do their best work. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

CompanyLocation: San Mateo, CA 94402 (Nineteenth Avenue area)+2 locations
Content_text:
Punchh is the leader in AI-powered loyalty, offer management, and customer engagement solutions for brick-and-mortar and online restaurants, convenience stores, and other retailers. Punchh brings the power of digital engagement to physical stores by delivering omnichannel experiences and personalization across the entire customer journey to drive same-store sales and customer lifetime value. Using pre-built integrations to 200+ third-party systems such as POS, Wi-Fi, kiosk, and payment providers, the Punchh platform delivers actionable, SKU-level data in real-time. Serving 200+ brands that span 100K+ stores in 20 different countries, Punchh customers include 5 of the top 100 North American convenience stores like Casey's and Racetrac and 37 of the top 100 restaurant brands, including Papa John's, Denny's, Focus Brands, and Yum! Brands (KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell). Punchh is headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Texas, Canada, and India. Punchh was built over eleven years by a seasoned leadership team with extensive experience in digital, marketing, CRM, and AI technologies, as well as deep knowledge of the restaurant and retail industries. In April of 2021, Punchh agreed to be acquired by PAR Technology Corporation (NYSE: PAR), a leading global provider of restaurant software. While Punchh continues to operate as an independent business unit, the acquisition creates a unified commerce cloud platform for enterprise restaurants and positions PAR and its subsidiaries to lead the industry with integrated point-of-sale, back office, payment, and guest engagement solutions

PAR invented the FIRST point of sale terminal over 40 years ago, yet we operate much like a start-up at the forefront of restaurant technology. PAR's solutions are used to serve tens of millions of guests every day in over 120 countries. Our mission is to build the number one restaurant technology company in the world and we're off to great start. We believe our customers want technology that is open and fast that enables their ability to innovate. We're looking for people who are hungry to go beyond the idea of 'just a job'. PAR's not for everyone though: We work hard, and we really reward success. We push ourselves and each other to be better every day. We're ferocious in battle but gentle in spirit. We're hands-on people. We keep our room clean and make our bed because details matter. We believe it is better to be fast than big, and that being both is best. We believe diversity creates strong systems and communities. We experiment. Sometimes we break things, but we learn quickly. We're honest and our intentions are good. And we always offer the last slice of dessert to our guests. We've got each other's and our customers' backs no matter what
Title

Head of Machine Learning

Location

San Mateo,CA

About the Role

Punchh is looking for a Head of Machine Learning that will report into our VP of Data. The position will be key in defining Punchh's data strategy and building a comprehensive suite of ML products.

What You'll Do

Work with the senior leadership, especially the CPTO office to create and implement Punchh's long term strategies in advanced data technologies.
Own the roadmap of the entire ML team, driving for outstanding execution.
Own the ML infrastructure, working with other technology leaders to build high-performing engineering platforms.
Both the strategic and technical leader of Punchh's Intelligent Data Platform, including:
Model customer behavior to empower intelligent marketing campaigns.
Use the latest NLP techniques to understand the text contents on the Punchh platform, e.g. restaurant reviews, receipts, and product catalogs.
Weak-supervision technologies to make AI products "less data-hungry"
Represent Punchh in conferences, publications, and marketing events

What You'll Need

Leadership experience in managing an AI team & developing scalable ML products.
Advanced degree (Ph.D. preferred) in computer science, physics, engineering or other related fields.
Extensive experience with one or more of the following industrial fields: retail, marketing, marketplace.
Outstanding software engineering background, with hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks.
Extensive knowledge with cloud technology, e.g. AWS and Azure.
Exceptional ability to articulate a complex concept with thoughtful, actionable recommendations.

Benefits

Healthcare coverage, FSA, HSA
Life and AD&D insurance
401K
Competitive salaries, bonus and stock options
Professional development
EAP
Maternity and Paternity (Bonding) Leave
Unlimited PTO
Paid holidays
Free lunch in the office

Punchh is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant, please click here.

We also provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable laws.

Notice to recruiters and placement agencies: If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit résumés to any person or email address at Punchh prior to having a signed agreement with Human Resources. Punchh is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency other than its approved recruitment partners. Also, any résumés sent to us without an agreement in place will be considered your company's gift to Punchh and may be forwarded to our Talent Acquisition team.

Clockwise is currently working & interviewing candidates remotely. We are actively hiring for this position and will review your application.

Who we are

Clockwise is an intelligent calendar assistant that frees up your time so you can work on what matters. We use an agentive technology approach to AI to understand your work / life commitments and automatically organize your calendar to help you focus on your priorities. Clockwise creates uninterrupted blocks of time within the boundaries of your work week to get core work done by actively managing complex intra & inter-team scheduling, double bookings, meeting room management, and so much more. Calendars are broken and aren't helping people do their best work. At Clockwise, we make your calendar work for you.

We're proud to have the backing of premier investors such as Accel and Greylock Partners. Our team has decades of experience from places like Twitter, Asana, Salesforce, Dropbox, Palantir, and Google. Join us as we help the world make time for what matters.

The role

Clockwise is looking for an experienced closer, that wants to build, and lay the sales foundation. This is a unique opportunity to define a sales process from the ground up, experiment with different sales tactics, and use your learnings to inform the product roadmap. You will not just be responsible for closing business, but also building the playbook for future teammates to follow.

What you'll do
As a foundational sales hire, you will be instrumental in defining our sales strategy and go-to-market motion
You will work with existing Clockwise users - from Fortune 100 companies to small businesses - to convert them to our new paid plans
You will build an experimentation plan to try different ways sales can help drive our self-service business model
You will proactively identify opportunities to make the team more effective (new sales collateral, different technology, etc)
You will work closely with product and marketing to let them know what's working and how we can improve
You will partner with Customer Success to grow existing customer contracts and support renewals
About you
You do more than what's asked of you – you're always looking for ways to improve existing processes to make the team better
You're results oriented – you never miss your number
You're a great communicator who builds strong cross-functional relationships
You pride yourself on being extremely organized – you never let next steps slip
You have 1+ years of closing experience at a SaaS company
Work location

Pacific Time work hours expected.

Clockwise is committed to a work experience that exemplifies our values-driven culture and this starts with empathy for everyone who joins our team. To this end, Clockwise offers both fully-distributed and part-time in-office options for new employees.

Fully Distributed: Clockwise has adopted remote-first rituals and technology for all employees in order to create an excellent employee experience for those who opt to work fully-distributed. This extends not only to a stipend for your home office, but through all our company rituals, including a commitment to get together, in person, on a regular cadence. Please note that while we're open to employees located anywhere inside the United States, we are currently oriented around PT office hours.

In-Office: For those who wish to have a physical office to return to, we also offer an option to work from our San Francisco HQ three days a week. We have a beautiful, fun, spacious office where everyone can work productively and collaboratively. Our San Francisco HQ is located in the Financial District, a block from the Montgomery Street Muni & Bart station.

What we offer (non-exhaustive)
Competitive total compensation package with generous equity
Premium medical, dental and vision plans
401(k) plan
Wellness stipend
Virtual happy hours & events
Generous, flexible vacation policy
Paid maternity and paternity leave
In the Press

www.getclockwise.com/press

What drives Clockwise

Empathy - we work to fully understand our customers and teammates, especially when we disagree

Authenticity - we speak openly and candidly while embracing our teammates' individuality

Focus - we spend our time deliberately and don't wait to do the things that matter

Drive - we relentlessly pursue success and aren't afraid to get outside our comfort zone

Curiosity - we seek out opportunities to learn and continuously question how we can improve

Enthusiasm - we love what we do and are excited to share it with the world


Clockwise is looking to build a diverse team of individuals that share our core values. If these values resonate with you, please apply below or email us at careers@getclockwise.com.

Are you a high energy individual with a passion for the latest manufacturing software trends including Edge Computing, IOT, and Artificial Intelligence? Are you able to work at a deep technical level driving IT/OT convergence and data driven closed loop solutions? If so, please apply for this outstanding opportunity at Siemens Digital Industry Software!

Our Customers …

Many manufacturing companies are partnering with Siemens to build their Digital Thread; the computer systems that give them the capability of electronically linking virtual simulations, design and testing, to physical manufacturing. These Customers are in the Aerospace, Automotive, Consumer Products & Packaging, Electronics, Medical Device, and Semiconductor industries where this technology gives them a competitive advantage.

Companies select Siemens because we have an end-to-end Digital Thread solution, available today - not just a part of the solution or something on a roadmap. This architect position is to become a member of a services team that works with the Customer manufacturing facilities – where the designs and simulations culminate in manufactured products – to deploy our industry leading Manufacturing Operations Management (MOM) software.

Your Challenge …

As a member of the MOM Services team, be a subject matter expert. Consult on solutions using Siemens MOM software – assist with the installation, configuration, extension, and deployment of these solutions. Enable our Customers on their journey to realize their Digital Thread by integrating the solutions with their manufacturing equipment, enterprise software, and other solutions – expertly leading our Customers to solutions that provide true value.

Who we are looking for…

Siemens will train you in our methodologies, best practices, and solutions - including our MOM Opcenter Foundation software products, previously known as Simatic IT. We need you to already have:

A Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience
An understanding of common manufacturing systems and industry best practices
Experience with software development lifecycles and tools
Fluency in written and spoken English, with good communication skills
Mostly work remotely, but able and willing to travel 25-50% of the time
1-3 years’ experience deploying Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) and peripheral manufacturing software solutions.
Possible deployment experience with Opcenter or other MES software, such as Wonderware, Apriso, or Solumina.

Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.

Siemens Industry Software Inc. requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless granted an accommodation due to a disability or sincerely held religious belief or practice

About Us …

Siemens is a large international corporation with diverse manufacturing interests. This includes a digital industries software division that is focused on external sales, maintenance, and deployment of software that enables the fourth industrial revolution (Industry 4.0). Our customers are therefore progressive thinkers, pursuing change that will make them market leaders.

Our products and services are based on Microsoft technologies, which scale for both small or medium companies, and large multi-national corporations. This position is with the Siemens services team that architects and deploys MOM solutions in North America; other teams in South America, EMEA, and Asia provide local services for global solutions.

Join Us …

See the Digital Thread in action; get watch, as 3D modelled ideas become real products!

Keywords …

#Industry: Aerospace and Defense; Automotive: Consumer Products and Packaging: Electronics; Energy; Food and Beverage; Heavy Equipment, High Technology, Machinery, Medical Device and Diagnostics; Semiconductors

#Solutions: Industry 4.0; Digital Twin

#Solutions: Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES); Advanced Production Scheduling (APS)

#SW: C#, .NET, SQL, OPC, JSON, Angular

#Siemens-Software: Opcenter; Simatic; Production Suite

JobTitle: Mechanical Integrity Engineer/ Asset Integrity Engineer
Content_text:
Mechanical Integrity Engineer / Asset Integrity Engineer
Job Purpose
The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented mechanical or chemical engineer with 5 to 10 years’ experience in the implementation of asset integrity management programs in chemical and/or oil and gas/refining facilities. The candidate will be a member of the ioMosaic Asset Integrity Management and Services (AIMS) Team and will support all team activities including marketing AIM services, AIM software sales, AIM training and AIM auditing.
Responsibilities
Work with clients on implementing AIM systems
Develop and/or conduct Asset Integrity Management Training on-line or in person
Participate and conduct asset integrity audits remotely and/or at client sites
Continuously improve existing AIM products and services
Work with sales and marketing teams to promote Asset Integrity Management and Services
The successful applicant must have demonstrated:
Communications skills
High efficiency and organizational skills
Attention to detail
Technical writing capabilities, including presentation of technical material in a logical, usable manner
Problem and implementation of solutions - solving abilities, including systematic approach to identification of problems

Experience Required
BS in Mechanical or Chemical Engineering. Minimum of 5 years of engineering experience in field/industry, is required.
Professional Engineer (PE) license is a plus
Experience in developing and maintaining a mechanical integrity program for refinery or chemical manufacturing facility including risk based inspections for all types of equipment
Familiarity with codes, standards, and Recognized and Generally Accepted Good Engineering Practice (RAGAGEP) such as API, ASME, IEC and ISO, for a broad range of equipment including fabricated equipment, and safety instrumented systems
Has trained employees on an MI/AI program or has been involved in the creation of such a program.
Conducted or is familiar with Fitness-for-service evaluations
Chaired or lead PHA, HAZOP, HAZID, SIL, SIMOP workshops
Lead AIM and PSM audits

This job description is not intended to describe in detail the multitude of tasks that may be assigned, but rather to provide a general sense of the responsibilities and expectations of this position. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position. As the nature of business demands change so, too, may the essential functions of this position.

Documentation SpecialistAtomwise, based in San Francisco, is transforming preclinical drug discovery using artificial intelligence (AI). Our technology can screen billions of small molecules to discover novel scaffolds and potent analogs, and contribute to the rational design of molecules during lead optimization. Our partners include pharmaceutical companies, innovative biotech companies, top-ranked academic institutions and global non-profit foundations. Atomwise has hundreds of programs that reflect a commitment to lowering the barriers to drug discovery and improving health across all therapeutic areas.Atomwise is seeking highly motivated individuals to join our team as Documentation Specialist. This role will have a direct impact on the selection and success of our drug discovery projects and our mission to transform pharma drug discovery - to shorten timelines, reduce costs, and increase the number of safe and effective treatments.Our team is our most valuable asset. Everyone on our team is crucial to fully realizing the potential of our technology to transform drug discovery. In this role you will transcribe, enter and maintain compound and biological assay data across different platforms. The ideal candidate will enjoy work that involves processing raw data from biological assays, manipulating different types of biological data and data types across multiple projects, and requires strong organizational skills and significant attention to detail.RequiredBachelor’s degree (biochemistry, cell biology, chemistry, molecular biology, pharmacology, computer science or a related field preferred)1-3 years experience in assay development, specimen data management, data management, quality control/assurance, or related disciplineFamiliarity with or exposure to various biochemical, biophysical, cellular, and pharmacological data typesAbility to work in a fast-paced and cross-functional results-oriented team environmentExcellent communication, organization, analytical and data visualization skills (particularly with data manipulation in Excel)Ability to prioritize and thoroughly follow up on assigned tasksA can-do attitude, no task is too smallPreferredWet lab experience in a research or drug discovery environmentKnowledge of small-molecule early drug development processGeneral understanding of cloud computing/data storage conceptsExperience with CDD Vault a strong plus, especially with migrating dataWhen applying, please provideA cover letterA paragraph stating how your skills and experience will help the Atomwise teamA CV or resumeCompensation & benefitsCompetitive salary, commensurate with experienceStock compensation plan – you’ll be an Atomwise co-ownerPlatinum health, dental, and vision benefits401k with 4% matchFunding for professional development and conference attendanceFlexible work scheduleGenerous parental leaveRelaxed work environmentGreat colleaguesAtomwise is an equal opportunity employer and strives to foster an inclusive workplace. Our mission is to develop better medicines faster, and we know that we need a diverse team to develop medicines that serve diverse populations. Accordingly, Atomwise does not make any employment decisions (including but not limited to, hiring, compensation, and promotions) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, and local law.We strongly encourage people of diverse backgrounds and perspectives to apply.Authorization to work in the US is required.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Job Type: Full-time

Photonic Test Development Engineer
Location: Emeryville

Description:
Seeking an experimentalist who wants to build a Lab into a Factory

Ayar Labs is a startup company developing cutting-edge optical I/O technology to remove electrical I/O bottlenecks and continue the performance scaling that Moore’s Law enabled until now. Our team consists of experts in circuit design, integrated photonics, laser engineering, and packaging. We are seeking a senior engineer to develop automated experiments and tests of optically active InP photonic circuits and digital CMOS with tightly integrated silicon photonics.

Essential Functions:
Independently develop experiments and tests to characterize lasers, modulators, receivers, and other photonic components. Test articles will be in many forms: on-wafer, singulated die, chip-on-carrier, submodules, and modules.
Analyze and interpret results in collaboration with designers to improve product performance and develop new electro-optic components.
Create infrastructure and process as we grow from product development to high-volume manufacturing.
Design and build automated test platforms to increase throughput for product development
System integration of instruments and optics for photonic test systems
Write software as needed to automate mechatronics, instruments, and data acquisition; and analyze and parameterize raw data.
Test methodology developed must scale up to high-volume manufacturing
Internal Customers and Partners: photonics and CMOS design teams, product engineering team, reliability team, and packaging team.
Basic Requirements:
Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Applied Physics, or equivalent; or MS + minimum 3 years industry experience in same
Expertise developing and implementing electrical and optical characterization of photonic devices
Experience with self-directed automation of test, measurement, or experimental setups
Preferred Experience:
Fundamentals of photonic device design and operation from layout to material properties; silicon or III/V
Characterizing photonics for communication
Simple mechanical design, CAD tools like Solidworks
Process development in a manufacturing environment, e.g. statistical process control, gauge R&R, standard operating procedures, out-of-control action plans.
Software design best-practices and an interest in developing code with a clean, scalable, and maintainable architecture.
Something we haven't thought of? We are looking for motivated and independent candidates who can bring unique expertise to stand up opto-electronic test systems!
"Principals only. Recruiters, remuneration for recruiting activities is only applicable subject to a signed and executed agreement between the parties. Please don’t contact our hiring managers."

About Ayar Labs
At Ayar Labs we’re about to revolutionize computing by moving data with light. We’re unleashing processing power for artificial intelligence, high performance computing, and telecommunications by removing the bottlenecks created by today’s electrical I/O - making it possible to continue scaling computing system performance. Ayar Labs is the first to deliver in-package optical I/O chiplets, a new universal I/O solution that replaces traditional electrical I/O and enables chips to communicate with each other from millimeters to kilometers, to deliver orders of magnitude improvements in latency, bandwidth density, and power consumption.

With our strong collaborations with industry leaders and government, our deep ties to MIT and UC Berkeley, and our commitment to hiring the best engineers in photonics and electronics, joining our team gives you the opportunity to collaborate with renowned experts on challenging, paradigm-shifting work.

We are passionate about delivering in-package optical I/O at scale, leveraging the strength of our patent portfolio and our team of leading interdisciplinary experts. We believe that deep cross-collaboration between teams facilitated by honest, open debate is the best way to drive innovation and achieve big wins. Join our team and experience the possibilities.

Resources:
Executives from Intel and GLOBALFOUNDRIES share their thoughts on Ayar Labs and the promise of in-package optical I/O (video)
Ayar Labs in the News and Recent announcements
LinkedIn and Twitter
Ayar Labs is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and is strongly committed to all policies which will afford equal opportunity employment to all qualified persons without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, creed, gender, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

At Dascena, our mission is to develop and implement clinically proven machine learning algorithms to improve patient outcomes. Our innovations help detect disease, improve the delivery of care, and saves lives. In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development with speed. You will be responsible for guiding throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users. As a product manager, you will champion the voice of the user and customer.
What you’ll do:
Understand the healthcare stakeholders, regulations, markets, competition, and user requirements in depth to develop detailed user requirements for Dascena’s machine learning products.
Author product design and development specifications based on user needs.
Launch new products and features, test their performance, and iterate quickly.
In partnership with Clinical, Data Science, Engineering, and Regulatory teams:
Creatively solve product development challenges
Design and execute evidence generation plans to demonstrate patient and health system benefit.
Define regulatory strategy and execution plan.
Proactively consider product deployment needs to ensure optimal user/customer experience.
Define and execute go-to-market strategy (in partnership with Corporate Development, Strategy and Commercial teams)l
Identify potential customers/partners (e.g. direct to health systems, strategic partnerships) and design potential business models for these alternatives.
Define and execute product deployment strategy for the proposed go-to-market approach (partner with Engineering team).
Outline and ensure tracking of key performance indicators for product (e.g. product adoption, customer satisfaction, real world patient outcomes, real world impact on health system utilization).
Work collaboratively with Engineering, Marketing, Legal, UX, and other cross-functional teams on cutting edge technologies.
Develop innovative solutions to some of the toughest healthcare problems by collaborating as needed across product areas, and functions.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.
What you have:
Bachelor’s degree in a technical field or equivalent experience building/shipping technical products.
4 years experience developing/launching products/technologies within healthcare (preferably machine learning algorithm products)
Experience driving product vision, go-to-market strategy, and design discussions.
Experience creating strategic product roadmaps, working with cross-functional teams.
Advanced oral communication skills to effectively present, negotiate, convey and explain information
Advanced written communication skills to draft clear, concise documentation, reports and specifications, roadmaps, executive and client status and business cases.
Working knowledge of implications and ability to meet privacy, legal and risk requirements and achieve product goal outcomes.
What you’ll bring:
Experience managing day-to-day technical and design direction.
Experience in one or more of the following: artificial intelligence/machine learning.
Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI Sales, Customer Support, Finance or Marketing.
Ability to influence multiple stakeholders without direct authority.
Other Information:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
To build a diverse workforce, Dascena encourages applications from individuals with disabilities, minorities, veterans, and women. Dascena is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
**Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.**

JobTitle: Data Engineer III, Patient Data (AI / ML) -- Remote
Content_text:
Data Engineer III, Patient Data (AI/ML) - Remote
Overview of Position
We’re looking for Data Engineers with a passion for artificial intelligence to help drive a new generation of data and machine learning-enabled services and products to impact healthcare supporting Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Data Science solutions for Change Healthcare.

You'll enjoy working with a highly talented and diverse team of Engineers and Data Scientists specializing in deep learning, active learning, and classical machine learning, one of the richest data sets in US healthcare, nearly limitless cloud compute resources including Spark clusters and GPUs, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products.
What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?
Design, build, and launch efficient & reliable data pipelines to move and transform data (both large and small amounts)
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet business requirements
Optimize data delivery and re-design infrastructure for greater scalability.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics.
Design elegant interfaces between internal services and internal customers. Design, build and launch new data extraction, transformation, and loading processes in production.
Work with internal and external stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support data infrastructure needs
What are the requirements needed for this position?
Master's degree in Computer Sciences, or Mathematics OR Bachelors’ degree in Computer Sciences, or Mathematics +3 years of equivalent work experience
2+ years of professional experience building and operating scalable distributed systems across the full software lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, operations, and maintenance
Programming experience in one or more modern programming languages such as Java, Python, Scala, or C++
Cloud technologies (AWS/Azure/Google, Lambda, EMR, EC2, SQS and RDS, etc)
Hands-on experience in tackling massive data sets with Yarn, Spark, Presto, Hive, Impala, etc
Experience with relational databases (SQL, PostgreSQL) and with key value stores (NoSQL databases like Hbase, Cassandra, Hive)
Experience with CI/CD using Jenkins
Familiarity with shell scripting using Bash or Zsh
What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?
Curious - willing to learn new things, and try new things, able to implement prototypes
Communicative - Comfortable presenting to other engineers, sharing ideas, and writing specifications and other documentation
Sense of Urgency - bring an agile, let’s get things done attitude
Prior experience with healthcare data is a plus, but if you don’t have experience with healthcare data we will teach you everything you need to know!
