JobTitle: Vice President, Data Operations - SF or ATL
CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94105 (Financial District/South Beach area)
Content_text:
Description
About this role
At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being! Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress!
The Index Content Steward team (“Index RM”), part of the BlackRock Data & AI organization, is responsible for managing index requirements from internal BlackRock fund managers, and BlackRock Solutions (BRS) clients. BlackRock and its BlackRock Solutions clients utilize these indices as an integral part of investment and risk management, serving as benchmarks for Mutual Funds, ETFs, and Hedge Funds, Pensions, and other products. Index Relationship management team works closely with all index vendors, as well as internal partner teams, Portfolio Management, Index Production, Index Implementation and other BlackRock Data & AI groups.
The Index Content Steward Team is a global team that includes expertise in regional eccentricities.
The Index Content Steward team act as project managers responsible for understanding and detailing client requirements, assessing potential solutions, and ensuring key breakthroughs are met.
Manage all index requests from BlackRock fund managers, including all aspects of rolling out multiple concurrent new indices, across various asset classes and strategies in Aladdin, including requirements capture, vendor data acquisition, data mapping and normalization, process testing and automation, and quality control.
BlackRock Solutions market the Aladdin® platform to external clients. The Content Stewards are responsible for managing the onboarding of all indices required by these clients, this will include working with multiple teams across the BlackRock, to ensure a smooth client implementation and experience.
The Index Content Steward team should understand our client’s needs and work with them to plan for current and future index requirements.
Provide high quality client service externally and internally. Address inquiries and assist in resolving problems from clients and internal BlackRock partners.
Initiate and drive Index platform improvements to support new business needs, minimize risk, and improve quality.
Bachelor’s Degree is required, with preference to business subject areas such as Finance, Accounting, Economics, or technical fields.
BlackRock Solutions Aladdin® implementations require excellent project management skills to ensure that requirements are delivered on time and to specification.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
A “Student of the Markets” mentality: Intellectually curious with a passion for learning about the global financial markets and the investment management business.
Natural team player able to work in an innovative, entrepreneurial, and fast paced environment.
Basic knowledge of SQL is required. Knowledge of UNIX and Python is useful.
5+ years of meaningful experience, preferably in financial services.
BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.
Our benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.
About BlackRock
At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.
This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.
BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.
We recruit, hire, train, promote, pay, and administer all personnel actions without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), sex stereotyping (including assumptions about a person’s appearance or behavior, gender roles, gender expression, or gender identity), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law. We interpret these protected statuses broadly to include both the actual status and also any perceptions and assumptions made regarding these statuses.BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITY

As a Manager of Technology Partnerships, you will be responsible for the mutual success of Legion's technology partnerships based on Legion's APIs. You will be responsible for envisioning, creating, and developing joint solutions that provide new capabilities for our customers. You will work with Legion's and our partner's product and business teams to bring solutions to market. Legion is looking for an energetic go getter that can take a project from concept to realization.

KEY GOALS

Create and deliver new joint solution capabilities to the market for customers

o Develop business case, requirements, and execute product development with Legion technical teams

o Coordinate and drive development with technical teams

o Create product marketing materials with marketing

o Own and improve business process of API creation with partners

Drive the creation of Joint Solution specific messaging and content

o Create joint win customer studies

o Quantifying addressable market with Legion Partners

o Create use cases that help Legion and Partner solutions win

o Promote content and messaging with Partners

Work on critical projects to scale Alliances functions

o Own special projects tied to OKRs (Objective Key Results)

PROFESSIONAL BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum of 5 years of working experience
2+ years of experience with building partner ecosystems
Demonstrated ability to create and execute on a product vision
Self-starter and comfortable in hyper growth start-up environment
Developing content and materials promoting APIs
Successfully managed creation and launch of Saas API based products
Project management experience
BA/BS degree
Preferred experience with Payments and/or Communications platforms

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES AND VALUES

Proactive and able to command respect through intelligence, hard work, and persistence
Personal passion and fervor for industry-leading next-generation technology
Ability to operate in an environment with limited resources
A great communicator who can distill powerful messages which resonate with customers
Track record of building positive relationships with peers
Continuous and thoughtful listener, able to learn from others and leverage input
Strong personal work ethic focused on high priority issues; action and results-oriented

LOCATION

Anywhere in mainland USA and with Internet access.
BACKGROUND AND OPPORTUNITY
Legion is seeking world class talent to help us capitalize on a massive opportunity to enable the future of work for the 2.7 billion-person strong deskless workforce. We have built a cutting edge workforce engagement suite which leverages AI and machine learning to deliver labor efficiency for employers and great experiences for employees across the Retail, Hospitality, and Fitness industries. Legion is backed by preeminent venture firms such as Norwest Venture Partners, First Round Capital, and XYZ Ventures and is based in Redwood City, California.

The hourly workforce currently constitutes almost 60% of the overall labor market in the United States and these nearly 80 million hourly workers are the driving force behind many of our largest domestic industries like food/beverage, retail and hospitality. Management of this workforce has historically been difficult due to high churn (average of 60%), high cost of replacement (average of $3,200 per employee in retail) and now new challenges are developing as millennials enter this market. The retail vertical alone spends $62 billion dollars a year on replacing workers and over 50% of hourly workers leave their jobs because of flexibility reasons.

In our modern, Uber-ized times, younger folks seek gig-like flexibility, modern mobile first technology and compelling work options. They want to use an app on their phone to schedule work, not haggle with the manager over their schedule on a week to week basis. Likewise, employers are increasingly in need of a flexible and efficient labor model that supports the innovations (think pop up stores, home delivery, mobile ordering, service options etc) needed, and frankly demanded, by today's modern customers. Mid market organizations have never had a technology platform to manage their hourly workers and the enterprise is mired in decades old technology (think Kronos, Infor) that's both user unfriendly and wildly ineffective for managing today's modern hourly workforce. There is a huge opportunity to modernize and upgrade how hourly workers interact with their employers and while enabling employers to be elastic, efficient and innovative...but no one has cracked the code until now.

ENTER LEGION
Legion's mission is to build the platform that enables this transition. We have built a workforce engagement solution that applies AI and machine learning to accurately forecast demand and automatically match employees to work. The simple notion of matching work that needs to be done to the best suited employee who wants it and doing so in a fair, compliant and efficient manner is fundamental to today's new job economy. The Legion platform provides flexible, efficient ways for employers and employees to engage with each other and enable the future of work.

At its core, this is a supply versus demand issue. Legion is able to use advanced machine learning to accurately predict how much work needs to be done and by what roles and skills. These forecasts are fully automated and tailored to the unique attributes of every location and take into account factors that impact customer traffic. For instance, rain could decrease customer traffic at an outdoor cafe but would likely increase the volume of delivery orders. Legion now helps you predictably staff for these events, and it gets more and more accurate as it ingests more data. Legion then uses AI to automatically match these forecasts to the best employees based on a wide variety of factors such as employee preference, skill, productivity and labor compliance policies. Likewise all of these rules are easily customizable to a unique business, policies and best practices of every customer. Legion is able to make informed and practical autonomous business decisions for every customer with the simple push of a button.
Legion is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran, disability status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

Job Applicant Privacy Policy

This Job Applicant Privacy Policy ("Policy") describes how Legion Technologies, Inc. ("Legion", "we", "us" and "our") collects, uses, and discloses "personal information" as defined under California law from and about job applicants who are residents of California.

This Policy does not apply to our handling of data gathered about you in your role as a user of our consumer-facing services. When you interact with us as in that role, the Legion Privacy Policy applies.


Types of Personal Information We Handle

We collect, store, and use various types of personal information through the application and recruitment process. We collect such information either directly from you or (where applicable) from another person or entity, such as an employment agency or consultancy, background check provider, or other referral sources. This information includes:

Identification and contact information, and related identifiers such as full name, date and place of birth, citizenship and permanent residence, home and business addresses, telephone numbers, email addresses, and such information about your beneficiaries or emergency contacts.
Professional or employment-related information, including:
Recruitment, employment, or engagement information such as application forms and information included in a resume, cover letter, or otherwise provided through any application or engagement process; and copies of identification documents, such as driver's licenses, passports, and visas; and background screening results and references.
Career information such as job titles; work history; work dates and work locations; information about skills, qualifications, experience, publications, speaking engagements, and preferences; and professional memberships
Education Information such as institutions attended, degrees, certifications, training courses, publications, and transcript information.
Legally protected classification information such as race, sex/gender, religious/ philosophical beliefs, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital status, military service, nationality, ethnicity, request for family care leave, political opinions, and criminal history.
Other information such as any information you voluntarily choose to provide in connection with your job application.

How We Use Personal Information

We collect, use, share, and store personal information from job applicants for our and our service providers' business and operational purposes in the recruitment process such as: processing your application, tracking your application through the recruitment process, contacting references with your authorization, conducting background checks you authorize, and making hiring decisions. We will also use job applicant information for internal analysis purposes to understand the applicants who apply and to improve our recruitment process. We may sometimes need to use applicant information for legal purposes, such as in connection with any challenges made to our hiring decisions.

With Whom We Share Personal Information

We will disclose job applicant personal information to the following types of entities or in the following circumstances (where applicable):

Internally: to other Legion personnel involved in the recruiting and hiring process.
Vendors: such as technology service providers, travel management providers, human resources suppliers, background check companies, and employment agencies or recruiters, where applicable.
Legal Compliance: when required to do so by law, regulation, or court order or in response to a request for assistance by the police or other law enforcement agency.
Litigation Purposes: to seek legal advice from our external lawyers or in connection with litigation with a third party.
Business Transaction Purposes: in connection with the sale, purchase, or merger.
How to Contact Us About this Policy – If you have any questions about this Policy, please contact privacy@legion.co.

JobTitle: Manager, Data Science (Machine Learning) SAN FRANCISCO, CATE...
Content_text:
Who We Are
Tonal is the smartest home gym and personal trainer. It has completely revolutionized the way people work out at home, with its sleek design and advanced A.I. technology. We’ve united a diverse team of experts and decades of research to reinvent strength training, making it more efficient, more effective and more engaging.
With this in mind, we want to bring that same innovative approach to the workplace. At Tonal, we continue our shift of emphasis by growing our instrumental team. We collectively weave our knowledge and creativity, as we redefine the future of fitness. We are passionate about building products that transform lives, and building teams that transform the status quo. Together, we can be our strongest.
Overview
This position can be based out of our headquarters in San Francisco, Toronto, New York, Los Angeles, Austin or remotely.
What You Will Do
Lead a team of passionate data scientists focused on modeling members’ fitness performance and providing weight recommendations
Develop algorithms to sense, understand, and derive insights on human motion while exercising via computer vision, pose detection, and more.
Review the team’s designs, algorithms, and code while also spending time developing your own
Lead the initiative to fully leverage the world's largest and best fitness data set
Collaborate closely with fitness experts on training methodologies; Validate and innovate on new more effective training methodologies using a data-driven approach
Work closely and collaborate with front-end and back-end teams to take the team’s work to production
Drive the direction of Tonal’s architecture, data collection, analytics, infrastructure, tools, and learning systems
Leverage your creativity to identify innovative opportunities for new data-driven features
Who You Are
Advanced degree in engineering, scientific, or mathematical field
5+ years data science experience
2+ years leading and/or managing technical teams
Knowledge of machine learning and signal processing algorithms
Working experience with data filtering and cleansing techniques
Strong knowledge of Python and SQL
Working knowledge of software development, including RESTful APIs
Team player with high integrity
Open to feedback and constantly striving to learn and improve
High degree of self-awareness
Tonal is committed to meeting the diverse needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner that is consistent with the principles of independence, dignity, integration and equality of opportunity. Should you have any accommodation requests, please reach out to us via our confidential email, accessibility@tonal.com. All requests will be addressed and responded to in accordance with Tonal’s Accessibility Policy and local legislation.

JobTitle: newHead Of Partner Solutions Product Management
Content_text:
About The Role
JPMorgan Chase acquired its integrated payments business, WePay, in 2018 on its mission to empower small and medium sized businesses (SMBs) through frictionless access to world-class software and financial services. WePay’s technology provides payments infrastructure to independent software vendors (ISVs) and to other businesses enabling them to integrate payments and other financial solutions into their applications that ultimately serve and empower SMBs.
We are looking for a payments product management leader to join us as the head of our Partner Solutions Product Organization. In this impactful role will have responsibility for leading and executing against a multi-year product strategy to anchor WePay/Chase as the preferred payments provider for our clients. In this highly visible and impactful role you will drive the strategic direction of our product strategies and drive decision-making and investment prioritization.
Your team will own product strategy and deliverables that culminate in great banking and payment experiences for our clients. Your team will work with our customers and partners to understand their needs, develop a strategy with defined objectives and key results. You will lead your team through successful execution of their product roadmap milestones, and collaborate closely with cross functional teams, such as engineering, marketing, commercialization, sales, risk, and operations to drive product initiatives. You will own your team’s products end-to-end with accountability for both delivering new capabilities to market as well achieving the defined key results, such as product adoption, client NPS, and financial results.
You will collaborate with senior leaders of other JPMC lines of business as well as the broader executive team to ensure alignment on strategy, terms, scope, approach, etc. We are looking for someone with the intellectual curiosity to deepen their payments industry knowledge; exceptional communication and organizational skills; and expertise developing commercial agreements and managing and prioritizing issues as they arise.
Most of what you will be working on is ‘new’ and undefined so you will play an instrumental role in creating and defining ‘structure and pathways’ for new ideas to actualize. You will have fun if you thrive working on complicated, envelope pushing, innovative concepts that help SMBs.
What You Will Do:
As a product executive your responsibilities will be inclusive of product vision, product strategy, product design, building and extending partnerships and marketplace ecosystem, product development, and helping in product marketing activities.
Oversee every element of the product roadmap from conception to launch and post-launch performance. You are also responsible for building great products that create sustainable value in terms of customer delight, revenue and profits for the business .
You are expected to follow design thinking methodology, Customer driven product development disciplines to focus on key business personas, identify new stakeholders, and deliver exceptional customer experience.
You will leverage the latest technologies and capabilities within the bank and outside in areas of AI, Machine Learning, Blockchain etc. to create new solutions or transform existing products within the firm.
Scope of ownership will include: business requirement gathering; partner integration strategies and architecture; POCs; creation of an integrated roadmap across products; bridging design and development teams; development of KPIs and tracking of performance metrics; product readiness and commercialization; partner and merchant research and discovery; internal and external feedback integration for agile initial build and for future dot releases, and adoption.
Work closely and collaboratively across various organizations, managing multiple stakeholders and leading by influence.
You will be responsible for recruiting, managing and mentoring junior resources to maximize performance and potential without compromising the firm's values.
You thrive in a culture of innovation, welcome continuous change, big on collaboration and teams, demonstrate an agile mindset and comfortable operating in a lean startup mode.


What We Are Looking For:
A hands-on product leader with a technical background/strong technical acumen and the ability to drive architectural, technical partnership discussions with various internal and external teams, vendors, and stakeholders.
A strong motivating people manager with extensive experience building and leading high-performance teams.
Extensive experience in payments with an in-depth understanding of the payments value chain (merchants, brands, acquirers, networks, issuers) highly preferred.
Expertise in other relevant disciplines including SaaS applications, B2B/B2C digital products, APIs & technology platforms/integrations and eco-system and partnerships .
A strategic thinker with creative problem-solving skills and the ability to translate strategy into action plans and execute on those plans.

Customer obsession. A laser focus on understanding and articulating customer needs and translating those needs into actionable solutions and value-added products and services.
Ability to influence and mobilize internal business partners at various levels to execute new business constructs
Deep experience driving product management in an agile environment leveraging Jira & Confluence.
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities and produce successful results in a fast-paced environment.


About WePay
WePay’s mission is to make commerce seamless. Our products help software companies integrate payments into their applications – thereby empowering small businesses and individuals to get paid easily and quickly using their go-to apps and software. Our customers include BigCommerce, TouchBistro, Meetup, and Freshbooks, just to name a few. By joining forces with JPMorgan Chase, a global financial services firm with over $2.5 trillion in assets that serves millions of customers worldwide, WePay is now able to connect our customers seamlessly into a range of banking services beyond payments. WePay is a unique place to work and offers the best of both worlds. WePay has a FinTech startup culture that emphasizes transparency, collaboration, and career growth, with the ability to work on small, nimble teams. However, now combined with the power of JPMorgan Chase, employees are also able to create change at scale and have an opportunity to truly disrupt and shape FinTech.

You can find more information at wepay.com
To all recruitment agencies: WePay does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, WePay employees, or any other company location. WePay is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Preferred Qualifications
Every day, enterprises around the world focus on how to help their employees work simpler and smarter. And while enterprises are as diverse as the people in them, ranging from global manufacturing field managers, to automotive dealers, to financial advisors, and even public workers in growing cities in the world, they all share many core needs. They need to connect employees with their customers so they in turn can thrive. They need to manage their valuable resources thoughtfully. Customers need to work efficiently with the vendors they depend on. And so much more.
Helping their employees work simpler and smarter means letting enterprises focus on what makes each of them special. They focus on what theyâ€™re best at, and in turn, let Oracle do the rest. The scope of our opportunity is enormous. At Oracle, weâ€™re committed to creating a state-of-the-art consumer-grade CX solution that will be the factor that distinguishes our software from the competition.
Hereâ€™s the kind of person weâ€™re looking forâ€¦
Youâ€™re passionate about CX, CRM and sales force automation (SFA) solutions. You will bring your passion and experience in CRM to advance the Oracle Sales solutionâ€™s ( https://www.oracle.com/cx/sales/ ) next-generation and classic capabilities transforming the selling experience for our customers.
You thrive on working well with others, love a challenge and have no problems adapting to changing business environments. You make the people around you better. You love to collaborate with fellow inbound and outbound product managers, UX designers, engineers, researchers, sales and marketing teams, customer success professionals, technical support, and documentation professionals, and inspire them to do their best with a â€œone teamâ€� mentality.
You enjoy learning, communicating and have no problem multi-tasking while prioritizing projects that are critical to Oracleâ€™s business. Technology excites you, and you believe that customers are first.
Youâ€™re a full cloud product manager. Youâ€™re the functional and technical subject matter expert for one or more areas of the Oracle Sales solution. You deliver features and innovation in the cloud continuously and, in doing so, regularly collaborate with customers and partners to collect and act on product feedback. You look at user stories, functional and interaction designs, product configurations and extensions, sales plays and demos, competitive analysis, marketplace partners, and more as tools in the Product Managerâ€™s essential toolkit. You intuitively know how technology, business requirements and awesome product design are necessary to deliver cloud innovation that delight. You act as a product liaison with engineers and senior product leaders to prioritize product enhancements and coordinate release materials. You have prior experience working in a global environment to deliver and adopt cloud software continuously.
Youâ€™re a fantastic storyteller. You know that our products and services tell our customers a story through the end-to-end Digital Transformation innovation from CRM front office to ERP back-office. You wonâ€™t rest until that Oracle story is a compelling one.
Youâ€™re a leader. As product owner you proactively lead the end-to-end product lifecycle for your product area of focus, including product vision, strategy, product development and delivery, go-to-market, user adoption, evangelism, best practice development, product enhancements, and attain reference customers. Youâ€™re a self-starter with strong opinions about your product area and the market needs it serves. Understanding market and customer needs, you write requirements and collaborate daily with engineers to implement, test, deliver and tune them. As the solution expert you collaborate with other functions supporting the success of your product including outbound product management, sales, professional services, customer success, technical support, and documentation. Youâ€™re comfortable influencing a diverse set of worldwide stakeholders across several functions whose collective work drives the success of your solution.
What are the technical requirements?
3-5 years in cloud enterprise software product life cycle, i.e. product management, development, management, and/or implementation, working with global, cross-functional scrum teams
CRM domain understanding of sales processes, pipeline and forecast methodologies in either Field Sales, Inside Sales, or Sales Operations
Experience in sales and marketing enablement technology
Experienced in CRM web, mobile and email channels, process engineering, pilot and UAT strategy

Experience in bringing creative ideas and proposals to development teams and executives supported by qualitative justification and quantitative analysis to deliver across multiple product pillars
Manage key customer relationships including prioritized enhancement requests and co-development/design projects
Manage customer forums about product areas, such as on Oracle Cloud Customer Connect, leveraging feedback as input into product plans
Manage and participate in customer programs such as customer advisory board meetings
Manage partner forums and use feedback in product roadmaps
Experience working closely with customers on product implementations

High level of initiative to overcome obstacles and drive towards action
Represent our company and team with excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills

What will you do as a Product Manager at Oracle?
You will lead telemetry and user adoption solutions for the Oracle Sales application (https://www.oracle.com/cx/sales/). These solutions gather telemetry from Oracle Sales to measure usage at the end-user, company, and Cloud infrastructure level, providing business and technical insights for external and internal stakeholders. Example insights include how end-users are using Oracle Sales, which users are, and arenâ€™t, using the application, what are they doing in the system, what are their journeys and click-paths, and how long do they spend in each area of the system. These insights provide critical information to help improve user adoption, provide coaching to end users, improve the Oracle Sales solution, and facilitate compliance with contract terms.
As leader of telemetry and user adoption solutions, you will drive the end-to-end product strategy, understand how telemetry is, and can better be used by both customers and Oracle to advance their respective businesses. With this understanding, you will formulate telemetry strategy, drive a vision showcasing how telemetry can be used throughout Oracle Sales to improve sales processes and SFA solutions. Understanding Oracle Sales data models and solutions, you will design the data collection pipeline, write technical requirements, and develop user-facing insights, reports and analyses using modern, interactive visualization solutions helping consumers draw actionable conclusions from these insights.
You will manage telemetry and user adoption solutions for the classic and next-generation versions of Oracle Sales. You will work with customers, partners, the Oracle field, product managers and other stakeholders to help them understand these solutions and collaborate about unmet needs to drive into future solutions.
You will develop and manage systems ensuring that customer usage of Oracle Sales complies with terms of purchase agreements, and you will be point-of-contact for these systems to stakeholders, including the field, customers and product management, and others.
You will build relationships with customers; understand customerâ€™s processes and objectives; and introduce new ways of doing things better and more productive and solicit feedback
You will research competition and market trends and propose roadmap trade-offs between parity and innovation tacking
You will partner closely with your fellow product designers to innovate by creating productive, coherent, seamless, and emotionally resonant, state-of-the-art CRM services for our users.
You will partner closely with our User Experience Design Lead to understand the customers who use our solution, empathize with them, and imagine creative ways we can make their work lives dramatically better.
You will partner closely with your partners in engineering to take your vision and ideas and turn them into reality.
You will partner closely with your colleagues in customer success to get customer feedback on your products, find out where youâ€™ve improved their lives, and find out where you have more work to do.
You will be comfortable working with a globally with geographically dispersed team, in various time zones
You will learn, grow, and be challenged. You will speak up and represent your position amongst peers and leadership, while remaining resilient and open to constructive criticism.
You will sometimes make tough compromises, or find things take longer than you want them to, or need to work extra hard to convince a colleague of your position.
And sometimes, you will get frustrated. But then youâ€™ll remember, that youâ€™re here to help turn Oracle into the place you love to work and have one of the best professional experiences of your life

As a Senior Technical Writer at Databricks, you will apply your considerable writing and technical skills to create compelling content that shows data scientists, data engineers, and data analysts how to use Databricks to solve their toughest machine learning and AI problems.

To succeed in this role, you must have the technical background to learn bleeding-edge big data tools very quickly. You must be passionate about writing, with a focus on clarity, straightforward storytelling, and an information architect's approach to organizing material. The work is going to come fast and furious— we are growing at an unprecedented rate—-but you'll never let up on your attention to detail or your advocacy for the customer. If this sounds exciting, we want to hear from you!

The impact you will have:

Write content:
Write high-impact documentation for all parts of the data science and data engineering lifecycle, including deployment and configuration guidance for IT and devops engineers, user guidance for data scientists and data engineers, API and command references, tutorials, walkthroughs, sample apps, and best practices guides
Collaborate closely with engineers and product managers to develop effective feature documentation
Collaborate closely with customer-facing technical staff (support engineers, solutions architects, developer relations) on best practices, onboarding material, and other scenario-based guidance
Contribute to doc site infrastructure and information architecture improvements:
Help doc team develop a persona-driven and use-case-based information-architecture approach to organizing contents
Help doc team in its continual effort to improve authoring and production tools and processes
Edit content and manage approvals:
Edit content contributed by engineering and the field for technical accuracy, grammar, usage, adherence to style, and fit within information architecture
Manage contributed articles through technical review, content edits, and publication

What we look for:

Writing and editing:
5+ years documenting sophisticated technologies for developers and IT professionals, or equivalent work experience (as a software developer, product manager, or solutions architect, for example)
Experience documenting SDKs, APIs, and similar tools
Mastery of the tools of the technical writer and editor: consistent voice, straightforward and lively style, understanding (or intuition!) of the rules of grammar and usage
Demonstrated understanding of information architecture concepts and how to apply them
Teamwork:
Excellent interpersonal communication skills
Proven project management skills
Entrepreneurial, "can-do" approach
Technical:
Proficiency in HTML, lightweight markup, and Git
Understanding of cloud and distributed data infrastructure
Basic proficiency in at least one programming language
Basic SQL proficiency and understanding of relational databases
Strong analytical skills, with excellent problem-solving abilities
Obsession with technical accuracy and attention to detail
Bonus:
Experience working with big data technologies (data warehouse, data analytics, ETL)
The ability to understand and test code samples in one of the following: Python, Java, Scala, R
Experience performing data analysis to drive decision-making
Experience developing short video tutorials
Experience creating effective and attractive diagrams

About Databricks

Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 5,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, H&M, and over 40% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Lakehouse Platform to unify their data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow, Databricks is on a mission to help data teams solve the world’s toughest problems.

We have an immediate opening for a Senior Associate Director/Director (Director/VP), Corporate Communications & Digital to join our growing West Coast presence. We are entrepreneurial, collaborative, diverse and curious. Clients come to us to help solve challenging problems, create new ideas and campaigns, and move their business forward. We believe in the power of communication to affect change and we are excited by purposeful work.
At APCO, you’ll have the opportunity to work across disciplines, including corporate communications, sustainability and corporate responsibility. Here in the West, we work with clients mainly in the tech, healthcare, sustainability, and nonprofit sectors.

Responsibilities:
Play a central role in driving business development and growth strategy, with a focus on the technology and digital health sectors
Organize teams around business development opportunities and manage proposal process ensuring accurate scoping/budgeting of opportunity
Develop and lead integrated issue and advocacy campaigns, and corporate and brand reputation assignments that demonstrate a robust understanding of digital and social media platforms, target audiences and measurement
Provide strategy-driven client service as a leader of significant accounts within the region
Counsel clients and troubleshoot client and internal issues
Lead brainstorms and other creative idea-generation sessions to produce effective approaches to addressing client challenges in the marketplace
Maintain self-driven passion and curiosity to stay abreast of current industry trends affecting clients, and be able to analyze and make strategic recommendations regarding communication strategy surrounding both identified and emerging issues
Demonstrate writing excellence when crafting internal and client materials and correspondence
Oversee financial and operational performance of multiple accounts simultaneously, ensuring quality work, deadline and budget adherence, and that plan creation and execution map to goals
Actively participate in external committees, boards, chambers to increase the visibility of APCO
Supervise staff by mentoring, motivating, coaching, consistently providing feedback, holding them accountable and conducting their reviews
Contribute to APCO thought leadership with novel, holistic approaches and a unique POV on the industry
Contribute to social storytelling strategies and effectively develops stories for multi-channel distribution and promotion
Oversee the execution of programs that boost client content on demand, reach new and specialty audiences, and help drive program performance goals
Lead and support the development of experience enhancing solutions (i.e. VR, 360 video, etc.) that are active and/or emerging in the marketplace
Help clients and teams to activate, parse or source large amounts of data to make it useful for specific stakeholders, especially using integrated data analysis and visualization platforms and technologies such as artificial intelligence
Demonstrate experience and a passion for the digital media tech landscape including social media platforms and digital analytics, monitoring and research tools
Qualifications:
A minimum of 12-15 years of relevant experience in corporate communications or related fields, such as marketing communications, public relations, executive communications; agency experience desired
Knowledge of regional technology and digital health sectors
Proven experience leading integrated communications campaign and brand reputation assignments that span digital, social and traditional channels
Proven track record in driving significant business, along with previous experience managing people and budgets
Exceptional writing and editing skills, and the ability to write both strategically and creatively under tight deadlines
Strong presentation skills and the ability to communicate effectively at all levels.
Ability to work collaboratively, take initiative, set priorities and lead a team
Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, a solution-oriented attitude and a growth mindset
Experience with qualitative and quantitative research methods and platforms
Demonstrated ability to apply research insights to strategy development
Successful track record of delivering strategically-thoughtful projects that deliver measurable impact
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a related field
Founded in 1984, APCO Worldwide is an award-winning, independently owned global communication and business strategy firm with offices in major cities throughout North America, Europe, the Middle East and Asia. APCO combines a global perspective with local expertise to help clients around the world manage challenges, opportunities, perceptions and reputations. APCO clients include corporations and governments; industry associations and nonprofit organizations; and many top Fortune 500 companies. The firm is a majority women-owned business.
APCO Worldwide, named one of the Best Agencies to Work For in North America by PRovoke Media for four consecutive years and a 2020 Top Places to Work in PR by PRNews, offers a collegial work environment, countless training and development opportunities, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.

As a Partner Solutions Architect for AWS you will work with the AWS technical field, your teammates, customers and product teams to lead the adoption of the Databricks Lakehouse Platform on the AWS platform. You will broaden familiarity with the Databricks product and its fit with the AWS architecture by being a technical ambassador towards the AWS Solution Architect community and by building 'technical champions' through enablement.

Working with the AWS field teams, you will help our customers to achieve tangible data-driven outcomes, helping data teams complete projects and integrate our platform into their enterprise Ecosystem and AWS deployment. As a member of our team, you will exercise and develop expertise in those areas, using open-source projects such as Apache Spark, MLflow, and Delta Lake; and AWS infrastructure and services. You will use this expertise to become a trusted advisor to our AWS partners and our joint customers. You will report to the Director of Partner Solutions Architects for AMER.

Partner with AWS field teams to help them stay skilled on Databricks, understand where Databricks fits in the AWS architecture and how Databricks can help solve their customer's technical and business problems

Lead go to market events such as AWS Devdays and Summits and customer workshops, hackathons, and webinars
Provide technical leadership for AWS and customers to understand, evaluate, and ultimately adopt Databricks.

Pre-sales or post-sales experience working with external clients or partners across a variety of industry markets
Understanding of customer-facing pre-sales or consulting role with a core strength in either data engineering or data science
Experience demonstrating technical concepts, including presenting and whiteboarding
Experience of the AWS Cloud platform core foundational native services and expertise in the Data & AI first party services
Coding experience in SQL, Python, Scala, or Java
Experience with Big Data technologies, including Spark, AI, Data Science, Data Engineering, Hadoop, Cassandra, and others
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or equivalent experience through work experience

Want to help the largest global enterprises derive business value through the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)? Excited by using massive amounts of disparate data to develop ML models? Eager to learn to apply ML to a diverse array of enterprise use cases? Thrilled to be a part of Amazon who has been pioneering and shaping the world’s AI/ML technology for decades?

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are helping large enterprises build ML models on the AWS Cloud. We are applying predictive technology to large volumes of data and against a wide spectrum of problems. AWS Professional Services works together with AWS customers to address their business needs using AI solutions.

AWS Professional Services is a unique consulting team. We pride ourselves on being customer obsessed and highly focused on the AI enablement of our customers. If you have experience with AI, including building ML models, we’d like to have you join our team. You will get to work with an innovative company, with great teammates, and have a lot of fun helping our customers. A successful candidate will be a person who enjoys diving deep into data, doing analysis, discovering root causes, and designing long-term solutions.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer-facing role and you will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services as needed.

Major responsibilities include:

Assist customers by being able to deliver a ML project from beginning to end, including understanding the business need, aggregating data, exploring data, building & validating predictive models, and deploying completed models with concept-drift monitoring and retraining to deliver business impact to the organization
Use AWS AI services (e.g., Personalize), ML platforms (SageMaker), and frameworks (e.g., MXNet, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SparkML, scikit-learn) to help our customers build ML models
Research and implement novel ML approaches, including hardware optimizations on platforms such as AWS Inferentia
Work with our other Professional Services consultants (Big Data, IoT, HPC) to analyze, extract, normalize, and label relevant data, and with our Professional Services engineers to operationalize customers’ models after they are prototyped
Master’s degree of PhD in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
Ability to develop strategic, baselined, data modeling processes; ability to accurately determine cause-and-effect relationships.
Publications or presentations in recognized ML journals or conferences
Deep technical skills, consulting experience, and business savvy to interface with all levels and disciplines within our customers’ organization
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment

About our Company
Founded in 2013, NovaSignal Corp. is a medical technology company whose mission is to save lives by unlocking the hidden power of blood flow data. We get up every day with the goal of making the world a better place by improving the lives of people suffering from traumatic injuries such as stroke. Our AI-driven, robotic ultrasound system is revolutionizing healthcare and will help millions of people across the globe as we continue to expand our reach. We are looking for people to join our rapidly growing team who are not afraid to roll up their sleeves, get to work, and make a difference in the world.
Summary of Position
The Data Scientist will be responsible for development of innovative, data-driven brain health diagnostic algorithms and software. This individual will join a team responsible for digital signal processing, data mining and machine learning activities that will deliver innovative features to NovaSignal’s line of products.
Attributes of a Successful Candidate
You know that it is important to define customer pain-points with high specificity before you analyze a bit of data.
You excel in design of experiments and take pride in your analytical skills.
You are data- and results-driven (maybe some pun is intended).
Essential Functions
Lead the development efforts of novel machine learning and analytical models combining multi-modal physiological data including cerebral blood flow velocity waveforms, electrocardiograms, medical history and other clinical factors.
Define problems and identify innovative solutions specific to the problem.
Lead or participate in research and technical projects in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
Develop simulations, perform analysis and provide actionable insights to team for improved product development.
Built robust production level software that is well tested and documented.
Work closely with senior staff to provide state of the art machine learning solutions to the technological challenges in the neural prognostics space.
Requirements for Senior Data Scientist
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Bioinformatics or related technical field or equivalent practical experience
3+ years of professional data science experience
Core strength in programming (Python, C/C++, Java)
Experienced software development skills within a structured architecture
Track record of applied statistics knowledge and skills
Outstanding problem definition and design of experiment skills; has a track record of applying analytical skills to deliver successful products
PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Bioinformatics or related technical field or equivalent practical experience is desired
Track record of writing peer-reviewed publications
Strengths in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms and software engineering is highly desired
Experience in successful projects with physiological data will make you stand out
Applicants with greater experience, leadership and track record will apply for Principal Data Scientist

C3.ai, Inc. (NYSE:AI) is a leading provider of Enterprise AI software for accelerating digital transformation. C3 AI has an opening for a Financial Systems Administrator located at our offices in Redwood City, CA.

Your Responsibilities:

Work as a member of the IT team who is responsible for the security of financial applications within the company and assigning of user permissions.
Experience with NetSuite, Microsoft Dynamics, Office 365 and Azure Active Directory
Familiar with the implementation of AAD Single Sign On and SAML
Responsible for support and maintenance of finance applications.
Troubleshoot with partners across the organization to solve data and technical issues
Develop, document, and implement policies, procedures and guidelines to ensure data integrity, change protocols, customization
Support SOX and security requirements including managing data and access controls to the financial systems
Maintain confidentiality of company programs, activities, records and financial information
Work with Technology and Finance teams and partners to design new processes in NetSuite using standard functionality, customizations, and 3rd party integrations

Requirements:

3+ years' experience in administration of NetSuite and Dynamics solutions for a large enterprise preferably at a SaaS Company
Demonstrate full understanding of the NetSuite stack and experience with NetSuite modules (Order to Cash, Revenue Recognition (606), Procurement, GL, AP, AR, FA, etc.)
Understanding of software such as OpenAir, ADP, Concur, FloQast, and other financial applications/tools a plus.
Ability to balance technical skills with business savvy, ability to transform end-user needs/functional requirement into technical requirements and build these unique solutions
Proficient in MS Office, Jira, database management, cloud applications
Advanced skills in business analysis with the capability to capture requirements and make recommendations on the best way to implement the requirements to meet overall business goals
Certified as a NetSuite Administrator or other Microsoft Dynamics Administration Certification.
BS Degree in Computer science or related field

C3 AI provides a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits including:

Competitive salary, generous stock options, 401K, medical, dental, and vision benefits. At the office, we offer a fully stocked kitchen with catered breakfast and lunch, table tennis and pool table, free membership at our on-site gym, Friday evening social hours with food, drink and music and a fun team of great people.

Hive is the leading provider of cloud-based enterprise AI solutions to power the next wave of intelligent automation. We offer a portfolio of best-in-class deep learning models, built with consensus-validated training data sourced and annotated by our distributed workforce of more than 2 million contributors globally. Hive's APIs enable use cases including automated content moderation, contextual advertising, advertising and sponsorship measurement, document parsing, and more. We process billions of API requests per month for many of the world's largest and most innovative companies.
Hive has raised over $120M in capital from leading investors, including General Catalyst, 8VC, Glynn Capital, Jericho Capital, Bain & Company, Visa Ventures, and others. We have over 170 employees globally in our San Francisco and Delhi offices. Please reach out if you are interested in joining the future of AI!
Accounting Manager Role
The Accounting team at Hive is crucial to the financial health and success of the company as it is responsible for all of our financial and operational processes. As our Accounting Manager, you will work closely with our finance and business teams to provide top-notch guidance and expertise in order to maintain efficiency and accuracy within the accounting department. You will manage and perform general accounting functions such as preparing financial reports and analysis, providing audit support, reconciling bank accounts, reviewing and maintaining ledgers, and assisting with payroll. Our ideal candidate will be able to provide transparency on the overall performance of the company and utilize their knowledge to continually implement measures for improvement.
Responsibilities
Partner with our VP of Finance on accounting functions and operations to create transparency and efficiency within the financial department
Responsible for accurate accounting of costs, maintaining accurate and complete documentation
Assist with preparing consolidated account schedules and quarterly reporting packages
Manage the accounting and analysis of revenue and gross-to-net models
Assist in modeling forecasted gross-to-net projections to provide insights
Be an essential part of the annual audit and quarterly reviews with external auditors, the accounting team, and executive management
Execute month-end close activities including analysis, journal entries, and balance sheet reconciliations
Prepare, review and provide accurate financial analyses and key performance indicators to the Executive team in a timely manner
Assist with payroll process and payroll reporting when needed and per union payroll and prevailing wage requirements
Maintain internal control and safeguards to mitigate risks
Assist with all local, and federal tax filings and reporting requirements
Identify and implement process improvements and automation to reduce time to close and improve accuracy of underlying accounting records
Assist in ad hoc analysis and projects as required
Requirements
A Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
5-7 years of relevant accounting experience, preferably in a Big 4 accounting firm
CPA certification preferred
Possess a good sense of financial analysis skills and deep understanding of accounting concepts
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills with a demonstrated ability to communicate and work effectively with multiple functional areas in a collaborative, team environment
Highly proficient in Excel and Powerpoint
Have demonstrated success in a competitive, entrepreneurial environment
Highly self-motivated and ambitious in achieving goals
A critical thinker who can foresee potential obstacles and consider alternative approaches
Possess a strong sense of urgency to respond to and address the needs of the company
Who We Are
We are a group of ambitious individuals who are passionate about creating a revolutionary AI company. At Hive, you will have a steep learning curve and an opportunity to contribute to one of the fastest growing AI start-ups in San Francisco. The work you do here will have a noticeable and direct impact on the development of the company.
Thank you for your interest in Hive and we hope to meet you soon!

C3 AI is looking for a Product Operations Analyst who thrives in a fast-paced environment.  The Product Operations Analyst will analyze current processes, develop KPIs, build metrics to help overall product execution and efficiency. JobTitle: Associate Director of Data Architecture - Telecommute
Content_text:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)
In 2019 Optum announced a broad, first-of-its-kind partnership with John Muir Health that will leverage data analytics tools to deliver quality, affordable care to patients in the Bay Area: https://healthitanalytics.com/news/optum-john-muir-health-use-data-analytics-to-improve-patient-care . As Optum supports John Muir Health in this strategic transformation it will be critical that the Analytics team provides high quality deliverables that support operations and decision-making, while also creating leading capabilities in predictive analytics and use of novel data sources.
Serving as a key member of the Analytics Leadership Team, the Associate Director of Data Architecture will lead the strategy and transformation of the Data Architecture team and capabilities to support the overall Analytics transformation. The team is shifting from an ecosystem focused primarily around an Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) to one that more greatly utilizes Epic advanced reporting capabilities and Optum Performance Analytics (OPA) in addition to the EDW. In parallel the team is improving data architecture standards and quality. The Associate Director of Data Architecture will own the roadmap, the alignment of the various tools to use cases, the planning for what data sources to include in each, and the technical aspects of data governance needed to ensure quality and consistency across the platforms. We are looking for a strong and supportive leader who can motivate a team of high performers towards our future state vision while helping them achieve their individual growth goals.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead technical strategy and road-mapping efforts
Facilitate evaluation and selection of new tools
Design and implement technical aspects of Data Governance program
Negotiate positive and productive collaboration models with other parts of the extended Analytics team and other teams
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders within and outside the Data Architecture team, using diplomacy to balance the needs of customers and employees
Manage and mentor Analytics resources within a matrixed leadership model. Drive talent management planning inclusive of performance, retention, and career pathing
Participate in budget planning
Implement new quality standards and processes using change management best practices
Take accountability for team performance while accelerating team members’ leadership growth and challenges

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
4+ years of experience working with common data systems used by health care delivery systems (e.g., EHR, patient management, claims adjudication, financial, workforce management, care management)
2+ years of experience managing data architects or data engineers
Proficiency using MS-SQL for Complex Data Management
Willingness to travel up to 10% (typically to Walnut Creek, CA)
Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance
Preferred Qualifications:
Proficiency in SQL
Advanced degree (Masters or higher) or certifications in information technology, engineering, math, computer science, analytics, engineering, or another related field
Advanced Certifications in analytics, analytical platforms, business, human organizational development, information systems, data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, product development, Agile, project management, process improvement, or related areas
Leadership experience in a transformation environment
Experience building and optimizing source data marts and subject area data marts within Health Catalyst
Multiple Epic Certifications
Epic Clarity and/or Caboodle experience
Experience with Optum Performance Analytics (OPA), OptumOne, ImpactPro, Humedica, Symmetry groupers and/or other Optum analytic products
Leadership experience within in a data governance program
Demonstrable success working in a matrixed or cross-functional team environment
UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.
Careers with Optum . Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $94,500 to $171,700. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.
*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.
Job Keywords: Associate Director of Data Architecture , Telecommute, Telecommuter, Telecommuting, Work at Home, Work from Home, Remote

CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94103 (South of Market area)+4 locations
Content_text:
Sr. Software Engineer - AI Platform
About the role:
Engages with stakeholders across teams to lead the development and maintenance of backend services and solutions to support user-facing products, downstream services, or infrastructure tools and platforms used across Uber.
About the Team:
If you have production experience at scale and you want more exposure to Machine Learning at scale, then we are the team for you. We are a team within the Uber AI Platform (better known as Uber Michelangelo) that is paving the way for Data-centric ML. We pioneered the use of the Uber ML Feature Store as a fundamental building block of the ML lifecycle across the industry - which powers models at Uber for training and serving at millions of QPS with very low latencies. Our ongoing mission is to develop MLOps infrastructure and tools to create high quality features and labels for use in machine models, with the goal of fully automating the lifecycle of feature engineering at Uber and beyond. We work closely with Data Science and Machine Learning teams across Uber to develop algorithms and tooling for sharing, discovery, computation, selection, transformation and monitoring of features and embeddings.
Minimum qualifications:
PhD or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field AND 2-years full-time Software Engineering work experience OR 5-years full-time Software Engineering work experience, WHICH INCLUDES 3-years total technical software engineering experience in one or more of the following areas:
Programming language (e.g. C, C++, Java, Python, or Go)
Note the 3-years total of specialized software engineering experience may have been gained through education and full-time work experience, additional training, coursework, research, or similar (OR some combination of these). The years of specialized experience are not necessarily in addition to the years of Education & full-time work experience indicated.
Technical skills:
Required:
Distributed systems
Preferred:
Production experience with low-latency microservices at scale in distributed cloud environments
Production experience with scalable data processing at scale in distributed cloud environments
Production experience with feature Engineering Lifecycle in ML systems
Production experience with applying Information Theory concepts in building scalable feature selection algorithms
Experience with building feature embeddings from high dimensional feature sets
Demonstrated use of ML techniques in Personalization or Recommendation Systems
Production experience with product engineering
Production experience with scalable engineering at scale in distributed cloud environments
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world!
We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have a curiosity, passion and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together!
Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94107 (South Of Market area)
Content_text:
THE ROLE:
As an Analyst within the Analytics team, you will be responsible for digital analysis & support for Xaxis' programmatic advertising campaigns. You will leverage multiple measuring & reporting platforms to conduct analysis and data evaluation to help drive the success of our online campaigns.
YOUR IMPACT:
Use your technical understanding of programmatic buying, audience buying, and DSPs to provide complete strategic recommendations to ensure successful optimization of campaigns through the effective understanding of client objectives.
Creating and maintain dashboards for all clients within Datorama.

Analyze campaign objectives and performance data to identify new opportunities for measurement and analytics solutions.

Develop customized reports to track and optimize campaign performance.
Manage the performance and pacing reporting for multiple stakeholders throughout the organization.
Through the use of reporting, perform QA testing to ensure tags are function properly.
Develop and deliver insights/analytics presentations across multiple accounts under the leadership of senior analytics & account staff.
Draw on expertise of functional experts to continually develop skills and capabilities.
Manage project execution while being mentored on best practices.
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree, with a concentration in advertising, marketing, statistics, economics, finance, computer science, mathematics or engineering OR Associate's degree with at least 2 years of experience (including Internships) within the online advertising industry with a focus on analysis and reporting
2 years' relevant work experience (digital media experience desired)
General understanding of SQL
Understanding of online marketing and web metrics
Basic knowledge of tagging and online tracking
Proficiency in Excel with the ability to review, analyze and present advertising reporting
Prior experience with relevant start-ups, DSPs, agencies, and trading desks preferred
Experience using data visualization tools such as Dataroma and DataStudio and Tableau
Knowledge of various measurement and campaign measurement technologies, Including DSPs, advertising platforms, viewability verification providers.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
ABOUT XAXIS:
Xaxis is the outcome media company.
Xaxis combines innovative AI technology, advanced omnichannel solutions, data-driven creative, and worldwide programmatic expertise to transform digital media investments into real business outcomes.
GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.

C3 AI has an opening for a Sr. Finance Manager located at our offices in Redwood City. We are looking for an analytical, self-motivated individual who is experienced working in a high-growth environment. The ideal person will have experience developing scalable, repeatable, processes and tools. They will manage and enhance financial reporting packages for the business. They will be a key member of balance a positive, collaborative attitude with a willingness to roll-up-their sleeves, allowing them to seamlessly function as a strong individual contributor, project leader, and team player. This role will report directly to the Director, FP&A.

Responsibilities:

Manage the execution of Company-wide end-to-end corporate forecasting, planning & reporting cadence and workstreams on behalf of C3 AI's Executive leadership.
Develop meaningful analyses around financial statements and KPI performance to drive continuous improvement in forecast accuracy and actionable, prescriptive, and predictive analytics.
Own the preparation of quarterly Management and Board reporting
Analyze and articulate risk and opportunities to plan and forecast.
Maintain forecast and review preparation of financials on a Quarterly, Annual, and Multi-Year forecast
Maintain and enhance weekly reporting cadence of financials and key metrics
Maintain and communicate departmental budgets and budget vs. actual analysis
Communicate drivers of variances to plan and forecast
Create meaningful analysis of spending trends for both people and vendor-based spend to provide analysis required for ROI-based framework
Manage facilities capacity planning
Aid accounting team in close review process to ensure accurate accruals are maintained
Preparation and review of executive and board level presentation materials
Support investor relations with ad hoc requests
Lead impactful projects with multiple work streams within scope and budget
Spearhead financial process & systems improvements to support company growth.
Partner with the Accounting team to ensure accounting principles and guidelines are accurately reflected in planning and forecast processes and deliverables.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a quantitative discipline
CPA, CFA, or MBA preferred
8+ years of experience across FP&A at a high-growth SaaS company, investment banking, or corporate development
Understanding of SaaS business models and operating metrics
Proven ability and experience designing, building, and implementing key FP&A forecasting or planning cadence, processes, and tools
Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment, and implementing scalable solutions, processes, and tools.
Very high attention to detail, process oriented and systems savvy
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Advanced proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint
Netsuite experience a plus
