Capgemini Engineering combines, under one brand, a unique set of strengths from across the Capgemini Group: the world leading engineering and R&D services of Altran – acquired by Capgemini in 2020 - and Capgemini's digital manufacturing expertise. With broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software, Capgemini Engineering supports the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Combined with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has more than 52,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including aeronautics, automotive, railways, communications, energy, life sciences, semiconductors, software & internet, space & defence, and consumer products.


Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided every day by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 270,000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2020 global revenues of €16 billion.


Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com
Our offer
Altran Americas is seeking an experienced corporate counsel to manage commercial transactions and a variety of other corporate matters. The ideal candidate will have 5-10 plus years of relevant legal experience with a strong background in contract drafting and negotiation. This position is open to candidates in the San Mateo, CA, New York City, or Boston area(s) and reports to Altran North America’s Deputy General Counsel.
Altran Innovative Product Development (IPD) consists of around 150 US-based engineers working in small teams to develop a variety of complex systems in partnership with our clients.

Altran IPD focuses on the critical challenge of bringing products from concept to production-ready release, balancing speed and agility in delivery with an emphasis on creating reliable, supportable and extensible designs. Our engineers are not distracted by the ongoing and unpredictable demands of supporting existing products and instead are able to maintain a focus on driving the new development efforts. Thus, our teams move at a very rapid pace, delivering exciting results for our clients and maximizing the learning opportunities for our employees.

Altran provides a full complement of technology consulting, software and product development services to clients ranging from established startups to Fortune 500 companies, in industries such as medical devices, healthcare information systems, industrial automation, autonomous vehicles and capital equipment.

At Altran you will face a steady stream of new client challenges and work with a variety of talented coworkers, as you keep pace with the technological trends driving each generation of new products.
For more information, visit www.altran.com/us/en/
Your role
Draft, negotiate, and review a broad range of commercial agreements including master services agreements, software licenses (inbound and outbound), vendor agreements, and partnership agreements.
Advise business and cross-functional stakeholders in client management, human resources, operations, facilities, and finance on legal issues, compliance matters and applicable legal terms and negotiation strategies.
Be a key contributor to our legal team’s efforts in preparation and implementation of our legal processes, policies, templates, and practices, and related trainings, including but not limited to anti-corruption, data privacy, and intellectual property.
Support the legal department in other areas as needed.
Consult with and manage outside counsel on litigation matters or external projects.
Your profile
5-10 years of relevant legal experience, ideally with a combination of law firm training and at least one in-house role at a technology company.
Demonstrated experience with commercial contract drafting and negotiating with multi-national companies, especially in an in-house environment. Candidate must have strong familiarity with drafting and negotiating intellectual property, warranty, indemnity and liability clauses.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with meticulous attention to detail.
Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects, work in a fast-paced environment and to effectively communicate legal issues and policies to senior management.
High degree of independence, initiative and decisiveness.
Great business and practical legal judgment.
JD and/or LLM with a license to practice law.

Facebook AI’s mission is to advance the state-of-the-art in artificial intelligence through fundamental and applied research in open collaboration with the community. Our work covers the full spectrum of topics related to AI, including deriving knowledge from data: Theory, algorithms, applications, software infrastructure and hardware infrastructure. We actively engage with the community through publications, open source software, participation in technical conferences and workshops, and collaborations with academia.We are looking for a Program Manager to build and scale global programs to strengthen the impact of our engineering and research teams. We drive efficiency, cultivate relationships, increase knowledge sharing, and facilitate meaningful external collaborations and partnerships. In this role, you will define, establish, and maintain project-specific and org-wide programs as well as create, manage, and scale processes to build capacity and support the growing organization.The ideal candidate is entrepreneurial, comfortable navigating ambiguous situations, anticipating project issues and resolving them, connecting resources and removing barriers. This role requires project and program management experience and broad knowledge of research's impact on product design and development. Communication skills, stakeholder management, experience managing complex logistics, and an organized approach are mandatory.


Define and manage strategic initiatives that improve team efficiency and impact, establishing operational systems and outcomes
Proactively identify and partner with stakeholders on internal processes, templates, and guidelines to improve team optimization and documentation
Proactively manage expectations: Define clear program roadmaps, provide frequent program updates, identify and communicate risks and adjustments, and ensure commitments are delivered
Manage relationships with cross-functional partners, such as Design, Legal, and Policy


Bachelor's degree
4+ years experience as a program or project manager, or similar role
4+ years of experience establishing and growing end-to-end, cross-functional programs


Experience working with technical teams, especially in machine learning or artificial intelligence
Experience building relationships with peers and senior stakeholders and collaborating with cross-functional teams across multiple locations
Experience communicating with data to drive change
Track record of operating independently and taking initiative, embracing ambiguity, demonstrating creativity, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a highly organized manner
Experience in a dynamic, fast-paced environment that requires independent time management, task prioritization, flexibility, and keen experience to identify problems and proactively work towards solutions


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Description:

Are you mechanically and electrically inclined? Do you like providing customers with quality service solutions? Join our team at United Service Technologies and become a part of one of the leading providers of commercial food equipment service.
Who are we?
United Service Technologies has been in business for over 20 years and is a trusted source for Commercial Food Equipment Service. We have over 100 associates in CA, NV, and TX who serve as valued partners to our customers. Our employees are dedicated to providing the best customer service and demonstrate the UST core values of dedication, accuracy, and good communication while being positive and teachable. Our purpose is to lead our industry, value our partners and care for our employees.
About the opportunity:
You will work with customers to electrically/mechanically troubleshoot, diagnose, repair, and maintain a variety of commercial food equipment.
You will typically work with minimal direct supervision at customer sites.
You will be paid from the moment you leave your home in the morning to the moment you return in the afternoon (“port to port”)
You will meet or surpass weekly productivity and customer-oriented goals while maintaining a high level of customer service.
Why work for us?
Competitive pay based on experience and performance
Benefits - medical, dental, vision
Paid vacation and holidays
401K with company match up to 4%
On-the-job and classroom training
Merged reality/virtual interaction tech support for troubleshooting
Use of AI software for diagnostics/troubleshooting
Service vehicle, uniforms, tools, and safety equipment provided
Safety-conscious work environment
UST is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
. Requirements:

You must have 0-2 years of similar electrical/mechanical experience. UST will provide training for the right candidates with little to no experience. Special consideration and compensation will be given to technicians with 5 or more years of similar electrical, mechanical, gas, and steam experience.
You must have a valid Driver’s License and ability to drive multiple hours daily.
You must be able to work Overtime and On-Call as required.
You must be able to attend training at our facility in Placentia, CA.
Physical Requirements:
Lifting 50-75 lbs. with or without assistance
Climbing up to 10 ft. with ladder
Occasional roof access may be necessary
Extensive walking up to 3-5 miles/day
Extensive driving up to 5-6 hours/day
Kneeling, squatting, bending, pushing/pulling
Exposure to noise, heat, cold, slippery, wet, dirty conditions

CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94103 (South of Market area)
Content_text:
Overview
Intuit is the global leader in financial management software. We are pioneering the shift to cloud computing for consumers, small businesses and those that serve them. We are rethinking how we can impact customer’s financial lives so profoundly they would never go back to the old way. This means dramatically rethinking how we can enable small businesses to run their businesses with confidence, and save time by using both our cloud solutions and our partners.
Come join the QuickBooks Acquisition Marketing Team as the Head of Web Marketing & Strategy responsible for the growth of the QuickBooks suite of products via our website. As the leader of the web team, your responsibility is full ownership and management of the QuickBooks.com website driving aggressive growth both short term and long. This role requires strong cross-discipline leadership skills, as you will partner closely with our marketing technology, analytics, creative, finance, paid media, and search teams to deliver personalized, best in class experiences across desktop and mobile.
The QuickBooks Acquisition Marketing Team is seeking a seasoned Leader who has a proven track record in developing forward looking web strategies and driving high growth returns.
What you'll bring
10+ years of experience managing large scale web properties, preferably in ecomm or retail
Strong technical knowledge spanning AI based personalization, rapid testing platforms, CDPs, data capture/storage/processing, etc. and basic knowledge of media technology, tracking, data needs
Strong track record of bringing to life complex innovation initiatives from concept through deployment
Experience working with atomic design/web systems and in an agile environment
Skilled at understanding dynamic organizations, interdependencies, and develop project plans that navigate them
Customer first mentality able to bring outside-in perspective when problem solving
Great storyteller who can create a vision, build excitement, and bring people along in the journey
Able to distill and communicate complex concepts in understandable, relatable and executive friendly ways
Self-starter attitude who sees ambiguity as an opportunity
Skilled at analyzing diverse sets of data to develop insights and support business cases
Strong results orientation and decision making skills
How you will lead
Leading, motivating, and growing the careers of 15+ person team
Using customer insights and data to develop the vision and strategies for how we will achieve our one, three, and five year goals
Continuing to evolve the web capabilities embracing modern marketing approaches and leading with best in class experiences
Leading the development of the learning agenda and testing calendar in partnership with product marketing and analytics counterparts
Overseeing the deployment of rapid testing/optimizations and clearly communicating the results and implications to the broader organization
Developing necessary requirements and scopes with technical resources to deliver timely solutions (MVP, trade-offs, balance short- and long-term).
Working closely with finance and analytics teams to define KPIs and build business forecasts
 Daily monitoring of dashboards to identify any performance anomalies or breakage and initiating appropriate investigation/analysis as needed
Partnering closely with the design team on web best practices, testing opportunities, and overall governance
Developing and deploying scalable initiatives including: personalization, dynamic social proof, sales assist, mobile first experiences, etc.
Driving the strategy for how to leverage information architecture, design, and messaging to present the Quickbooks suite of products as a unified ecosystem vs. collection of independent point solutions
Partnering with the search team to ensure the overall site is optimized to drive maximum organic search volume
Working with the media and integrated marketing team on developing cohesive site experiences and landing pages to support campaigns
Continually pushing for operational rigor and operational processes improvements to increase efficiency and capacity

About OpenAIOpenAI is an AI research and deployment company dedicated to ensuring that general-purpose artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity. AI is an extremely powerful tool that must be created with safety and human needs at its core. OpenAI is dedicated to putting that alignment of interests first — ahead of profit.To achieve our mission, we must encompass and value the many different perspectives, voices, and experiences that form the full spectrum of humanity. Our investment in diversity, equity, and inclusion is ongoing, executed through a wide range of initiatives, and championed and supported by leadership.At OpenAI, we believe artificial intelligence has the potential to help people solve immense global challenges, and we want the upside of AI to be widely shared. Join us in shaping the future of technology.Applications to this job posting are routed to teams across OpenAI that best match your skills and interests.About the RoleThe Research Engineer role is responsible for building AI systems that can perform previously impossible tasks or achieve unprecedented levels of performance. This requires good engineering (for example designing, implementing, and improving a massive-scale distributed machine learning system), writing bug-free machine learning code, and building the science behind the algorithms employed.The most outstanding deep learning results are increasingly attained at a massive scale, and these results require engineers who are comfortable working in large distributed systems. We expect engineering to play a key role in most major advances in AI of the future.We expect you to: Have strong programming skillsHave experience working in large distributed systemsBe excited about OpenAI’s approach to researchNice to have: Interested in and thoughtful about the impacts of AI technologyPast experience in creating high-performance implementations of deep learning algorithmsBenefits and PerksMedical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your familyMental health and wellness support401(k) plan with 4% matchingUnlimited time off and 18+ company holidays per yearPaid parental leave (20 weeks) and family-planning supportAnnual learning & development stipend ($1,500 per year)We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. This position is subject to a background check for any convictions directly related to its duties and responsibilities. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the candidate. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodations via accommodation@openai.com.Job Type: Full-time

About Vidora
Vidora is on a mission to make machine learning a reality for anyone, anywhere. We are looking for people who are curious, resilient and driven to help execute that mission. We believe that a great company should provide an environment which embraces diversity, fosters growth, and makes you excited to come to work in the morning. At Vidora, you’ll take on exciting challenges, meet new people to learn from, and most importantly… have fun!

Responsibilities

Manage a portfolio of named accounts and grow relationships with key customer stakeholders/sponsors.
Develop an understanding of customer’s business, use cases, and how they can achieve their business goals with Vidora and ML.
Serve as the primary point of contact for customers, including triage of customer tickets and resolution of technical issues.
Proactively monitor customers to ensure customer engagement and identify expansion opportunities.
Be prepared to present the Vidora platform to new and existing stakeholders, as well as convey the Vidora product roadmap.
Serve as an internal advocate for customer needs and provide feedback to the Vidora product team.
Implement customer health and engagement strategies to increase visibility into accounts and create a scalable framework.

Qualifications

Early stage startup experience.
Self-starter, self-motivated, and collaborative.
Experience in the enterprise analytics and/or data SaaS; understanding of AI/ML space.
Experience increasing customer satisfaction, adoption, and retention in the Enterprise.
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills.
Excellent relationship-building skills with internal teams, external partners, and executives.
Excellent prioritization and project management skills.

Preferred

Strong interest in analytics, AI, and data science.
Experience using big data or machine learning technology
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Economics, or other technical discipline

Location
San Francisco Bay Area preferred, and/or West Coast Remote

Benefits
Great culture, Competitive salary plus equity, Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance, 401k

Interested? Email careers@vidora.com with your resume!

CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA (Financial District/South Beach area)•Remote
Content_text:
JOB DESCRIPTION
You're an original. So are we.
We're a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.
Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we've used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi's®, Dockers®, Denizen® and Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™
At Levi Strauss & Co, we are revolutionizing the apparel business and redefining the way denim is made.
We are taking one of the world's most iconic brands into the next century:
from creating machine learning-powered denim finishes to using block-chain for our factory workers' well-being, to building algorithms to better meet the needs of our consumers and optimize our supply chain.
Be a pioneer in the fashion industry by joining our Global Talent Acquisition team as the Principal Digital Recruiter supporting our Data, Analytics & AI team. You will have the chance to impact our Global business as you attract talent and help build our Data Science and Machine Learning teams.
The Principal Tech Recruiter will manage end-to-end Recruiting for our Global Technology Team. The Levi Strauss & Co. Talent Acquisition team is made up of high-achievers who are passionate about talent. With recruiters placed throughout the US, Asia and Europe, our global team works hard to build relationships with external and internal talent. We partner with internal stakeholders to develop and meet talent strategies that are unique to each LS&Co team.
You will report directly to the Senior Director of Global Talent Acquisition. You can work remotely, although our preference is a candidate who is available to work Pacific Standard Time.
About the Job
Manage full-cycle recruiting for our Technology teams
Utilize LinkedIn Recruiter to develop sourcing strategies to attract a diverse talent pool
Partner with hiring managers to provide guidance, expertise and teamwork to hire top talent
Elevate the candidate experience by adopting our "white glove" candidate experience.
Be an evangelist for Levi Strauss & Co
About You
8+ years full-cycle recruiting experience
Must have prior experience recruiting for Engineers, DevOps and Architects
Extensive proactive sourcing experience with a focus on attracting diverse talent
Passion for the apparel/fashion/lifestyle space
Excellent communication, time management and negotiation skills
Ability to work with internal stakeholders to develop a trusted partnership
We put a lot of thought into our programs to provide you with a benefits package that matters. Whether it is for medical care, taking time off, improving your health or planning for retirement, we've got you covered. Here's a small snapshot:
401K match: $1.25 for every $1.00 you contribute up to the first 6% of pay you save.
Five hours of paid volunteer time per month with nonprofit organizations
Product discount of 60% off regular-price merchandise
EOE M/F/Disability/Vets
LOCATION
San Francisco, CA, USA
FULL TIME/PART TIME
Full time
Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

About Ironclad
Ironclad is the #1 contract lifecycle management platform for innovative companies. Every company, in every country, in every industry runs on contracts, but managing these contracts slows companies down and costs them millions of dollars. L’Oréal, Staples, Mastercard, and other leading innovators use Ironclad to collaborate and negotiate on contracts, accelerate contracting while maintaining compliance, and turn contracts into critical carriers of operational business intelligence. It’s the only platform flexible enough to handle every type of contract workflow, whether a sales agreement, an HR agreement or a complex NDA.

Ironclad’s innovation and work culture has been recognized by Forbes’ 50 Most Promising AI Companies in 2021, Fortune’s Best Small & Medium Workplaces 2021, Fast Company’s 2020 Best Workplaces for Innovators, Glassdoor’s best Machine Learning startup, Enterprise Tech 30 List, and is backed by leading investors like Accel, Y Combinator, Sequoia, and Bond. For more information, visit www.ironcladapp.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

Engineering @ Ironclad
As an Engineer at Ironclad, you'll work cross-functionally to identify business problems and architect, build, and verify solutions. You'll build a platform that lets lawyers scale themselves and their businesses 100x more effectively. At Ironclad, we’ve built a product that brings a two thousand year old profession into the digital age, and you’ll play a pivotal role in driving the foundation forward.
We seek engineers with strong coding fundamentals and a track record of shipping high quality products. We work in a highly collaborative environment, and strive to foster a positive, inclusive culture. We’re in hypergrowth, tripling our team size at all levels and offer remote work flexibility. If you’d like to join us on our mission to build the product that legal teams love, let’s talk!
What you'll do:
Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other engineers to spec, design, and build features and systems
Partner with quality engineers to define, build and maintain testing strategy
Provide thoughtful feedback to others on the team
Help interview and recruit talented engineers to Ironclad
Work on a modern stack built upon: TypeScript, ReactJS, Node.js, Java, and Docker containers in Kubernetes on Google Cloud Platform (experience with these specific technologies not required)


What we look for:
Passion for software engineering to build and ship great product
At least 3+ years of software experience architecting, building, launching and maintaining complex systems (a formal degree is not required, we are prioritizing industry experience)
A high bar for quality
Passionate about learning and sharing knowledge
Strong cross-team communication and collaboration skills
Ironclad’s Values: drive, intent, integrity, and empathy
NOTE: New College Graduates should apply HERE
Benefits & Perks:
Competitive compensation
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401k
Wellness reimbursement
Take what you need vacation policy
Generous parental leave for both primary and secondary caregivers
Work in our beautiful San Francisco office and remote work flexibility

About UsIron Ox is reimagining the modern farm, utilizing robotics and AI to grow fresh, consistent, and responsibly farmed produce for everyone. Our experienced team of growers, plant scientists, engineers, and innovators are passionate about deeply understanding and developing this new wave of technology to feed an ever-growing population.Our mission at Iron Ox is dedicated to addressing some of the most significant issues in food security, now and in the future. We’re focused on sustainable, scalable food production for a changing climate and an ever-growing population.Iron Ox is looking for a Recruiter that will build and scale for all roles at Iron Ox. You will have the opportunity to play an integral part in owning the hiring strategy to build out all functions as we expand nationwide.What You'll DoPartner with hiring managers and drive the full-cycle recruiting processManage all aspects of the recruiting process from starting a requisition to making an offerCollaborate with hiring managers to identify and formalize needs, determine diverse sourcing strategies and actively engage with candidatesEngage active and passive talent through resume screening, outbound sourcing, networking, referrals, events, etc.Build strong, diverse pipelines of quality talent for various positions across all departmentsKeep candidate experience at the forefront and leave every candidate with the best impression of Iron OxAdvise leadership as a subject matter expert for building out operation teamsPartner with the Recruiting org to build and scale processesWhat You'll Bring5+ years of experience full-cycle recruiting for all levels across multiple departmentsExperience with using creative sourcing strategies to hire a variety of rolesSelf-starter who enjoys a fast-paced collaborative environmentAdaptability and flexibility to switch gears with changing prioritiesStrong sense of urgency while being highly organizedStrong communication skills and the ability to interact with a diverse workforceWhat We OfferIron Ox is a small startup with a big dream. We Are:
Accenture’s SAP practice in the West, and we bring the New to life using design thinking, agile development methodologies, and the latest smart tech for SAP when it comes to automation and AI. We help out clients apply intelligence to set their business apart and make them more proactive, predictive and productive – the power of the intelligent enterprise. We have also announced our partnership with SAP to develop SAP’s new Responsible Production and Design solution, which will help companies consume fewer resources and build sustainability into their design processes. “We believe sustainability is going to be the next digital,” says Julie Sweet. “I’m hopeful that by 2025, we’ll be able to say every business is a sustainable business.”
Our north star and purpose as a company is to deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Ready to learn as much as you can? We put strong emphasis on training our people on S/4 HANA and all the new cloud products from SAP, both functionally and technically. You will get the chance to work in our fastest growing and most dynamic region in the west, with a wide range of top clients across all industries. Accenture’s regional focus also means you will be part of a regional domain and community, with close relationship with peers and Accenture leadership.
You Are:
A transformation maven with the skills to help clients meet the challenges of digitization. Your human superpower? Using your know-how, creativity, and analytical powers to solve clients’ most complex business problems to help their companies do more. You’re as comfortable leading projects and teams as you are diving into the details of workstreams and configuring SAP solutions. Or you specialize in one or the other, our practice covers the functional & process side of SAP as well as the technical development & technical architecture. Additionally, you have the communication and people skills to inspire teams to bring their A-game.
The Work:
Leads the E2E migration plan, develop the status/reporting structure for client, establish meeting invite/cadence, navigate financials, etc. This is specifically needed for North America SAP on Cloud programs to ensure we leverage the North America time zone.
Deliver & drive the overall project to migrate/implement Client's SAP solution on Cloud (onshore accountable for SAP Migration, SAP TechArch, Infra/Cloud).
Collaborate among towers and work closely with other vendors/partners (SAP, Microsoft, AWS, etc.).
Coordinate internally with the account leadership
Own conversations with customer/partners for cutover planning & optimizations and sign-offs.
Tracking, status & metrics reporting and project planning onshore.

Here's what you need:
Minimum of 3 years experience with SAP Program/Project Management
Minimum of 3 years experience with SAP Cloud Migration, Testing, Cutover
Minimum of 3 years experience with SAP Technical Architecture
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years work experience). If Associate’s Degree, must have equivalent minimum 6 year work experience.
Bonus points if:
Experience with SAP on Hyperscaler (Azure, AWS, GCP)

About Gap Inc.
Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials.
This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our team is made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team.
About the Role
As a part of our technology organization, you will have the opportunity to build next generation solutions that will transform the way our customers interact with our family of iconic brands. Our team employs a DevOps model, allowing our product teams to have full ownership of design, build and operate with immense scale. From distributed computing to artificial intelligence, mobile, big data and cloud computing, you will have the opportunity to build a career that allows you to make an impact all while learning new technical and leadership skills. We are inspired by new challenges and push ourselves to create what’s next in this dynamic industry. Come join this diverse team and grow with us.




The Martech & Personalization architect is a critical role accountable for the architecture of all capabilities for our multi brand, market and channel platform enabling personalized experience to our customers & campaign success.



In this role, you will be responsible for working with your Architecture, Product Management, Engineering and Technical Program Management peers to build the technology roadmap for the enterprise-wide services catering to our customer journey enabling systems.



In addition, you will institute the right processes and practices to ensure high availability of all your applications and services at scale, while contributing to your team’s technical roadmap in the Cloud.
What You'll Do
Integrate technology products and solutions with existing eCommerce, Stores, and Supply Chain technologies leveraging enterprise integration patterns.
Represent the analytics & personalization practice and the importance of data to a business’ success.
Design and oversee solutions that provide frameworks, interfaces, and services that can be extended and reused across the portfolio
Implementing & maintaining Adobe Analytics, Optimizely, Tealium IQ, Tealium Audience Stream, LiveRamp, Channel Advisor, Coherent Path, Social Marketing Channels (Facebook, Instagram etc.)
Co-create and execute Segmentation Strategy
Implement & provide guidelines for A/B & MVT tests
Work with marketing team to ensure end-to-end tracking of campaigns
Auditing program and measurement strategy leading to KPI / KBR definition
Partner with quality assurance to ensure data integrity
Assist in connecting data flow into CDPs and support activation out of those sources
Working with the marketing team to ensure the site is in GDPR / CCPA compliance
Work with technical team to streamline integrations with both internal and external partners
Document architecture and technologies according to Gap standards
Who You Are
Benefits at Gap Inc.
Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*
Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*
Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*
Employee stock purchase plan.*
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*
See more of the benefits we offer.
For eligible employees
Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Humans Rights Campaign for the fourteenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2019 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the second year in a row.

Hive is the leading provider of cloud-based enterprise AI solutions to power the next wave of intelligent automation. We offer a portfolio of best-in-class deep learning models, built with consensus-validated training data sourced and annotated by our distributed workforce of more than 2 million contributors globally. Hive's APIs enable use cases including automated content moderation, contextual advertising, advertising and sponsorship measurement, document parsing, and more. We process billions of API requests per month for many of the world's largest and most innovative companies.
Hive has raised over $120M in capital from leading investors, including General Catalyst, 8VC, Glynn Capital, Jericho Capital, Bain & Company, Visa Ventures, and others. We have over 170 employees globally in our San Francisco and Delhi offices. Please reach out if you are interested in joining the future of AI!
Machine Learning Role
In order to execute our vision, we need to grow our team of best-in-class machine learning engineers. We are looking for developers who are excited about staying at the forefront of deep learning technology, prototyping state-of-the-art neural net models and launching these models into production. We value hard workers who have no qualms working with terabyte-scale datasets, who are interested in learning new technologies at all levels of the machine learning stack, and who move fast and take ownership of their projects. Our ideal candidate has experience creating a working machine learning-powered project from the ground up, contributes innovative ideas and ingenious implementations to the team, and is capable of planning out scalable, maintainable data pipelines.
Responsibilities
Everything involved in applying a ML model to a production use case, including, designing and coding up the neural network, gathering and refining data, training and tuning the model, deploying it at scale with high throughput and uptime, and analyzing the results in the wild in order to continuously update and improve accuracy and speed
Interface closely with the Backend and DevOps teams as well as with our internal data labeling services
Requirements
You have an undergraduate or graduate degree in computer science or similar technical field, with significant coursework in mathematics or statistics
You have 1-2 years industry machine learning experience
You have successfully trained and deployed a deep learning machine model (image, NLP, video, or audio) into production, with measurably improved performance over baseline, either in industry or as a personal project
You have strong experience with a high-level machine learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, Caffe, or Torch, and familiarity with the others
You know the ins and outs of Python, especially as it applies to the above ML frameworks
You are capable of quickly coding and prototyping data pipelines involving any combination of Python, Node, bash, and linux command-line tools, especially when applied to large datasets consisting of millions of files
You have a working knowledge of the following technologies, or are not afraid of picking it up on the fly: C++, Scala/Spark, SQL, Cassandra, Docker
You are up-to-date on the latest deep neural net research and architectures, both in understanding the theory and motivations behind the techniques, as well as how to implement them in the ML framework of your choice
You have great communication skills and ability to work with others
You are a strong team player, with a do-whatever-it-takes attitude
Who We Are
We are a group of ambitious individuals who are passionate about creating a revolutionary AI company. At Hive, you will have a steep learning curve and an opportunity to contribute to one of the fastest growing AI start-ups in San Francisco. The work you do here will have a noticeable and direct impact on the development of the company.

Thank you for your interest in Hive and we hope to meet you soon!

At Shipt, we are transforming the grocery shopping experience and giving time back to consumers. Shipt shoppers handpick fresh groceries and household essentials, then deliver them to your door in as little as one hour.
Almost every user interacts with Search to find and buy products. However, each miss can result in someone not adding a product to their basket and potentially walking away from using Shipt all together.
We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to lead optimization of our Search & Recommendations systems. You will be responsible for working with Data Science, Engineering, and Design to develop a roadmap for solving problems like:
Search Intent - When a user searches for “DiGiorno's pizza”, how might we fix any misspellings? What is a brand? What is the category? How can we show a result set that is 100% relevant to what the user’s intent is? What happens when we don’t understand the user’s intent?
Results Ranking - How might we put products that we know users want to buy at the top of the page? How do we know when we’ve done a good job?
Recommendations - What products are similar to what I’m looking for? What are products that I might buy alongside the product I’m interested in? How can we predict & show the next item that you’re going to buy?
Personalization - How might we make our search results or substitution recommendations relevant based on what matters to a user? How might we provide relevant results to someone with specific dietary preferences?
Universal search - How might we facilitate product searches across multiple stores?
In this role you will also interact very closely with the product catalog and product availability teams to diagnose whether customer issues are due to our search systems or whether they are related to our product catalog.
Your Responsibilities

Effectively prioritize and execute against your backlog
Develop cross-team product roadmaps, and educate both internal and external (as applicable) stakeholders to drive implementation, measurement, and optimization
Prove product and strategic initiative efficacy with sound measurement practices to evaluate success of features & drive business results
Partner with Product, UX, Engineering, Data Science and business partners to formulate features, identify dependencies, influence decision making, and drive prioritization

Requirements/Qualifications:
3+ years of product management experience working in an agile approach with cross-functional teams
Hands-on experience articulating requirements/stories & acceptance criteria, participating in agile ceremonies, delivering & measuring/hindsighting features
Experience driving product vision, go-to-market strategy, and design discussions
Experience with search, AI, ML preferred
Ability to influence multiple stakeholders without direct authority preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

About OpenAIOpenAI is an AI research and deployment company dedicated to ensuring that general-purpose artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity. AI is an extremely powerful tool that must be created with safety and human needs at its core. OpenAI is dedicated to putting that alignment of interests first — ahead of profit.To achieve our mission, we must encompass and value the many different perspectives, voices, and experiences that form the full spectrum of humanity. Our investment in diversity, equity, and inclusion is ongoing, executed through a wide range of initiatives, and championed and supported by leadership.At OpenAI, we believe artificial intelligence has the potential to help people solve immense global challenges, and we want the upside of AI to be widely shared. Join us in shaping the future of technology.About the TeamSecurity is at the foundation of OpenAI's mission. OpenAI is pushing artificial intelligence to unprecedented scale. We have a large cloud footprint and run some of the biggest Kubernetes clusters in the world. The OpenAI API makes leading AI technology available to developers via a simple HTTPS call. In connection to its mission to deploy safe and responsible AI, OpenAI has a duty to protect its data.The Security team secures OpenAI's technology, people, and products. We are technical in what we build but are operational in how we do our work, and are committed to supporting all products and research at OpenAI. Our Security team tenets include: prioritizing for impact, enabling researchers, preparing for future transformative technologies, and engaging a robust security culture.About the RoleAs a Technical Program Manager on the Security team, you will help scale the security and IT programs at OpenAI. You will work alongside a diverse team of engineers, developers, and security advisers to coordinate, drive, measure security improvements across OpenAI. We are a small company, and intend to stay small: as an early member of the information security team, the decisions you make today will have significant impact on the organization today and into the future.We're looking for a candidate who thrives cross-functionally, can handle complexity, and who is motivated to help a small team be greater than the sum of its parts.In this role, you will:Manage and scale large security and IT programs across OpenAI while working closely with partners in research and engineering.Work with security engineers and our partners to capture requirements and ensure execution on security initiatives.Coordinate our privacy and compliance programs for OpenAI's product, sales, and research initiatives.Drive operational maturity by implementing processes and metrics where they can provide the most value.Help plan OpenAI Security's strategic impact by contributing to quarterly and long-term planning.You may thrive in this role if you have:3+ years of experience as an engineer, TPM, product manager, or related role.An eye for optimization, and an inclination to use metrics to drive outcomes.Ability to empathize and collaborate with colleagues, independently manage and run projects, and prioritize efforts for risk reduction.Strong organizational skills, a track record of excelling cross-functionally, and the ability to handle multiple initiatives at once.Exposure to security program fundamentals including vulnerability management, privacy, compliance frameworks, and operations.Experience with public cloud providers (e.g. Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure) and modern software development practices.Benefits and PerksMedical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your familyMental health and wellness support401(k) plan with 4% matchingUnlimited time off and 18+ company holidays per yearPaid parental leave (20 weeks) and family-planning supportAnnual learning & development stipend ($1,500 per year)We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. This position is subject to a background check for any convictions directly related to its duties and responsibilities. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the candidate. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodations via accommodation@openai.com.Job Type: Full-time

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
The challenge
The Digital Strategy Group (DSG) works with C-level leadership at Adobe’s Enterprise customers to craft strategies for customer-experience transformation and digital innovation. Our engagements employ Adobe’s digital benchmarking capabilities, industry trends, customer-journey mapping, organizational assessments, high-level architecture assessments and other techniques to deliver high-impact recommendations. We also bring a deep industry perspective to the organization, delivering vision, published thought leadership, and aligning the ecosystem on an overall industry go-to-market strategy.
What you’ll do
The FSI (financial services & insurance) Digital Strategy Associate, you will take part in multiple strategy engagements (typically 2 to 6 weeks each) for senior customers. For each engagement, you will be part of a robust team that is passionate about developing insights and recommendations! We seek candidates who can contribute in one or more of the following areas:
Experience design — run ethnographic interviews and journey diagnostics to understand customers’ unmet needs. Build brand-new web and mobile app experiences that delight our customers’ customers and improve performance. Use Adobe XD in hands on workshops to rapidly prototype and test new designs.
Analytics and benchmarking — use Adobe’s unparalleled analytics dataset to show customers how their digital business compares within industry. Reveal insights from their own reports and the corresponding actions to optimize performance and customer experience.
Economic impact analysis — assess how improvements to customer journey and business capabilities will grow revenues, reduce costs, and generate business value. Size potential opportunities to prioritize short- & long-term recommendations. Help customers write business cases to quantify value and rationalize technology investments.
Experience architecture — assess customers’ technology landscape and data strategy to understand current implementation and usage. Recommend new solutions, integrations, and use cases to enable improved customer experiences.
You will also contribute industry leadership in the following ways:
Industry perspective – collaborate to define Adobe’s perspective on impactful industry experiences by working with deep subject matter specialists. Apply that perspective by authoring thought leadership assets to drive demand generation, field enablement, etc. Be the voice of the industry within Adobe to inform product strategy.
Industry & partner strategy – collaborate on Adobe’s strategy to deepen its customer footprint in core industries. Align the Adobe internal and partner ecosystem on the industry strategy and coordinate go-to-market efforts across functions.
This role offers rich opportunities to develop as a customer leader and business leader! You will learn the Cloud business and develop your network as you collaborate with people across Adobe, including from Sales, Marketing, Product, and Professional Services. You will have opportunities to rotate across DSG industry teams to deepen your subject matter expertise as you execute strategy engagements and contribute to industry leadership. You will also engage with Center of Excellence teams that drive core tools and capabilities that fuel DSG engagements, such as experience design and value.
What you need to succeed
Pursuit of an MBA or equivalent advanced degree
Outstanding record of academic achievement
Demonstrated passion for digital experiences and/or cloud technology
Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills, including conducting research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work effectively with people at all levels
Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively verbally and in writing
High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to absorb concepts quickly
Willingness to travel up to 30% (actual amount may be less)
Desirable but not essential
Work or internship experience in a leading technology company, strategy consulting organization, digital agency, or marketing department
Experience in UX/UI design, user research and design-thinking methodologies
Experience creating digital/brand/media strategies along with a practical understanding of the technologies and tactics necessary for execution
Knowledge of one of the following industry groups: Retail, Travel & Hospitality, Media & Entertainment, Financial Services, Healthcare, High Tech, Manufacturing, Auto, Public Sector
Experience with the following languages and concepts: AI, web services and APIs, HTML, JavaScript, Java, relational databases, SQL scripting
When you join Adobe, you can look forward to collaborating with the most genuine people in the industry, working on projects with real purpose, and having immense pride in the products we build and the customers we support. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire hardworking individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, cultural background or religious beliefs. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here.

Hive is the leading provider of cloud-based enterprise AI solutions to power the next wave of intelligent automation. We offer a portfolio of best-in-class deep learning models, built with consensus-validated training data sourced and annotated by our distributed workforce of more than 2 million contributors globally. Hive's APIs enable use cases including automated content moderation, contextual advertising, advertising and sponsorship measurement, document parsing, and more. We process billions of API requests per month for many of the world's largest and most innovative companies.
Hive has raised over $120M in capital from leading investors, including General Catalyst, 8VC, Glynn Capital, Jericho Capital, Bain & Company, Visa Ventures, and others. We have over 170 employees globally in our San Francisco and Delhi offices. Please reach out if you are interested in joining the future of AI!
Business Operations Manager Role
Hive is looking for a strong leader to provide direction, insight, and strategy across the board. As a business operations manager at Hive, you will work closely with our executive team to provide support in a variety of key activities, including improvement of key processes, implementation of systems and structure, development of company and team productivity metrics, and project management and execution of client projects. Our ideal candidate has strong generalist skills and a proven background of leadership. They are able to step into any role and help out with any project as needed. A passion for startups and AI is a must.
Responsibilities
Manage our bus ops activities by setting achievable short-term and long-term goals
Implement effective reporting and productivity goals for company teams, ensuring metrics are useful, visible, and streamlined
Plan, manage, coordinate, and execute client projects flawlessly through collaboration with business and engineering team members
Actively look for ways to improve upon and optimize existing procedures, systems, and processes
Act as a generalist in getting anything and everything done to help the company grow; anticipate challenges, react promptly and calmly to necessary changes, and ease our growing pains
Requirements
You have a Bachelor’s degree
You have 3-5 years of work experience at a top consulting or banking organization
You have a strong history of leadership; you take initiative and manage others in a way that promotes growth and efficiency
You have client-facing experience and a proven ability to engage with customers when necessary
You are highly organized and detail-oriented; you can handle multiple projects and dynamic priorities without missing a beat
You are energetic, resourceful, and driven, and have the ownership to thrive in an unstructured environment
Who We Are
We are a group of ambitious individuals who are passionate about creating a revolutionary AI company. At Hive, you will have a steep learning curve and an opportunity to contribute to one of the fastest growing AI start-ups in San Francisco. The work you do here will have a noticeable and direct impact on the development of the company.
Thank you for your interest in Hive and we hope to meet you soon!

CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA (Financial District/South Beach area)
Content_text:
Responsible for implementing various algorithms to do automated feature extraction and dataset augmentation, optimizing runtimes of neural network algorithms and building higher-level abstractions for various common AI/ML techniques. As an ML engineer, they will also work cross functionally amongst other engineers, on common ML operation tasks such as ML data management and training and model deployment, as well as build systems that are scalable.
Candidates will need to have a BS in computer science from an accredited university. In addition, we’re looking for engineers who have the following:
Working knowledge of software engineering - through job experience or coursework. Experience with Python preferred
Have at least 6 months of professional work experience in one of the following: ML/AI models in production, neural network algorithms, performance optimization of deep learning systems.
Coursework or work experience with machine learning algorithms such as classifiers, anomaly detection, and clustering

JITX is a way to design circuit boards faster, better, and with fewer errors. Instead of manually drafting and reviewing one-off designs, write code to generate designs programmatically. Our AI-powered solvers handle the low-level details, and make your engineering work massively reusable. Our vision at JITX is to automate hardware design for the benefit of science and the welfare of humanity. JITX is a team that is building next generation software to help companies design better electronics. Dedicated to solving difficult problems with huge impact, our first step is to automate circuit board design.

This role is responsible for breaking down, formulating, and designing an algorithmic strategy for tackling JITX's most challenging problems. You will work directly with an algorithm implementation engineer and domain expert to attack open problems in circuit board design automation, and together invent the world's first fully automated design flow. You will not need electronics experience, but will need a creative mind, and revel in formulating and solving tough problems.- You should be comfortable with or eager to learn the algorithmic building blocks: sorting, caching, canonical forms, dynamic programming, gradient descent, cost functions, branch and bound, constraint satisfaction, constraint solving, dynamic programming, breath-first traversal, depth-first traversal, A* search, linear programming, etc.
You will need to communicate clearly and be able to both share your own expertise and learn from others.You will need to formulate, break down, design, and prove correctness for your algorithm, and communicate its properties to performance engineers.Education: PhD, MS, or BS in Computational Geometry, Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics or comparable education.

POST-COVID WORK PLAN
This role will need to be local within the California Bay Area. JITX will continue to be flexible in the Post- Covid Work Plan but this role will be asked to join certain team members on a weekly basis in a South Bay Satellite Office and likely once (or twice) a month in our Berkeley office.
In order to provide our employees with a safe working environment, our company is requiring that all employees be fully vaccinated and safely outside of the 2-week post vaccination window before working onsite, unless they have been approved medical or religious exemption. If hired, you will be required to self certify and likely show proof of vaccination (or exemption) upon the start of your employment with us.
At JITX, we celebrate and support differences. We are learning everyday by drawing on our differences in who we are, what we've experienced, and how we think to make JITX thrive. JITX is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

Product Manager, Hive Models Role
As a Product Manager on our Hive Models team, you will work cross-functionally with all stakeholders to define product requirements and see the implementation through to completion, leading development efforts between our Machine Learning, Core Infrastructure, and Product teams. You will play a crucial role in the core of our business: our cloud-hosted deep learning models. You are both the foundation and the catalyst for Hive’s growth; you are a key reference for our existing clients and are relentless in delivering on our innovative capabilities.
Responsibilities
Own the roadmap, functional requirements, and development timeline for our Hive Models
Gain deep understanding of our customers’ needs across various industries
Oversee product execution from inception to delivery
Help engineering and product teams estimate and decompose complex projects into manageable parts with delivery plans, and track progress against those plans
Own our Hive Models portfolio, understanding the needs of the product development teams, and envisioning and executing the creation of our deep learning models that can provide human-like interpretation of video, image, audio and text
Clearly communicate product benefits to our users and internal stakeholders
Work with the executive team to determine top priorities, help define new features, and improve models habitually
Measure engineering velocity, and help identify and establish new best practices to improve the speed at which projects are delivered


Requirements
You have a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or similar field
You have hands-on experience with modern machine learning libraries, frameworks, and technologies
You have excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills
You have a working knowledge of functional programming languages such as Python or Node.JS
You have 2-3 years of combined Machine Learning and Product Management experience
You are comfortable with — and can thrive in — an environment that is constantly changing, frequently uncertain, and at times chaotic
You are detail-oriented, organized, collaborative, and hands-on
You have experience leading a team, and effectively implementing team goals and deadlines
Beyond just shipping new products, you obsess about continuous product improvement

Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow.
At Allianz Global Investors our people enjoy motivating, fulfilling careers. If you are looking for a fast-paced working environment, you are resolved to cultivate and expand your talents and relish a challenge, then join us now! We are committed to giving our people – experienced and energetic professionals alike – the opportunities and experiences they seek to thrive and gain personal fulfilment. We are looking for you! Allianz Global Investors is currently seeking an Associate to join our Global Artificial Intelligence Investment Team covering a variety of strategies including AI, Cloud, Thematic, and Multi-Asset. In this role, you will play an integral role with the team in all aspects of the investment process and assist with the active management of several strategies. The Associate can expect to have meaningful interaction with senior professionals both internally and externally with management teams. The role is based in our San Francisco office, and will consider those outside of the Bay Area with willingness to relocate.

Responsibilities:
Generate new investment ideas primarily focused on the technology sector.
Conduct due diligence for potential investments including modelling, interacting with senior management
and customers/partners.
Support the management of existing portfolios including daily trading & monitoring, monthly reporting and commentary, fundamental research & financial modeling, and marketing & client support.
Maintain and enhance presentations, whitepapers and marketing collateral related to our thematic innovation strategies.
Active participation in company and sell side analyst meetings, industry conferences, portfolio company discussions and decisions.
Strong interest in technological innovation and the ramifications for public equities/private companies.

Key Requirements/Skills/Experience
BA / BS degree required
Degree major - Economics, or Finance; would also consider Computer Science majors interested in Investment Management
2-4 years of investment related work experience; Prior experience in equity research, consulting or investment banking a plus
Exceptional writing and verbal communication skills; Strong data management and research skills
A passion for the markets & innovation
Ability to learn quickly & thrive in a fast pace environment
About Allianz Global Investors
Allianz Global Investors is a leading active asset manager with over 690 investment professionals in 23 offices worldwide and managing EUR 633 billion in assets for individuals, families, and institutions.
Active is the most important word in our vocabulary. We believe in solving, not selling, adding value beyond pure economic gain. The AWS early stage startup team works directly with many of the top startups in the world. You will spend your days working with early stage startup founders and navigating across AWS and Amazon to enable startups to realize outsized success. The team is comprised of a rare group of high-caliber former founders and startup operators, working within Amazon to drive AWS strategy and support the next generation of entrepreneurs.

You might never have thought of working at AWS – but this is a unique role to work for one of the fastest growing startups of all time (AWS, believe it or not) while being plugged into the center of the startup ecosystem. We’re seeking team members who have founded companies, and who get excited about working with and mentoring early stage startup founders day-in and day-out.

If this role sounds interesting, read on:
Candidates must have a background as a startup founder or investor, where they’ve built a business, raised capital, and experienced the arc of business-building from nothing to something.

Candidates will possess both a business and technical background – a business background to enable the candidate to drive engagement with leading startup accelerators, and technical exposure to enable the candidate to easily interact with startup founders, engineers, and builders.

Top candidates will have worked in a structured and rigorous environment, whether in a corporate culture (e.g., Amazon, Google, Facebook), later-stage startup environment (e.g., reporting to a Board of Directors), investment banking, and/or consulting. The candidate must have demonstrated the ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, convey compelling data-driven decisions, and work collaboratively to build consensus.

A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must, as is the ability to leverage and motivate Amazon and AWS’s global organization to achieve results:

Role & Responsibilities:

Serve as a key member of the Business Development team in helping drive overall AWS market and technical strategy.
Work closely with startup organizations and portfolio companies to ensure they are successful using the AWS platform, by providing technical resources and business mentorship.
Execute strategic initiatives for AWS, while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g., sales teams, partners, marketing, support, etc.).
Understand and actively utilize salesforce.com and other internal Amazon systems, to manage reporting, tracking, and goal attainment for the early stage startup team.
Build new programs to support early stage startups, on behalf of AWS and Amazon.
Prepare and deliver data-driven reviews to senior management about progress, achievements, and roadblocks in the early stage startup business.
Serve as the primary eyes and ears for AWS and Amazon to the startup community.
Handle a high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market.
Some relevant technical knowledge required, such as: fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, storage systems, database systems, core distributed computing concepts, content delivery networks (CDNs), artificial intelligence / machine learning, etc., with ability to go deep enough on technical aspects to differentiate between AWS services.

Some travel required.


Experience as a startup founder or investor
Knowledge of and familiarity within the startup ecosystem
Advanced experience with data focused tools
MBA or graduate degree
